Fearful of knowing the worst , [he]19-stephen lingered about [the office]1621-the office until [all the other workmen]1622-all the other workmen had been in and come out again jingling [their]1622-all the other workmen wages . But [the master]179-the master and [[his]179-the master brother]1521-his brother [Thomas]36-mr. wyley had been taking counsel together about the matter . [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley was for turning [the boy]1434-the boy off at once , and reducing [him]1434-the boy to the utmost straits of poverty ; but [[his]179-the master more prudent brother]1626-his more prudent brother was opposed to this plan . '[40-spirits] Look here , [brother James]37-james wyley , ' [he]179-the master said ; '[40-spirits] if [we]369-we drive [the young scamp]370-the young scamp to desperation , there 's no telling what [he]370-the young scamp will do . Ten to one if [he]370-the young scamp does not go and tell a string of lies to [some of [the farmers]372-the farmers about [here]146-here , or perhaps to [the parson at [Longville]10-longville]374-the parson at longville]371-some of the farmers about here , or perhaps to the parson at longville , and [they]371-some of the farmers about here , or perhaps to the parson at longville may make an unpleasant disturbance . [Nobody]147-nobody knows and [nobody]147-nobody cares about [him]370-the young scamp as it is ; but [he]370-the young scamp is [a determined young fellow]377-a determined young fellow , or [I]0-i 'm mistaken . Better keep [him]370-the young scamp at work under [your]0-i own eye , and make [the place]177-the place too hot for [him]370-the young scamp by degrees . Before long [you]0-i will catch [him]370-the young scamp poaching with [his]370-the young scamp dog , and if [he]370-the young scamp is let off for a time or two because of [his]370-the young scamp youth , and goes at it again , [we]1628-we can make out a pretty case of juvenile depravity , without any character from [[his]370-the young scamp employer]1629-his employer , [you]0-i know ; and so [he]370-the young scamp will be sent out of the way , and boarded at the expense of [the country]1361-the country for a few years or so . '[377-a determined young fellow] ' Well , '[179-the master] said [the master]179-the master , ' [I]179-the master 'll try [him]370-the young scamp once again . If [he]370-the young scamp 'd go out quietly , [nobody else]1631-nobody else has any claim upon [the cottage]1314-the cottage ; and [I]179-the master want to set to work [there]1463-there quickly . '[179-the master] So when [Stephen]19-stephen entered [the office]1621-the office with trembling limbs and a very pale face under its dusky covering , it happened that [he]19-stephen met with a very different reception to what [he]19-stephen expected . [The master]179-the master sat behind a small counter , upon which lay [Stephen]19-stephen 's twelve shillings , the only little heap of money left ; and as [he]19-stephen gathered them nervously into [his]19-stephen hand , [he]19-stephen wondered if this would be the last time . But [[his]19-stephen master]190-his master 's face was not more threatening than usual ; and [he]19-stephen muttered [his]19-stephen ' Thank [you]190-his master , [sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] and was turning away with a feeling of great relief , when [Mr. Wyley]37-james wyley 's harsh voice brought [him]19-stephen back again , trembling more than ever . ' Have [you]19-stephen thought any more of [my]190-his master offer , [Fern]19-stephen ? '[190-his master] [he]190-his master asked . ' [I]190-his master should n't mind , as [you]19-stephen are [an orphan]1635-an orphan , and have [two sisters]1636-two sisters depending upon [you]19-stephen , if [I]190-his master made the ten pounds into fifteen ; and [you]19-stephen may leave the money at interest with [me]190-his master till [you]19-stephen are older . '[190-his master] ' And [I]36-mr. wyley 've been thinking , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[36-mr. wyley] added [Thomas Wyley]36-mr. wyley , who sat at a high desk checking the accounts , ' that , as [you]19-stephen seem set against being separated , instead of taking [[your]19-stephen grandfather]256-your grandfather into [the House]1347-the house , [I]36-mr. wyley 'd get [him]256-your grandfather two shillings a week allowed [him]256-your grandfather out of [it]1347-the house ; and that would pay the rent of [a nice two - roomed cottage down in [Botfield]23-botfield , close to [your]19-stephen work]1639-a nice two - roomed cottage down in botfield , close to your work . Come , that would make all of [you]19-stephen comfortable . '[36-mr. wyley] ' [You]19-stephen should bear in mind , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[179-the master] said [the master]179-the master , ' that [the place]177-the place does not of right belong to [you]19-stephen at all ; and [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor is coming to shoot over [the estate]1642-the estate in September ; and then [I]179-the master shall have orders to remove [you]19-stephen by force . So [you]19-stephen had better take [our]1643-our offer . '[179-the master] ' Please , [sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , bowing respectfully , ' do n't be angered with [me]19-stephen , but [I]19-stephen ca n't go from what [I]19-stephen said afore . [Father]28-father told [me]19-stephen never to give up [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow ; and maybe [he]28-father 'd hear tell of it in heaven if [I]19-stephen broke [my]19-stephen word to [him]28-father . [I]19-stephen ca n't do it , [sir]264-sir . '[19-stephen] ' Well , [wilful]41-wilful will have [his]28-father way , '[36-mr. wyley] said [Mr. Thomas]36-mr. wyley , nodding at [the master]179-the master ; and as [neither of [them]385-them]384-neither of them addressed [Stephen]19-stephen again , [he]19-stephen left [the office]1621-the office , amazed to find that [he]19-stephen was not forbidden to return to work on the following Monday . [The Red Gravel Pit]364-the red gravel pit , where [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had promised to meet [[her]21-miss anne scholars]388-her scholars on Sunday morning , was a quarry cut out of the side of [one of [the hills]82-the hills]389-one of the hills , from which the stones were taken for making and mending [the roads in [the neighbourhood]246-the neighbourhood]391-the roads in the neighbourhood . [The quarry]393-the quarry had been hollowed out into a kind of enclosed circle , only entered by [the road through which [the waggons]395-the waggons passed]394-the road through which the waggons passed . All along [the edge of [the red rocks]397-the red rocks]396-the edge of the red rocks high overhead there was a coppice of green hazel - bushes and young oaks , where [the boys]219-the boys had spent many a Sunday searching for wild nuts , and hunting the squirrels from tree to tree . [Stephen]19-stephen and [Tim]33-tim met half an hour earlier than the time appointed by [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and by dint of great perseverance and strength rolled together five large stones , under the shadow of an oak tree ; and placed four of them in a row before the largest one , as [Tim]33-tim had once seen [the children]399-the children sitting in [the village school at [Longville]10-longville]400-the village school at longville , when [he]33-tim had taken a donkey - load of coals for [the schoolmaster]401-the schoolmaster . [Martha]22-martha came in good time with [little Nan]21-miss anne , both in [their]402-their new black bonnets and clean cotton shawls ; and [all]349-all were seated orderly in a row when [Miss Anne]21-miss anne entered [the Red Gravel Pit]364-the red gravel pit by [the waggon road]405-the waggon road . [I]0-i need not describe to [you]406-you how [Miss Anne]21-miss anne heard [Stephen]19-stephen read [his]19-stephen chapter , and taught [Tim]33-tim and [Martha]22-martha , and even [little Nan]21-miss anne [herself]21-miss anne , the first few letters of the alphabet ; after which [she]21-miss anne made [them]349-all all repeat a verse of a hymn , and , when [they]349-all could say it correctly , sang it with [them]349-all over and over again , in [her]21-miss anne sweet and clear voice , until [Stephen]19-stephen felt almost choked with a sob of pure gladness , that would every now and then rise to [his]19-stephen lips . [Tim]33-tim sang loudly and lustily , getting out of tune very often . But [little Nan]21-miss anne was [a marvel to hear]407-a marvel to hear , so soft and sweet were [her]21-miss anne childish tones , so that [Miss Anne]21-miss anne bade [her]21-miss anne sing the verse alone , which [she]21-miss anne did perfectly . [Martha]22-martha , too , was full of admiration of [the lady]1588-the lady 's lilac silk dress and the white ribbon on [her]22-martha bonnet . That was the first of many pleasant Sunday mornings in [the Red Gravel Pit]364-the red gravel pit . When the novelty was worn away , [Martha]22-martha discovered that [she]22-martha had too much to do at [home]125-home to be able to leave it so early in the day ; and [Tim]33-tim sometimes overslept [himself]33-tim on a Sunday , when most of [[his]33-tim comrades]411-his comrades spent the whole morning in bed . But [Stephen]19-stephen and [little Nan]21-miss anne were always there , and [[their]412-their teacher]413-their teacher never failed to meet [them]412-their . Nor did [Miss Anne]21-miss anne confine [her]21-miss anne care of [the orphan children]414-the orphan children to a Sunday morning only . Sometimes [she]21-miss anne would mount [the hill]1336-the hill during the long summer evenings , and pay [[their]412-their little household]416-their little household a visit , giving [Martha]22-martha many quiet hints about [her]22-martha management and [her]22-martha outlay of [Stephen]19-stephen 's wages ; hints which [Martha]22-martha did not always receive as graciously as [they]412-their were given . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne would read also to [the blind old grandfather]417-the blind old grandfather , choosing very simple and easy portions of the Bible , especially about the lost sheep being found , as that pleased [the old shepherd]418-the old shepherd , and [he]417-the blind old grandfather could fully understand its meaning . In general , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne was very cheerful , and [she]21-miss anne would laugh merrily at times ; but now and then [her]21-miss anne face looked pale and sad , and [her]21-miss anne voice was very mournful while [she]21-miss anne talked and sang with [them]414-the orphan children . Once , even , when [she]21-miss anne bade [Stephen]19-stephen ' good evening , '[21-miss anne] an exceedingly sorrowful expression passed across [her]21-miss anne face , and [she]21-miss anne said to [him]19-stephen , ' [I]21-miss anne find it quite as hard work to serve [God]26-god really and truly as [you]19-stephen do , [Stephen]19-stephen . There is only [one Helper for both of [us]1647-us]1646-one helper for both of us ; and [we]1647-us can only do all things through [Christ]39-christ which strengtheneth [us]1647-us . '[21-miss anne] But [Stephen]19-stephen could not believe that good , [gentle Miss Anne]21-miss anne found it as hard to be [a Christian]419-a christian as [he]19-stephen did . Everything seemed against [him]19-stephen at the works . The short indulgence from hard words and hard blows granted [him]19-stephen after [[his]19-stephen father]1392-his father 's death was followed by what appeared to be a very tempest of oppression . It was very soon understood that [the master]179-the master had a private grudge against [the boy]1434-the boy ; and though [the workpeople]423-the workpeople were ground down and wronged in a hundred ways by [him]19-stephen , so as to fill [them]423-the workpeople with hatred and revenge , [they]423-the workpeople were not the less willing to take advantage of [his]19-stephen spite against [Stephen]19-stephen . [His]19-stephen work underground , which had always been distasteful to [him]19-stephen compared with [a shepherd]424-a shepherd 's life on [the hills]82-the hills , was now made more toilsome and dangerous than ever , while [Black Thompson]31-black thompson followed [him]19-stephen everywhere and all day long with oaths and blows . [Stephen]19-stephen 's evident superiority over [the other boys]426-the other boys was of course very much against [him]19-stephen ; for [he]19-stephen had never been much associated with [them]426-the other boys , as [[his]19-stephen distant home]427-his distant home had separated [him]19-stephen from [them]426-the other boys excepting during the busy hours of labour . Now , when , through [his]19-stephen own self - satisfaction and [Tim]33-tim 's loud praises , [his]19-stephen accomplishments became known , it is no wonder that a storm of envy and jealousy raged round [him]19-stephen ; for not only [the boys]219-the boys [themselves]219-the boys , but [[their]219-the boys fathers]209-their fathers also , felt affronted at [his]19-stephen wonderful scholarship . To be sure , [Tim]33-tim never deserted [him]19-stephen , and [his]19-stephen partisanship was especially useful on the bank , before [he]19-stephen went down and after [he]19-stephen came up from the pit . But below , in the dark , dismal passages of [the pit]1478-the pit , many a stripe , unmerited , fell upon [his]19-stephen bruised shoulders , which [he]19-stephen learned to bear the more patiently after [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had taught and explained to [him]19-stephen the verse , ' But [He]19-stephen was wounded for [our]1648-our transgressions , [He]19-stephen was bruised for [our]1648-our iniquities ; the chastisement of [our]1648-our peace was upon [Him]19-stephen ; and with [His]19-stephen stripes [we]1648-our are healed . '[21-miss anne] Still [Stephen]19-stephen , feeling how hard it was to continue in the right way , and knowing how often [he]19-stephen failed , to [his]19-stephen own sore mortification and the rude triumph of [[his]19-stephen comrades]411-his comrades , wondered exceedingly how it was possible for [Miss Anne]21-miss anne to find it as hard to be [a follower of [Christ]39-christ]432-a follower of christ as [he]19-stephen did . The middle weeks of August were come — sunny , sultry weeks ; and from [the brow of [the hill]1336-the hill]1335-the brow of the hill , all [the vast plain lying westward for many miles]435-the vast plain lying westward for many miles looked golden with the corn ripening for harvest . The oats in [the little field]436-the little field had already been reaped ; and the fruit in [the garden]1350-the garden , gathered and sold by [Martha]22-martha , had brought in a few shillings , which were carefully hoarded up to buy winter clothing . It was now the time of the yearly gathering of bilberries on [the hills]82-the hills ; and [tribes of [women]440-women and [children]1322-children]439-tribes of women and children ascended to the tableland from [all [the villages]443-the villages round]442-all the villages round . It was the pleasantest work of the year ; and [Martha]22-martha , who had never missed the bilberry season since [she]22-martha could remember , was not likely to miss it now . Even [little Nan]21-miss anne could help to pick the berries , and [she]21-miss anne and [Martha]22-martha were out on [the hillsides]444-the hillsides all the livelong summer day . [[Their]445-their dwelling on [the spot]447-the spot]446-their dwelling on the spot gave [them]445-their a good advantage over [those who lived down in [Botfield]23-botfield]448-those who lived down in botfield ; and each day , before any of [the others]449-the others could reach the best bilberry - wires , [they]445-their had already picked a quart of the small purple berries , fresh and cool with the dew of the morning . Only [the poor old grandfather]1465-the poor old grandfather had to be left at [home]125-home alone , with [his]1465-the poor old grandfather dinner put ready for [him]1465-the poor old grandfather , which [he]1465-the poor old grandfather was apt to eat up long before the proper dinner - hour came ; and then [he]1465-the poor old grandfather had to wait until [Stephen]19-stephen returned from [his]19-stephen work , or [Martha]22-martha and [little Nan]21-miss anne were driven [home]125-home by the August thunderstorms . [Martha]22-martha was wonderfully successful this year , and gained more money by selling [her]22-martha bilberries than [she]22-martha thought necessary to show to [Stephen]19-stephen ; though , on [his]19-stephen part , [he]19-stephen always brought [her]22-martha every penny of [his]19-stephen wages . Ever since [[their]445-their father]1448-their father 's funeral there had been a subject of dispute between [the brother]454-the brother and [sister]455-sister . [Martha]22-martha was bent upon enclosing [the green dell]1380-the green dell , with [[its]1380-the green dell clear , cool little pond]457-its clear , cool little pond ; and to this end [she]22-martha spent all the time [she]22-martha could spare in raising a rough fence of stones and peat round [it]1380-the green dell . But [Stephen]19-stephen would not consent to it ; and neither argument , scolding , nor coaxing could turn [him]19-stephen . [He]19-stephen always answered that [he]19-stephen had promised [the master]179-the master that [he]19-stephen would not trespass on [the manor]293-the manor ; and [he]19-stephen must stand to [his]19-stephen word , whatever [they]179-the master might lose by it ; though , indeed , [he]19-stephen saw no harm in making [green fields]460-green fields out of [the waste land]106-the waste land . [Martha]22-martha , on [her]22-martha side , maintained [her]22-martha right as [the eldest]462-the eldest to act as [she]22-martha judged best ; and , moreover , urged the example of [[her]22-martha thrifty grandmother , who had planned this very enclosure , and whose pattern [she]463-her thrifty grandmother , who had planned this very enclosure , and whose pattern she was determined to follow was determined to follow]463-her thrifty grandmother , who had planned this very enclosure , and whose pattern she was determined to follow . But before long the dispute was ended , and the subject of it became a matter of heart - troubling wonder , for [several labourers from [[the master]179-the master 's farm]466-the master 's farm]464-several labourers from the master 's farm began to fence in the very same ground , as well as to prepare the turf behind [[Fern]22-martha 's Hollow]1387-fern 's hollow for the planting of young trees ; and neither [Stephen]19-stephen nor [Martha]22-martha could hide from [the other]468-the other that these labours made [them]469-them feel exceedingly uneasy . ' [I]19-stephen say , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[19-stephen] said one of [the hedgers]470-the hedgers , as [he]19-stephen was going down from [his]19-stephen work one evening , and met [the tired boy]471-the tired boy coming up from [his]19-stephen , ' [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] afeared there 's some mischief brewing . There 's [master]251-master , and [Mr. Thomas]36-mr. wyley , and [Mr. Jones]42-jones [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , been talking with [[thy]471-the tired boy grandfather]474-thy grandfather nigh upon an hour . There 'll be a upshot some day , [I]0-i know ; and [Jones]42-jones , [he]42-jones said summat about leaving a keepsake for [thee]471-the tired boy . ' '[42-jones] What could it be , [William]43-william morris ? ' asked [Stephen]19-stephen anxiously . '[43-william morris] How should [I]0-i know ? ' said [the man]1649-the man , with some reluctance . '[131-lad] Only , [lad]131-lad , [I]0-i did hear a gun go off ; and [I]0-i never heard [Snip]29-snip bark again , though [I]0-i listened for [him]29-snip . [Stephen]19-stephen , [Stephen]19-stephen , dunna [thee]19-stephen go so mad like ! ' But it was no use shouting after [Stephen]19-stephen , as [he]19-stephen ran frantically up [the hill]1336-the hill . [Snip]29-snip was always basking lazily in the sunshine under the hedge of [the paddock]1651-the paddock , at the very point where [he]29-snip could catch the first sight of [[his]29-snip young master]304-his young master , after which there was no more idleness or stillness in [him]29-snip . [Stephen]19-stephen could hardly breathe when [he]19-stephen found that [Snip]29-snip was not at the usual place to greet [him]19-stephen ; but before [he]19-stephen reached [[his]19-stephen home]1385-his home [he]19-stephen saw it — the dead body of [[his]19-stephen own poor [Snip]29-snip]1654-his own poor snip — hung on the post of the wicket through which [he]19-stephen had to pass . [He]19-stephen flew to [the place]177-the place ; [he]19-stephen tore [his]19-stephen own hands with the nails that were driven through [Snip]29-snip 's feet ; and then , without a thought of [[his]19-stephen grandfather]1405-his grandfather or of [his]19-stephen own hunger , [he]19-stephen bore away the dead dog in [his]19-stephen arms , and wandered far out of sight or sound of [the hateful , cruel world]1657-the hateful , cruel world , into [one of the most solitary plains upon [the uplands]93-the uplands]1658-one of the most solitary plains upon the uplands . [Any one passing by]1660-any one passing by might have thought that [Stephen]19-stephen was fast asleep in the last slanting rays of the sun , which shone upon [him]19-stephen there some time after the evening shadows had fallen upon [Botfield]23-botfield ; but a frenzy of passion , too strong for any words , had felled [him]19-stephen to the ground , where [he]19-stephen lay beside [Snip]29-snip . [The gamekeeper , who had so many dogs that [he]1661-the gamekeeper , who had so many dogs that he did not care for any one of them in particular , had killed this one creature that was dearer to him than anything in the world , except little nan , and grandfather , and martha . and snip was dead , without remedy ; no power on earth could bring back the departed life did not care for [any one of [them]1663-them in particular]1662-any one of them in particular , had killed [this one creature that was dearer to [him]1661-the gamekeeper , who had so many dogs that he did not care for any one of them in particular , had killed this one creature that was dearer to him than anything in the world , except little nan , and grandfather , and martha . and snip was dead , without remedy ; no power on earth could bring back the departed life than anything in [the world]1665-the world]1664-this one creature that was dearer to him than anything in the world , except [little Nan]21-miss anne , and [grandfather]1397-grandfather , and [Martha]22-martha . '[19-stephen] Why , [lad]131-lad ! why , [Stephen]19-stephen ! what ails [thee]131-lad ? ' said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson 's voice , close behind [him]19-stephen . '[477-eh] [Eh]477-eh ! who 's gone and shot [Snip]29-snip ? [That rascal Jones]42-jones , [I]0-i 'll go bail ! Is [he]29-snip quite dead , [Stephen]19-stephen ? Stand up , [lad]131-lad , and let 's give a look at [him]29-snip . ' [The boy]1434-the boy rose , and faced [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [[his]31-black thompson comrade]1674-his comrade with eyes that were bloodshot , though [he]31-black thompson had not shed a tear , and with lips almost bitten through by [his]31-black thompson angry teeth . [Both the men]1675-both the men handled the dog gently and carefully , but , after a moment 's inspection , [Thompson]31-black thompson laid it down again on the turf . '[29-snip] It 's a shame ! ' [he]31-black thompson cried , with an oath that sounded pleasantly in [Stephen]19-stephen 's ears ; '[29-snip] it was one of the best little dogs about . [I]0-i 'd take [my]0-i vengeance on [him]29-snip for this . In [[thy]0-i place]479-thy place , [I]0-i could n't sleep till [I]0-i 'd done something . ' '[0-i] Ay ! ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , with flashing eyes ; '[29-snip] [I]0-i know where [he]29-snip 's keeping a covey of birds up against game day — nineteen of them . [I]0-i 've seen them every day , and [I]0-i could go to the place in the dark . ' '[0-i] That 's [a brave lad]480-a brave lad ! ' said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson ; '[480-a brave lad] [he]480-a brave lad 's got [[his]480-a brave lad father]1392-his father 's pluck after all , as [I]0-i 've always told [thee]482-thee , [Davies]44-davies , and [we]483-we 'll see [him]480-a brave lad righted . [He]29-snip 's got [his]29-snip eyes in [his]29-snip head , has [this lad]484-this lad ! ' '[29-snip] They 're down in [the leasowe]1676-the leasowe , between [the Firspinny]11-the firspinny and [Ragleth Hill]12-ragleth hill , '[19-stephen] continued [Stephen]19-stephen ; ' and [they]486-they 're[19-stephen] just prime , [I]0-i can tell [ye]482-thee . And [I]0-i know , too , what [he]29-snip does n't know [himself]29-snip . [I]0-i know to some black game , far away up [the hill]1336-the hill . [He]29-snip 'd give [his]29-snip two eyes to see [them]486-they , with [their]486-they white wing - feathers ; and if [he]29-snip had n't ' — [Stephen]19-stephen stopped , with quivering lips , for [he]19-stephen could not speak yet of [Snip]29-snip 's murder . '[29-snip] Never take on , [[my]0-i lad]135-my lad , ' said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , clapping [him]135-my lad on the back ; '[29-snip] [we]488-we 'll spoil [his]29-snip sport for [him]29-snip . Come [thy]29-snip ways with [us]488-we ; it 'll be dark dusk afore [we]488-we gain the spinny , and [Jones]42-jones is off to [the Whitehurst woods]489-the whitehurst woods to - night . [We]488-we 'll have as rare sport as [the lord of [the manor]293-the manor [himself]490-the lord of the manor himself]490-the lord of the manor himself . [Thee]29-snip art [a sharp one]492-a sharp one . [I]0-i 'd lay a round wager , now , [thee]29-snip knows where all the sheep of [the hillside]1428-the hillside fold of nights . ' '[29-snip] Ay , do [I]0-i , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen , walking briskly beside [Black Thompson]31-black thompson ; '[0-i] [I]0-i know every walk and every fold on [the hills]82-the hills ; ay , and many of the sheep [themselves]495-themselves . [I]0-i keep [my]0-i eyes wide open out of doors , [I]0-i promise [ye]29-snip . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i 'll swear to that , ' said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , glad to encourage [the boy]1434-the boy in [his]1434-the boy foolish boasting . On [their]1678-they way [they]1678-they passed near to [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , and [Stephen]19-stephen heard [little Nan]21-miss anne 's shrill voice calling [his]19-stephen name , as if [she]21-miss anne were seeking [him]19-stephen weariedly ; but when [he]19-stephen hesitated for a moment , [his]19-stephen heart yearning to answer [her]21-miss anne , [Black Thompson]31-black thompson again patted [him]19-stephen on the back , and bade [him]19-stephen never show the white feather , but remember [poor dead Snip]29-snip ; at which [his]19-stephen passion for revenge returned , and [he]19-stephen pressed on eagerly to the fir - coppice . It was quite dark when [they]1678-they entered the path leading through [the wood]1679-the wood . [No one]189-no one spoke now , and [they]1678-they trod cautiously , lest there should be any noise from [their]1678-they footsteps . The tall black fir - trees towered above [them]1678-they to an unusual height ; and through all the topmost branches there ran a low , mournful sound , as if every tree was whispering about [them]1678-they , and lamenting over [them]1678-they . Even [the little brook , which in the sunshine rippled so merrily along the borders of [the wood]1679-the wood]1681-the little brook , which in the sunshine rippled so merrily along the borders of the wood , seemed to be sobbing like [a grieved and tired child]1683-a grieved and tired child in the night - time . Strange rustlings on every side , and sudden groanings of the withered boughs in some of the pines , made [them]1678-they start in fear ; and once , in a little opening among the trees , when the stars came out and looked down upon [them]1678-they , [Stephen]19-stephen would have given all [he]19-stephen had in [the world]1665-the world to be safe at [home]125-home , with [little Nan]21-miss anne singing hymns on [his]19-stephen knee , or quietly asleep after the hot and busy day . '[0-i] It 's lonesome enough to make a bull - dog afeared , ' whispered [Davies]44-davies , in a frightened tone . But before long [they]1678-they were out of [the wood]1679-the wood ; and in the glimmer of light that lasts all night through during the summer , [Stephen]19-stephen saw [Black Thompson]31-black thompson unwind a net , which had been wrapped round [his]31-black thompson body under [his]31-black thompson collier 's jacket . More than half the covey of partridges were bagged ; and [they]1678-they had such capital luck , as [the men]1474-the men called it , that [Stephen]19-stephen soon entered into the daring spirit of the adventure . It sent a thrill of excitement through [him]19-stephen , in which poor [Snip]29-snip was for the time forgotten ; and when about midnight [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [Davies]44-davies said '[19-stephen] Good - night ' to [him]19-stephen at [[his]19-stephen cottage]1688-his cottage door , calling [him]19-stephen [a brave fellow]1689-a brave fellow , and giving [him]19-stephen [a fine young leveret]1690-a fine young leveret , with the promise that [he]19-stephen should have [his]19-stephen share of whatever money [they]1678-they received for [their]1678-they spoil , [he]19-stephen entered [[his]19-stephen dark home]1691-his dark home , where [every one]1692-every one was slumbering peacefully , and , without a thought of sorrow or repentance , was quickly asleep [himself]19-stephen . [Martha]22-martha 's exclamation of surprise and delight at seeing the leveret was the first sound that [Stephen]19-stephen heard in the morning ; but [he]19-stephen preserved a sullen silence as to [his]19-stephen absence the previous night , and [Martha]22-martha was too shrewd to press [him]19-stephen with questions . [They]1678-they had not been unused to such fare during [[their]1678-they father]1448-their father 's lifetime ; and it was settled between [them]1678-they that [she]22-martha should come down from [the bilberry - plain]1694-the bilberry - plain early in the afternoon to make a feast of the leveret by the time of [Stephen]19-stephen 's return from [the pit]1478-the pit . All day long [Stephen]19-stephen found [himself]19-stephen treated with marked distinction and favour by [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [[his]31-black thompson comrades]411-his comrades , to some of whom [he]19-stephen heard [him]19-stephen say , in a loud whisper , that '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen ' ud show [himself]19-stephen a chip of the old block yet . '[496-they] At dinner [they]496-they invited [him]19-stephen to sit within [their]496-they circle , where [he]19-stephen laughed and talked with the best of [them]496-they , and was listened to as if [he]19-stephen were already [a man]1421-a man . How different to [his]19-stephen usually hurried meal beside the horses , that worked like [himself]19-stephen in the dark , close passages , but did not , like [him]19-stephen , ascend each evening to [the grassy fields]498-the grassy fields and the pure air of [the upper earth]499-the upper earth ! [Stephen]19-stephen had a true tenderness in [his]19-stephen nature towards [these dumb fellow - labourers]500-these dumb fellow - labourers , and [they]496-they loved the sound of [his]19-stephen voice , and the kindly patting of [his]19-stephen hand ; but somehow [he]19-stephen felt as if [they]496-they knew how [he]19-stephen had left [[his]19-stephen faithful old Snip]501-his faithful old snip unburied on [the open hillside]502-the open hillside , where [Black Thompson]31-black thompson had found [him]19-stephen in [his]19-stephen passion the evening before . [He]19-stephen was not sorry for what [he]19-stephen had done ; [he]19-stephen would avenge [himself]19-stephen on [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper again whenever there was an opportunity . Even now , [he]19-stephen promised [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , when [they]496-they were away from [the other colliers]504-the other colliers , to show [him]19-stephen the haunts of the scarce black grouse , which would be so valuable to [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper ; and [he]19-stephen enjoyed [Black Thompson]31-black thompson 's applause . But there was a sore pang in [his]19-stephen heart , as [he]19-stephen remembered [dead Snip]29-snip , unburied on [the hillside]1428-the hillside . Supper was ready when [he]19-stephen reached [home]125-home ; and what a savoury smell came through the open door , quite down to the wicket ! Of course [Snip]29-snip was not watching for [him]19-stephen ; and [little [Nan]21-miss anne]1601-little nan also , instead of looking out for [him]19-stephen as usual , was waiting eagerly to be helped ; for , as soon as [Stephen]19-stephen was seen over [the brow of [the hill]1336-the hill]1335-the brow of the hill , [Martha]22-martha poured [her]22-martha dainty stew into a large brown dish , and [she]22-martha had already portioned out a plateful for [the grandfather]1472-the grandfather . Few words were uttered , for [Martha]22-martha was hot , and rather testy ; and [Stephen]19-stephen felt a sullen weight hanging upon [his]19-stephen spirits . Only every now and then [the old grandfather]512-the old grandfather , chuckling and mumbling over the uncommon delicacy , would call [Stephen]19-stephen by [[his]19-stephen father]1392-his father 's name of [James]37-james wyley , and thank [him]19-stephen for [his]19-stephen rare supper . ' Good evening , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's voice , and as the light from the doorway was darkened , [all the party]514-all the party looked up quickly , and [Stephen]19-stephen felt [himself]19-stephen growing hot and cold by turns . ' [Your]22-martha supper smells very nice , [Martha]22-martha ; there has been some good cooking done to - day . '[19-stephen] ' Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[22-martha] cried [Martha]22-martha , colouring up with excitement and fear , ' it is [a young leveret [Mrs. Jones]45-mrs. jones]1697-a young leveret mrs. jones , [[the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper 's wife]1699-the gamekeeper 's wife , gave [me]22-martha for some knitting [I]22-martha 'd done for [her]45-mrs. jones ; [she]45-mrs. jones said it '[22-martha] ud be a treat for [grandfather]1397-grandfather . [I]0-i 've been cooking it all evening , [ma'am]335-ma'am , and it 's very toothsome . If [you]335-ma'am 'd only just taste a mouthful , it ' ud make [me]21-miss anne ever so proud . '[21-miss anne] ' Thank [you]22-martha , [Martha]22-martha , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , smiling ; ' [I]21-miss anne am quite hungry with climbing [the hill]1336-the hill , and if it is as good as the bread [you]22-martha gave [me]21-miss anne the other day , [I]21-miss anne shall enjoy having [my]21-miss anne supper with [you]22-martha . '[21-miss anne] [Stephen]19-stephen scarcely heard what [Miss Anne]21-miss anne said to [him]19-stephen , while [he]19-stephen watched [Martha]22-martha bustling about to reach out a grand china plate , which was one of the great treasures of [their]517-their possessions ; and [he]19-stephen looked on silently as [she]22-martha chose the daintiest morsels of the stew ; but when [she]22-martha moved the little table nearer to the door , and laid the plate and knife and fork upon it , before [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , [he]19-stephen started to [his]19-stephen feet , unable to sit still and see [her]22-martha partake of the food which [he]19-stephen had procured in such a manner . ' Do n't touch it ! do n't taste it , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ! '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen cried excitedly . ' Oh , please to come out with [me]19-stephen to [the bent of [the hill]1336-the hill]1701-the bent of the hill , and [I]19-stephen 'll tell [you]21-miss anne why . But do n't eat any of it ! '[19-stephen] [He]19-stephen darted out at the door before [Martha]22-martha could stop [him]19-stephen , and ran down [the green path]518-the green path to a place where [he]19-stephen was out of sight and hearing of [[his]19-stephen home]1385-his home , waiting breathlessly for [Miss Anne]21-miss anne to overtake [him]19-stephen . It was some minutes before [she]22-martha came , and [her]22-martha face was overcast and troubled ; but [she]22-martha listened in silence , while , without concealment , but with many bitter and passionate words against [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , and excuses for [his]19-stephen own conduct , [he]19-stephen confessed to [her]22-martha all the occurrences of the night before . Every moment [his]19-stephen agitation increased under [her]22-martha quiet , mournful look of reproach , until , as [he]19-stephen came to the close , [he]19-stephen cried out in a sorrowful but defiant tone , ' Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , [I]19-stephen could not bear it ! '[19-stephen] ' Do [you]19-stephen remember , '[22-martha] [she]22-martha asked , in a low and tender voice , ' how poor [Snip]29-snip used to follow [me]22-martha down to [this very spot]1703-this very spot , and sit here till [I]22-martha was out of sight ? [I]22-martha was very fond of [poor old Snip]29-snip , [Stephen]19-stephen ! '[22-martha] Yes , [her]22-martha voice trembled , and tears were in [her]22-martha eyes . The proud bulwark which [Stephen]19-stephen had been raising against [his]19-stephen grief was broken down in a moment . [He]19-stephen sank down on the turf at [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's feet ; and , no longer checking the tears which had been burning in [his]19-stephen eyes all day , [he]19-stephen wept and sobbed vehemently , until [his]19-stephen passion had worn away . ' And now , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , sitting down beside [him]19-stephen , ' [I]21-miss anne must tell [you]19-stephen that , though [I]21-miss anne am not surprised , [I]21-miss anne am very , very grieved , [Stephen]19-stephen . If [you]19-stephen knew [your]19-stephen Bible more , [you]19-stephen would have read this verse in it , " [God]26-god is faithful , who will not suffer [you]19-stephen to be tempted above that [ye]19-stephen are able ; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape , that [ye]19-stephen may be able to bear it . " Did no way of escape open to [you]19-stephen , [Stephen]19-stephen ? '[21-miss anne] Then [Stephen]19-stephen remembered how [he]19-stephen had heard dear little [Nan]21-miss anne calling piteously to [him]19-stephen as [he]19-stephen passed [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow with [Black Thompson]31-black thompson ; and how [his]19-stephen heart yearned to go to [her]21-miss anne , though [he]19-stephen had resisted and conquered this saving impulse . ' [You]19-stephen do not know much , '[21-miss anne] continued [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' but if [you]19-stephen had followed out all [you]19-stephen do know , instead of poaching with [Black Thompson]31-black thompson that [you]19-stephen might revenge [yourself]19-stephen for [Snip]29-snip being killed , [you]19-stephen would have been praying for [them]1704-them that persecute [you]19-stephen . The Bible says that not a sparrow falls to the ground without [[our]1705-our Father]199-our father . So [God]26-god knew that [poor Snip]29-snip was shot . '[21-miss anne] ' But why did [He]199-our father not hinder it ? '[19-stephen] asked [Stephen]19-stephen , speaking low and indistinctly . ' [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne earnestly , ' suppose that [I]21-miss anne lived in [a very grand palace]1707-a very grand palace , where there were many things that [you]19-stephen had never seen , and [I]21-miss anne wanted little [Nan]21-miss anne to come and live with [me]21-miss anne , not as [a servant]1708-a servant , but as [[my]21-miss anne dear child]1709-my dear child ; would it be unkind of [me]21-miss anne to send [her]21-miss anne first to [a school]1710-a school , where [she]21-miss anne could learn how to read the books , and understand the pictures , and play the music [she]21-miss anne would find in [[my]21-miss anne palace]1711-my palace ? Even if the lessons were often hard , and [some of [[her]21-miss anne schoolfellows]1713-her schoolfellows]1712-some of her schoolfellows were cruel and unkind to [her]21-miss anne , would it not be better for [her]21-miss anne to bear it for a little while , until [she]21-miss anne was made ready to live with [me]21-miss anne as [[my]21-miss anne own child]1714-my own child ? '[21-miss anne] [The young lady]1602-the young lady paused for a few minutes , while [Stephen]19-stephen pictured to [himself]19-stephen [the grand palace]522-the grand palace , and [little Nan]21-miss anne being made fit to live in [it]522-the grand palace ; and when at last [he]19-stephen raised [his]19-stephen brown eyes to [hers]1602-the young lady , bright with the pleasant thought , [she]1602-the young lady went on in a quiet , reverential tone : ' Perhaps [we]1715-we could not understand any of the things of heaven , so [[our]1715-we Father]199-our father which is in [heaven]226-heaven sends [us]1715-we to [school]1718-school [here]146-here ; [we]1715-we are learning lessons all [our]1715-we life long . There is not a single trouble that comes to [us]1715-we but it is to teach [us]1715-we the meaning of something [we]1715-we shall meet with there . [We]1715-we should not be happy to hear [the angels]1589-the angels singing a song which [we]1715-we could not understand , because [we]1715-we had missed [our]1715-we lessons down here . '[1602-the young lady] ' Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[19-stephen] cried [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [I]19-stephen feel as if [I]19-stephen could bear anything when [I]19-stephen think of that ! Only [I]19-stephen wish [I]19-stephen was as strong as [an angel]1721-an angel . '[19-stephen] ' Patience is better than strength , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , in a tone as if [she]21-miss anne were speaking to [herself]21-miss anne : ' patiently to bear the will of [God]26-god , and patiently to keep [His]26-god commandments , is greater and more glorious than the strength of [an angel]1721-an angel . '[21-miss anne] ' [Black Thompson]31-black thompson was so kind to [me]19-stephen all to - day , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , sighing ; ' and now [he]31-black thompson 'll be ten times worse if [I]19-stephen go back from telling [him]31-black thompson where the black game is . '[19-stephen] ' [You]19-stephen must do right , '[21-miss anne] replied [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , with a glance that brought back true courage to [the boy]1434-the boy 's heart ; ' and remember that " blessed are [they]524-they which are persecuted for righteousness '[21-miss anne] sake , for [theirs]524-they is [the kingdom of [heaven]226-heaven]354-the kingdom of heaven . " Now , good - night , [Stephen]19-stephen . Go and bury [poor Snip]29-snip while there is daylight , in some quiet place where [you]19-stephen can go and think and read and play sometimes . ' [Stephen]19-stephen returned to [the hut]1337-the hut for a spade , and then went , with a strange blending of grief and gladness , to the place where [he]19-stephen had left [his]19-stephen poor dog . [He]19-stephen chose [a solitary yew tree on [the hill]1336-the hill]1724-a solitary yew tree on the hill for [the burial ground]1726-the burial ground , and dug as deep a grave as [he]19-stephen could among the far - spreading roots . It was strange , only such things do happen now and then , that while [he]19-stephen was working away hard and fast , with the dead dog lying by under the trunk of the yew tree , [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper [himself]1557-the gamekeeper passed that way . [He]1557-the gamekeeper had been in a terrible temper all day , for [he]1557-the gamekeeper had discovered the mischief done down in the fir - coppice , and the loss of [his]1557-the gamekeeper carefully - preserved covey . The sight of [Stephen]19-stephen and [dead Snip]29-snip irritated [him]19-stephen ; though a feeling of shame crept over [him]19-stephen as [he]19-stephen saw how tear - stained [the boy]1434-the boy 's face was . '[42-jones] [Mr. Jones]42-jones , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[42-jones] [I]0-i 've something to say to [you]42-jones . ' '[0-i] Be sharp , then , ' replied [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , '[0-i] and mind what [you]0-i 're about . [I]42-jones 'll not take any impudence from [a young rascal like [you]0-i]1730-a young rascal like you . '[42-jones] ' It 's no impudence , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen ; ' only [I]19-stephen know to some black game , and [I]19-stephen wanted to tell [you]42-jones about them . '[19-stephen] ' Black game ! '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said contemptuously . ' A likely story . There 's been none these half - dozen years . '[19-stephen] ' It 's four years since , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen ; ' [I]19-stephen remember , because [grandfather]1397-grandfather and [I]19-stephen saw [them]1732-them the day [mother]167-mother died , when [little Nan]21-miss anne was born . [I]19-stephen could n't forget [them]1732-them or mistake [them]1732-them after that . [They]1732-them are at [the head of [the Black Valley]1735-the black valley]1734-the head of the black valley , where the quaking noise begins . [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] sure [I]0-i 'm right , [sir]264-sir . '[19-stephen] ' [You]264-sir are not making game of [me]42-jones ? '[42-jones] asked [Jones]42-jones , laughing heartily at [his]42-jones own wit . ' Well , [[my]42-jones lad]135-my lad , if this is true , it will be worth something to [me]42-jones . Hark [ye]527-you , [I]42-jones 'm[42-jones] sorry about [your]527-you dog , and [you]527-you shall choose any one of [mine]42-jones [you]527-you like , if [you]527-you 'll promise to keep [him]528-him out of mischief . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i could n't have another dog in [Snip 's place]529-snip 's place , ' replied [Stephen]19-stephen in a choked voice ; '[0-i] at any rate not yet , thank [you]527-you , [sir]264-sir . ' '[264-sir] Well , ' said [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , shouldering [his]1557-the gamekeeper gun , and walking off , '[264-sir] [I]0-i 'll be [[your]527-you friend]345-your friend , [young Fern]19-stephen , when it does not hurt [myself]0-i . ' Of course [Stephen]19-stephen 's brief term of favour with [Black Thompson]31-black thompson was at an end ; but whether [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had given [him]19-stephen a hint that [the boy]1434-the boy was under [her]21-miss anne protection , and had confessed all to [her]21-miss anne , or because [he]19-stephen might be busy in some deeper scheme of wickedness , [he]19-stephen did not display as much anger as [Stephen]19-stephen expected , when [he]19-stephen refused to show [him]19-stephen the haunts of the grouse , or go with [him]19-stephen again on a poaching expedition . [Stephen]19-stephen was more humble and vigilant than [he]19-stephen had been before falling into temptation . [He]19-stephen set a close watch upon [himself]19-stephen , lest [he]19-stephen should be betrayed into a self - confident spirit again ; and [Tim]33-tim 's loud praises sounded less pleasantly in [his]19-stephen ears , so that one evening [he]19-stephen told [him]33-tim , with much shame , into what sin [he]19-stephen had been led by [his]19-stephen desire to avenge [Snip]29-snip 's murder . Unfortunately , this disclosure so much heightened [Tim]33-tim 's estimation of [his]19-stephen character , that from time to time [he]19-stephen gave utterance to mysterious hints of the extraordinary courage and spirit [Stephen]19-stephen could manifest when occasion required . These praises were , however , in some measure balanced by [Martha]22-martha 's taunts and reproaches at [home]125-home . The shooting season had commenced , and [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor was come , with [a number of [[his]94-the lord of the manor friends]1743-his friends]1742-a number of his friends , to shoot over [the hills]82-the hills and plantations . [He]94-the lord of the manor was [a frank , pleasant - looking gentleman]1745-a frank , pleasant - looking gentleman , but far too grand and high for [Stephen]19-stephen to address , though [he]19-stephen gazed wistfully at [him]94-the lord of the manor whenever [he]19-stephen chanced to meet [him]94-the lord of the manor on [the hills]82-the hills . One afternoon [Martha]22-martha saw [him]94-the lord of the manor and [the master]179-the master walking towards [Fern]22-martha 's Hollow , where the fencing - in of [the green]1427-the green and of the coppice behind [the hut]1337-the hut were being finished rapidly ; and [she]22-martha crept with stealthy steps under the hedge of [the garden]1350-the garden , until [she]22-martha came within earshot of [them]1751-them ; but [they]1751-them were just moving on , and all [she]22-martha heard of the conversation were these words , from [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor : '[19-stephen] [You]532-you shall have it at any rate [you]532-you fix , [Wyley]37-james wyley — at a peppercorn rent , if [you]532-you please ; but [I]0-i will not sell a square yard of [[my]0-i land]533-my land out and out . ' How [Martha]22-martha and [Stephen]19-stephen did talk about those words over and over again , and could never come to any conclusion about them . It was about noon on Michaelmas Day , a day which was of no note up at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , where there was no rent to be paid , and [Martha]22-martha was busily hanging out clothes to dry on the gorse bushes before [the house]1347-the house , when [she]22-martha saw [a troop of [labourers]1755-labourers]1754-a troop of labourers coming over [the brow of [the hill]1336-the hill]1335-the brow of the hill and crossing [the newly - enclosed pasture]1758-the newly - enclosed pasture . [They]1754-a troop of labourers were armed with mattocks and pickaxes ; but as [the peaceful little cottage]1759-the peaceful little cottage rose before [them]1754-a troop of labourers , with blind old Fern basking in the warm sunshine , and [little Nan]21-miss anne playing quietly about the door - sill , [the men]1474-the men gathered into a little knot , and stood still with an irresolute and ashamed aspect . '[534-they] [They]534-they know nothing about it , ' said [William Morris]43-william morris ; '[534-they] look at [them]534-they , as easy and unconcerned as lambs . [I]0-i was afeared there 'd be a upshot , when [the master]179-the master were after [old Fern]22-martha so long . [I]0-i do n't half like the job ; and [Stephen]19-stephen is n't here . [He]19-stephen does look a bit like [a man]1421-a man , and [we]537-we could argy with [him]19-stephen ; but [that old man]538-that old man , and [that girl]539-that girl — they'll take on so . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i say , [Martha]22-martha , ' shouted [a bolder - hearted man]1761-a bolder - hearted man , '[0-i] has n't [the master]179-the master let [thee]22-martha know [thee]22-martha must turn out to - day ? [He]19-stephen wants to lay the foundation of [a new house]541-a new house , and get the walls up afore the frost comes on ; and [we]537-we are come to pick [the old place to the ground]542-the old place to the ground . [He]19-stephen only told [us]537-we an hour ago , or [we]537-we 'd have seen [thee]22-martha was ready . ' '[19-stephen] [I]0-i do n't believe [thee]22-martha ; [thee]22-martha 's only romancing , ' said [Martha]22-martha , turning very pale . '[22-martha] [The old place]543-the old place is [our]537-we own , and [no master]544-no master has any right to [it]543-the old place , save [Stephen]19-stephen . ' '[19-stephen] It 's no use wasting breath , ' replied [William Morris]43-william morris . '[179-the master] [The master]179-the master says [he]179-the master 's bought [the place]177-the place from [[thy]22-martha grandfather]474-thy grandfather , [lass]548-lass ; and [he]179-the master agreed to turn out by noon on Michaelmas Day . [Master]251-master does n't want to be hard upon [you]22-martha ; and [he]251-master says , if [you]22-martha 've no place to turn in to , [you]22-martha may go to [the old cabin]550-the old cabin on [the upper cinder - hill]551-the upper cinder - hill , till there 's [a cottage empty in [Botfield]23-botfield]552-a cottage empty in botfield ; and [we]553-we 'll help [thee]22-martha to move the things at [wunst]13-wunst . [We]553-we 're to get the roof off and the walls down afore nightfall . '[251-master] ' [Grandfather]27-grandfather and [little Nan]21-miss anne ! '[22-martha] screamed [Martha]22-martha ; ' get into [the house]1347-the house this minute ! It 's no use [you]22-martha men coming up here on this errand . [You]22-martha know [grandfather]1397-grandfather 's simple , and [he]1397-grandfather has n't sold [the house]1347-the house ; how could [he]1397-grandfather ? [He]1397-grandfather 's no more sense than [little Nan]21-miss anne . No , no ; [you]554-a pack of rascals must go down to [the works]1765-the works , and hear what [Stephen]19-stephen says . [You]554-a pack of rascals 're[251-master] [a pack of rascals]554-a pack of rascals , every one of [you]554-a pack of rascals , and [the master]179-the master 's the biggest ; and [you]554-a pack of rascals 'll all have to gnash [your]554-a pack of rascals teeth over this business some day , [I]0-i reckon . ' By this time [the old man]1403-the old man and [the child]1568-the child were safely within [the house]1347-the house ; and [Martha]22-martha , springing quickly from the wicket , where [she]22-martha had kept [the men]1474-the men at bay , followed [them]1474-the men in , and barred the door , before [any one of [the labourers]1771-the labourers]1770-any one of the labourers could thrust [his]1770-any one of the labourers shoulder in to prevent [her]22-martha . [They]1474-the men held a consultation together when [they]1474-the men found that no arguments prevailed upon [her]22-martha to open to [them]1474-the men , to which [Martha]22-martha listened disdainfully through the large chinks , but vouchsafed no answer . '[0-i] Come , come , [[my]0-i lass]556-my lass , ' said [William Morris]43-william morris soothingly ; '[556-my lass] it 's lost time and strength , [thee]556-my lass contending with [the master]179-the master . [I]0-i do n't like the business ; but [our]558-we orders are clear , and [we]558-we must obey [them]559-them . [Thee]179-the master let [us]558-we in , and [we]558-we 'll carry the things down to [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin for [thee]556-my lass . If [thee]179-the master wo n't open the door , [we]558-we 'll be forced to take the thatch off . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't , ' answered [Martha,—'not]46-martha,—'not for [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor [himself]94-the lord of the manor . [The house]1347-the house is [ours]558-we , and [I]0-i '[0-i] ware any of [you]179-the master to touch [it]561-it . Go down to [Stephen]19-stephen and hear what [he]19-stephen 'll say . If [thee]179-the master takes the thatch off , [thee]179-the master sha n't move [me]0-i out . ' But when the old stove - pipe , through which the last breath of the household fire had passed , was drawn up , and the blue sky could be seen through the cloud of dust and dirt with which [the hut]1337-the hut was filled , choking [the helpless old man]1775-the helpless old man and [the frightened child]1776-the frightened child , [Martha]22-martha 's courage failed [her]22-martha ; and [she]22-martha went out , with [little Nan]21-miss anne clinging round [her]22-martha , and spoke as calmly to [the invaders]1777-the invaders as [her]22-martha rising sobs would let [her]22-martha . '[179-the master] [You]179-the master know it 's [[grandmother]1426-grandmother 's own house]563-grandmother 's own house , ' [she]22-martha said ; '[179-the master] and [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor [himself]94-the lord of the manor has no right to [it]563-grandmother 's own house . But [I]0-i 'll go down and fetch [Stephen]19-stephen , if [you]179-the master 'll only wait . ' '[565-we] [We]565-we dare n't wait , [Martha]22-martha , ' answered [Morris]43-william morris kindly ; '[22-martha] and it 's no use , [lass]548-lass ; [the master]179-the master 's too many for [thee]548-lass . But [thee]548-lass go down to [Stephen]19-stephen ; and [we]565-we 'll move the things safe , as if they were [our]565-we own , and put them where they 'll not be broken ; and [we]565-we 'll take care of [little Nan]21-miss anne and [[thy]548-lass poor old grandfather]568-thy poor old grandfather . Tell [Stephen]19-stephen [we]565-we 're desperately cut up about it [ourselves]565-we ; but , if [we]565-we had n't done it , [somebody that has no good - will towards [him]19-stephen]1778-somebody that has no good - will towards him would have taken the job . So go [thy]548-lass poor ways with [thee]548-lass , [[my]565-we lass]556-my lass ; [we]565-we are main sorry for [thee]548-lass and [Stephen]19-stephen . '[565-we] The hot , choking smoke from the limekiln was blowing across [the works]1765-the works ; and [the dusty pit - bank]570-the dusty pit - bank was covered with [busy men]571-busy men and [boys]1326-boys and [girls]573-girls , shouting , laughing , singing , and swearing , when [Martha]22-martha arrived at [Botfield]23-botfield . [She]22-martha was rarely seen at [the pit]1478-the pit , for [her]22-martha thrifty and housewifely habits kept [her]22-martha busy at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow ; and the rough , loud voices of [the banksmen]575-the banksmen , the regular beat of the engine , the clanking of chains , and the dust and smoke and heat of the almost strange scene bewildered [the hillside girl]576-the hillside girl . [She]22-martha made [her]22-martha way to [the cabin]577-the cabin , [a little hut built near]578-a little hut built near [the mouth of [the shaft]1492-the shaft for the use of [the people employed about]581-the people employed about [the pit]1478-the pit]579-the mouth of the shaft for the use of the people employed about the pit ; but before [she]22-martha could see [Tim]33-tim , or fix upon [any one]138-any one to inquire about [Stephen]19-stephen from , [a girl of [her]584-a girl of her own age , but with a face sunburnt and blackened from her rough and unwomanly work , and in an uncouth dress of sackcloth , which was grimed with coal - dust own age , but with a face sunburnt and blackened from [her]584-a girl of her own age , but with a face sunburnt and blackened from her rough and unwomanly work , and in an uncouth dress of sackcloth , which was grimed with coal - dust rough and unwomanly work , and in an uncouth dress of sackcloth , which was grimed with coal - dust]584-a girl of her own age , but with a face sunburnt and blackened from her rough and unwomanly work , and in an uncouth dress of sackcloth , which was grimed with coal - dust , came up and peered boldly in [her]584-a girl of her own age , but with a face sunburnt and blackened from her rough and unwomanly work , and in an uncouth dress of sackcloth , which was grimed with coal - dust face . ' Why , it 's [Miss Fern]47-miss fern ! '[22-martha] [she]22-martha cried , with a loud laugh ; ' [Miss Fern , Esq .]47-miss fern , of [Fern]47-miss fern 's Hollow , come to learn [us]1780-us [poor pit - folk]1781-poor pit - folk scholarship and manners . Here , [lads]1499-lads ! here 's [[Mr. Stephen Fern]19-stephen 's fine sister]1783-mr. stephen fern 's fine sister , as knows more nor all of [us]1780-us put together . Give [us]1780-us a bit of [your]47-miss fern learning , [Miss Fern]47-miss fern . '[22-martha] ' [I]22-martha know [a black - bess]1784-a black - bess when [I]22-martha see one , '[22-martha] replied [Martha]22-martha sharply ; and [all the boys]585-all the boys and [girls]573-girls joined in a ready roar of merriment against [Bess Thompson]48-bess , whose nickname was the common country name for a beetle . ' That 'll do ! '[587-they] [they]587-they shouted ; ' [she]48-bess knows [a black - bess]1784-a black - bess ! [Thee]48-bess 's got [thy]48-bess answer , [Bess Thompson]48-bess . '[587-they] ' What 's brought [thee]48-bess to [the pit]1478-the pit ? '[48-bess] asked [Bess]48-bess fiercely ; ' [we]587-they want [no scatter - witted hill girls]1787-no scatter - witted hill girls here , [I]48-bess can tell [ye]48-bess . So get off [the pit - bank]206-the pit - bank , afore [I]48-bess drive [thee]48-bess off . '[48-bess] ' What 's all this hullabaloo ? '[33-tim] inquired [Tim]33-tim , making [his]33-tim appearance at the cabin door . ' Why , [Martha]22-martha , what brings [thee]48-bess at [the pit]1478-the pit ? Come in here , and tell [me]33-tim what 's up now . '[33-tim] [Tim]33-tim listened to [Martha]22-martha 's tearful story with great amazement and indignation ; and , after a few minutes ' consideration , [he]33-tim told [her]22-martha [he]33-tim had nothing much to do , and [he]33-tim would get leave to take [Stephen]19-stephen 's place for the rest of the day , so as to set [him]33-tim free to go [home]125-home at once . [He]33-tim left [her]22-martha standing in the middle of [the cabin]577-the cabin , for the rough benches round it looked too black for [her]22-martha to venture to take a seat upon them ; and in a short time [he]33-tim shouted to [her]22-martha from a skep , which was being lowered into [the pit]1478-the pit , promising [her]22-martha that [Stephen]19-stephen should come up as soon as possible . It seemed a terribly long time to wait amid that noise and dust , and every now and then [Black Bess]23-botfield relieved [her]23-botfield feelings by making hideous grimaces at [her]22-martha when [she]22-martha passed [the cabin]577-the cabin door ; but [Stephen]19-stephen ascended at last , very stern - looking and silent , for [Tim]33-tim had told [him]33-tim [Martha]22-martha 's business ; and [he]33-tim hurried [her]22-martha away from [the pit - bank]206-the pit - bank before [he]33-tim would listen to the detailed account [she]22-martha was longing to give . Even when [they]1795-they were in [the lonely lane leading homewards]1796-the lonely lane leading homewards , and [she]22-martha was talking and sobbing [herself]22-martha out of breath , [he]33-tim walked on without a word passing [his]33-tim lips , though [his]33-tim heart was sending up ceaseless prayers to [God]26-god for help to bear this trial with patience . [Poor old home]1797-poor old home ! There was all the well - used household furniture carried out and heaped together on the turf,—chairs and tables and beds,—looking so differently to what [they]1795-they did when arranged in [their]1795-they proper order . [The old man]1403-the old man , with [his]1403-the old man grey head uncovered , was wandering to and fro in sore bewilderment ; and little [Nan]21-miss anne had fallen asleep beside the furniture , with the trace of tears upon [her]21-miss anne rosy cheeks . But [the house]1347-the house was almost gone . The door - sill , where [Stephen]19-stephen had so often seen the sun go down as [he]19-stephen rested [himself]19-stephen from [his]19-stephen labours , was already taken up ; the old grate , round which [they]1795-they had sat all the winter nights that [he]19-stephen had ever known , was pulled out of the rock ; and all the floor was open to the mocking sunshine . It is a mournful thing to see [[one]1551-one 's own home]1801-one 's own home in ruins ; and a tear or two made a white channel down the coal - dust on [Stephen]19-stephen 's cheeks ; but [he]0-i subdued [himself]0-i , and spoke out to [the labourers]1771-the labourers like [a man]1421-a man . '[0-i] [I]0-i know it 's not [your]588-you fault , ' [he]0-i said , as [they]1771-the labourers stood round [him]0-i , making explanations and excuses ; '[0-i] but [you]588-you know [grandfather]1397-grandfather could not sell [the place]177-the place . [I]0-i 'll get [you]588-you to help [me]0-i carry the things down to [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . The sheep and ponies are coming down [the hill]1336-the hill , and there 'll be rain afore long ; and it 's not fit for [grandfather]1397-grandfather and [little Nan]21-miss anne to be out in it . [You]588-you 'll spare time from the work for that ? ' '[594-we] Ay , will [we]594-we ! ' cried [the men]1474-the men heartily ; and , submitting kindly to [Stephen]19-stephen 's quiet directions , [they]1474-the men were soon laden with the household goods , which were scanty and easily removed . Two or three journeys were sufficient to take [them]1474-the men all ; and when [the labourers]1771-the labourers returned for the last time to [their]1771-the labourers work of destruction , [Stephen]19-stephen took [little Nan]21-miss anne in [his]19-stephen arms , and [Martha]22-martha led away [the old man]1403-the old man ; while the sound of the pickaxes and the crash of the rough rubble stones of [[their]1771-the labourers old home]1807-their old home followed [their]1771-the labourers slow and lingering steps over [the new pasture]1808-the new pasture , and down [the hillside]1428-the hillside towards [Botfield]23-botfield . [The cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin was situated at the mouth of an old shaft , long out of use , but said to lead into [the same pit as that now worked]1811-the same pit as that now worked , the entrance to which was about a quarter of a mile distant . [The cabin]577-the cabin was about the same size as [the hut from which [the helpless family]1814-the helpless family had been driven]1813-the hut from which the helpless family had been driven ; but [the thatch]1815-the thatch wanted so much mending that [Stephen]19-stephen and [Martha]22-martha were obliged to draw over it one of [their]1771-the labourers patchwork quilts , to shelter [them]1771-the labourers for the night from the rain which was threatened by the gathering clouds . The door from [the hut at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow]1816-the hut at fern 's hollow was fortunately rather too large instead of being too small for the doorway ; and [William Morris]43-william morris promised to bring [them]1771-the labourers a shutter for the window - place , where there was no glass . Altogether , [the cabin]577-the cabin was not very inferior to [[their]1771-the labourers old home]1807-their old home ; but , instead of the soft green turf and the fragrant air of [the hills]82-the hills , [they]1771-the labourers were surrounded by barren cinder - heaps , upon which nothing would grow but the yellow coltsfoot and a few weeds , and the wind was blowing clouds of smoke from the limekilns over and round [the dismal cabin]1820-the dismal cabin . [Stephen]19-stephen , with the profound silence that began to frighten [Martha]22-martha , made every arrangement [he]19-stephen could think of for [their]1771-the labourers comfort during the quickly - approaching night ; and as soon as this was finished , [he]19-stephen washed and dressed [himself]19-stephen , as upon a Sunday morning , before going to meet [Miss Anne]21-miss anne in [the Red Gravel Pit]364-the red gravel pit . [He]19-stephen was leaving [the cabin]577-the cabin without speaking , when [little Nan , who had watched everything in childish bewilderment and dismay]1823-little nan , who had watched everything in childish bewilderment and dismay , set up a loud , pitiful cry , which [he]19-stephen soothed with great difficulty . '[19-stephen] [Stevie]19-stephen going to live [here]146-here ? ' said [the little child]1824-the little child at last , with a deep sob . '[19-stephen] Ay , [little Nan]21-miss anne , ' [he]19-stephen answered ; '[21-miss anne] for a bit , [darling]596-darling . Please [God]26-god , [we]597-we 'll go [home]125-home again some day . But [little Nan]21-miss anne shall always live with [Stevie]19-stephen . That 'll do ; wo n't it ? ' '[19-stephen] Ay , [Stevie]19-stephen , ' sobbed [the child]1568-the child ; and [Stephen]19-stephen , kissing [her]1568-the child tenderly , put [her]1568-the child on to [Martha]22-martha 's lap , and walked out into the moonlight . The clouds were hanging heavily in the western sky , but the clearer heavens shone all the brighter by the contrast . [The mountains]74-the mountains lay before [him]19-stephen , calm and immovable in the soft light ; and [he]19-stephen could see the round outline of [his]19-stephen own hollow , at which [his]19-stephen heart throbbed for a minute painfully . But there was a hidden corner at the side of [the cabin]577-the cabin , and there [Stephen]19-stephen knelt down to pray earnestly before [he]19-stephen went farther on [his]19-stephen errand , until , calm and quiet as [the hills]82-the hills , and as the moon which seemed to be gazing lovingly upon [them]82-the hills , [he]19-stephen went on with a brave and stedfast spirit to [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house . [Botfield Hall]14-botfield hall was [a large , half - timbered farmhouse , with a gabled roof , part of which was made of thatch and the rest of tiles]1831-a large , half - timbered farmhouse , with a gabled roof , part of which was made of thatch and the rest of tiles . [It]14-botfield hall stood quite alone , at a little distance from [the works]1765-the works , on the other side of [them]82-the hills to that where [the village]280-the village was built . The window - casements were framed of stone ; and the outer doors were of thick , solid oak , studded with large - headed iron nails . The iron ring that served as a rapper on the back door fell with a loud clang from [Stephen]19-stephen 's fingers upon the nails , and startled [him]19-stephen with its din , so that [he]19-stephen could hardly speak to [the servant who answered [his]19-stephen noisy summons]1834-the servant who answered his noisy summons . [They]82-the hills crossed [a kitchen]1835-a kitchen , into which many doors opened , to a kind of parlour beyond , fitted up with furniture that looked wonderfully handsome and grand in [Stephen]19-stephen 's eyes , and where [the master]179-the master was sitting by a comfortable fire . [The impatient servant]1837-the impatient servant pushed [him]19-stephen within the door , and closed it behind [her]1837-the impatient servant , leaving [him]19-stephen standing upon a mat , and shyly stroking [his]19-stephen cap round and round , while [the master]179-the master sat still , and gazed at [him]19-stephen steadily with an assumed air of amazement , though inwardly [he]179-the master was more afraid of [the boy]1434-the boy than [Stephen]19-stephen was of [him]1434-the boy . It makes [a coward of [a man]1421-a man or [boy]1842-boy]1840-a coward of a man or boy to do [anybody]1843-anybody an injury . '[19-stephen] Pray , what business brings [you]599-you [here]146-here , [young Fern]19-stephen ? ' [he]0-i asked in a gruff voice . '[264-sir] [Sir]264-sir , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen firmly , but without any insolence of manner , '[264-sir] [I]0-i want to know who has turned [us]602-us out of [[our]602-us own house]603-our own house . Is it [the lord of the manor]94-the lord of the manor , or [you]264-sir ? ' '[264-sir] [I]0-i 've bought [the place]177-the place for [myself]0-i , ' answered [the master]179-the master , bringing [his]179-the master hand down with a heavy blow upon the table before [him]179-the master , as if [he]179-the master would like to knock [Stephen]19-stephen down with the same force . '[0-i] There 's [nobody]147-nobody to sell it but [me]0-i , ' said [the boy]1434-the boy . '[147-nobody] [You]0-i think so , [[my]0-i lad]135-my lad , do [you]0-i ? Why , if it were [your]0-i own , [you]0-i would have no power over [it]177-the place till [you]0-i are one - and - twenty . But [the place]177-the place was [[your]0-i grandfather]256-your grandfather 's , and [he]256-your grandfather has sold [it]177-the place to [me]0-i for £ 15 . When [[your]0-i grandfather]256-your grandfather returned from transportation [[[his]256-your grandfather wife]1315-his wife 's hut]612-his wife 's hut became [his]256-your grandfather ; and [his]256-your grandfather right to it does not go over to [anybody else]613-anybody else till [he]256-your grandfather is dead . It never belonged to [[your]0-i father]248-your father ; and [you]0-i can have no right to it . If [you]0-i want to see the deed of purchase , it is safe here , witnessed by [[my]0-i brother]615-my brother [Thomas]36-mr. wyley and [Jones]42-jones [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , and [[your]0-i grandfather]256-your grandfather 's mark put to it . [I]0-i would show it to [you]0-i ; but [I]0-i reckon , with all [your]0-i learning , [you]0-i would not make much out of it . ' '[0-i] [Sir]264-sir , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , trembling , '[1397-grandfather] [grandfather]1397-grandfather is quite simple and dark . [He]1397-grandfather could n't understand that [you]264-sir were buying [the place of [him]1397-grandfather]620-the place of him . Besides , [he]1397-grandfather 's never had the money ? ' '[1397-grandfather] What do [you]264-sir mean , [[you]264-sir young scoundrel]621-you young scoundrel ? ' cried [the master]179-the master . '[264-sir] [I]0-i gave it into [his]1397-grandfather own hands , and made [him]1397-grandfather put it into [his]1397-grandfather waistcoat pocket for safety . Simple is [he]1397-grandfather , and dark ? [He]1397-grandfather could attend [[his]1397-grandfather son]1312-his son 's funeral four miles off only a few months ago ; and [he]1397-grandfather can understand [[my]0-i niece]263-my niece [Anne]21-miss anne 's fine reading , which [I]0-i can not understand [myself]0-i . Ask [him]1397-grandfather for the three five - pound notes [I]0-i gave [him]1397-grandfather , if [you]264-sir have not had them already . ' '[0-i] How long ago is it ? ' inquired [Stephen]19-stephen . '[0-i] [You]264-sir ca n't remember ! ' said [the master]179-the master , laughing : '[0-i] well , well , [Jones]42-jones left [you]264-sir a keepsake at [[your]264-sir garden]624-your garden wicket for [you]264-sir to remember the day by . ' [Stephen]19-stephen 's face flushed into a wrathful crimson , but [he]19-stephen did not speak ; and in a minute or two [the master]179-the master said sharply , — '[42-jones] Come , be off with [you]264-sir , if [you]264-sir 've got nothing else to say . ' '[264-sir] [I]0-i have got something else to say , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen , walking up to the table and looking steadily into [[his]0-i master]190-his master 's face . '[0-i] [God]26-god sees [both of [us]625-both of us]625-both of us ; and [He]26-god knows [you]264-sir have no right to [the place]177-the place , and [I]0-i have . [I]0-i believe some day [we]625-both of us 'll go back again , though [you]264-sir have pulled [the old house]1541-the old house down to the ground . [I]0-i do n't want to make [God]26-god angry with [me]0-i . But the Bible says [He]26-god seeth in secret , and [He]26-god will reward [us]625-both of us openly . ' [The master]179-the master shrank and turned pale before the keen , composed gaze of [the boy]1434-the boy and [his]1434-the boy manly bearing ; but [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart began to fail [him]19-stephen , and , with trembling limbs and eyes that could scarcely see , [he]19-stephen made [his]19-stephen way out of [the room]1852-the room , and out of [the house]1347-the house , down to the end of the shrubbery . There [he]19-stephen could bear up no longer , and [he]19-stephen sat down under the laurels , shivering with a feeling of despair . The worst was come upon [him]19-stephen now , and [he]19-stephen saw [no helper]1854-no helper . '[26-god] [[My]0-i poor boy]628-my poor boy , ' said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's gentle voice , and [he]19-stephen felt [her]21-miss anne hand laid softly on [his]19-stephen shoulder . '[26-god] [[My]0-i poor [Stephen]19-stephen]629-my poor stephen , [I]0-i have heard all , and [I]0-i know how bitterly hard it is to bear . ' [Stephen]19-stephen answered [her]21-miss anne only with a low , half - suppressed groan ; and then [he]19-stephen sat speechless and motionless , as if [his]19-stephen despair had completely paralyzed [him]19-stephen . '[0-i] Listen , [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [she]21-miss anne continued , with energy : '[19-stephen] [you]19-stephen told [me]0-i once that [the clergyman at [Danesford]5-danesford]630-the clergyman at danesford has some paper belonging to [you]19-stephen , about [the cottage]1314-the cottage . [You]19-stephen must go to [him]630-the clergyman at danesford , and tell [him]630-the clergyman at danesford frankly [your]19-stephen whole story . [I]0-i do not believe that what [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle has done would stand in law , and [I]0-i [myself]0-i , if it be necessary , would testify that [[your]19-stephen grandfather]256-your grandfather could not understand such a transaction . But perhaps it could be settled without going to law , if [the clergyman at Danesford]630-the clergyman at danesford would take it in hand ; for [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle is very wishful to keep a good name in [the country]1361-the country . But if not , [Stephen Fern]19-stephen , [I]0-i promise [you]19-stephen faithfully that should [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow ever come into [my]0-i possession , and [I]0-i be [[[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle 's only relative]638-my uncle 's only relative , [I]0-i will restore it to [you]19-stephen as [your]19-stephen rightful inheritance . ' [She]1855-her spoke so gravely , yet cheeringly , that a bright hope beamed into [Stephen]19-stephen 's mind ; and when [Miss Anne]21-miss anne held out [her]1855-her hand to [him]19-stephen , as a pledge of [her]1855-her promise , [she]1855-her felt a warm tear fall upon it . [He]19-stephen rose up from the ground now , and stood out into the moonlight before [her]1855-her , looking up into [her]1855-her pale face . '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [she]1855-her said , more solemnly than before , '[19-stephen] do [you]19-stephen find it possible to endure this injury and temptation ? ' '[19-stephen] [I]0-i 've been praying for [the master]179-the master , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen ; but there was a tone of bitterness in [his]19-stephen voice , and [his]19-stephen face grew gloomy again . '[0-i] [He]179-the master is [a very miserable man]640-a very miserable man , ' said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , sighing ; '[640-a very miserable man] [I]0-i often hear [him]179-the master walking up and down [[his]179-the master room]641-his room , and crying aloud in the night - time for [God]26-god to have mercy upon [him]179-the master ; but [he]179-the master is a slave to the love of riches . Years ago [he]179-the master might have broken through [his]179-the master chain , but [he]179-the master hugged it closely , and now it presses upon [him]179-the master very hardly . All [his]179-the master love has been given to money , till [he]179-the master can not feel any love to [God]26-god ; and [he]179-the master knows that in a few years [he]179-the master must leave all [he]179-the master loves for ever , and go into eternity without it . [He]179-the master will have no rest to - night because of the injury [he]179-the master has done [you]642-you . [He]179-the master is [a very wretched man]643-a very wretched man , [Stephen]19-stephen . ' '[643-a very wretched man] [I]0-i would n't change with [him]179-the master for all [his]179-the master money , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen pityingly .
