'[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen , ' continued [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[19-stephen] [you]19-stephen say [you]19-stephen pray for [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle , and [I]0-i believe [you]19-stephen do ; but do [you]19-stephen never feel a kind of spite and hatred against [him]338-my uncle in [your]19-stephen very prayers ? Have [you]19-stephen never seemed to enjoy telling [[our]645-us Father]199-our father how very evil [he]338-my uncle is ? ' '[19-stephen] Yes , ' said [the boy]1434-the boy , hanging down [his]1434-the boy head , and wondering how [Miss Anne]21-miss anne could possibly know that . '[19-stephen] Ah , [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [she]21-miss anne continued , '[19-stephen] [God]26-god requires of [us]645-us something more than such prayers . [He]26-god bids [us]645-us really and truly to love [[our]645-us enemies]223-our enemies — love which [He]26-god only can know of , because it is [He]26-god who seeth in secret and into the inmost secrets of [our]645-us hearts . [I]0-i may hear [you]19-stephen pray for [[your]19-stephen enemies]312-your enemies , and see [you]19-stephen try to do [them]312-your enemies good ; but [He]26-god alone can tell whether of a truth [you]19-stephen love [them]312-your enemies . ' '[26-god] [I]0-i can not love [them]312-your enemies as [I]0-i love [you]19-stephen and [little Nan]21-miss anne , ' replied [Stephen]19-stephen . '[19-stephen] Not with the same kind of love , ' said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; '[645-us] in [us]645-us there is something for [your]19-stephen love to take hold of and feed upon . " But if [ye]19-stephen love [them]312-your enemies which love [you]19-stephen , what reward have [ye]19-stephen ? do not even [the publicans]649-the publicans the same ? " [Your]19-stephen affection for [us]645-us is the kind that [sinners]650-sinners can feel ; it is of [this earth]651-this earth , and is earthly . But to love [[our]645-us enemies]223-our enemies is heavenly ; it is [Christ]39-christ - like , for [He]39-christ died for [us]645-us while [we]645-us were yet [sinners]650-sinners . Will [you]19-stephen try to do more than pray for [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle and [Black Thompson]31-black thompson ? Will [you]19-stephen try to love [them]312-your enemies . Will [you]19-stephen try for [Christ]39-christ 's sake ? ' '[19-stephen] Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , how can [I]0-i ? ' [he]0-i asked . '[19-stephen] It may not be all at once , ' [she]21-miss anne answered tenderly ; '[19-stephen] but if [you]19-stephen ask [God]26-god to help [you]19-stephen , [His]26-god Holy Spirit will work within [you]19-stephen . Only set this before [you]19-stephen as [your]19-stephen aim , and resist every other feeling that will creep in ; remembering that [the Lord Jesus]655-the lord jesus [Himself]655-the lord jesus , who died for [us]656-us , said to [us]656-us , " Love [[your]19-stephen enemies]312-your enemies . " [He]655-the lord jesus can feel for [you]19-stephen , for " [He]655-the lord jesus was tempted in all points as [we]656-us are . " ' As [she]21-miss anne spoke the last words , [they]656-us heard [the master]179-the master 's voice calling loudly for [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and [Stephen]19-stephen watched [her]21-miss anne run swiftly up the shrubbery and disappear through the door . There was a great bolting and locking and barring to be heard within , for it was rumoured that [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley kept large sums of money in [[his]36-mr. wyley house]1858-his house , and no place in [the whole country - side]1859-the whole country - side was more securely fastened up by day or night . But [Stephen]19-stephen thought of [him]19-stephen pacing up and down [[his]19-stephen room]641-his room through the sleepless night , praying [God]26-god to have mercy upon [him]19-stephen , yet not willing to give up [his]19-stephen sin ; and as [he]19-stephen turned away to [the poor little cabin on [the cinder - hill]1862-the cinder - hill]1861-the poor little cabin on the cinder - hill , there was more pity than revenge in [the boy]1434-the boy 's heart . The report of the expulsion of [the family]1864-the family from [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]1387-fern 's hollow spread through [Botfield]23-botfield before morning ; and [Stephen]19-stephen found an eager cluster of [men]1482-men , as well as [boys]1326-boys and [girls]573-girls , awaiting [his]19-stephen appearance on [the pit - bank]206-the pit - bank . There was the steady step and glance of [a man about [him]19-stephen when [he]19-stephen came]1870-a man about him when he came — a grave , reserved air , which had an effect upon even [the rough colliers]1871-the rough colliers . [Black Thompson]31-black thompson came forward to shake hands with [him]19-stephen , and [his]19-stephen example was followed by many of [the others]449-the others , with hearty expressions of sympathy and attempts at consolation . '[655-the lord jesus] It 'll be put right some day , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen ; and that was all [they]1482-men could provoke [him]19-stephen to utter . [He]19-stephen went down to [his]19-stephen work ; and , though now and then the recollection thrilled through [him]19-stephen that there was [no pleasant [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]1873-no pleasant fern 's hollow for [him]19-stephen to return to in the evening , [none of [[his]19-stephen comrades]411-his comrades]1874-none of his comrades could betray [him]19-stephen into any expression of resentment against [[his]19-stephen oppressor]1876-his oppressor . In the meantime [Miss Anne]21-miss anne did not forget to visit [the cabin]577-the cabin , and cheer , as well as [she]21-miss anne could , the trouble of [poor [Martha]22-martha , whose good and proud housewifery had kept [[Fern]22-martha 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow cleaner and tidier than any of [the cottages at [Botfield]23-botfield]1879-the cottages at botfield]1878-poor martha , whose good and proud housewifery had kept fern 's hollow cleaner and tidier than any of the cottages at botfield . It was no easy matter to rouse [Martha]22-martha to take any interest in [the miserable cabin where the household furniture had been hastily heaped in the night before]1880-the miserable cabin where the household furniture had been hastily heaped in the night before ; but when [her]21-miss anne heart warmed to the work , in which [Miss Anne]21-miss anne was taking an active part , [she]21-miss anne began to feel something like pleasure in making [the new home]1881-the new home like [the old one]1882-the old one , as far as the interior went . Out of doors , no improvement could be made until soil could be carried up [the barren and steep bank]1883-the barren and steep bank , to make a little plot of garden ground . But within , the work went on so heartily that , when [Stephen]19-stephen returned from [the pit]1478-the pit , half an hour earlier than usual,—for [he]19-stephen had no long walk of two miles now,—he found [[his]19-stephen grandfather]1405-his grandfather settled in the chimney corner , apparently unconscious of any removal , while both [Martha]22-martha and [little Nan]21-miss anne seemed in some measure reconciled to [their]1886-their change of dwelling . Moreover , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne was waiting to greet [him]19-stephen kindly . '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [she]21-miss anne said , '[19-stephen] [Martha]22-martha has found the three notes in [[your]19-stephen grandfather]256-your grandfather 's pocket all safe . [You]19-stephen had better take them with [you]19-stephen to [the clergyman at [Danesford]5-danesford]630-the clergyman at danesford , and do what [he]630-the clergyman at danesford advises [you]19-stephen with [them]660-them . And now [you]19-stephen are come to live at [Botfield]23-botfield , [you]19-stephen can manage to go to [church]661-church every Sunday ; even [little Nan]21-miss anne can go ; and there is [a night - school at [Longville]10-longville]662-a night - school at longville , where [you]19-stephen can learn to write as well as read . It will not be all loss , [[my]0-i boy]253-my boy . ' The opportunity for going to [Danesford]5-danesford was not long in coming , for [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [Cole]33-tim , who were [the chief colliers in [the pit]1478-the pit]1887-the chief colliers in the pit , chose to take a '[19-stephen] play - day ' with [the rest of [[their]1887-the chief colliers in the pit comrades]1890-their comrades]1889-the rest of their comrades ; and [the boys]219-the boys and [girls employed at the works]1892-girls employed at the works were obliged to play also , though it involved the forfeiture of [their]219-the boys day 's wages — always a serious loss to [Stephen]19-stephen . This time , however , [he]19-stephen heard the news gladly ; and , carefully securing the three notes by pinning them inside [his]19-stephen pocket , [he]19-stephen set out for [his]19-stephen ten miles walk across [the tableland]81-the tableland to [the other side of [the mountains]74-the mountains , where [Danesford]5-danesford lay]1894-the other side of the mountains , where danesford lay . [His]19-stephen nearest way led straight by [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , and [he]19-stephen saw that already upon [the old site]1896-the old site the foundation was laid for [a new house containing [three rooms]1898-three rooms]1897-a new house containing three rooms . In everything else the aspect of [the place]177-the place remained unchanged ; there still hung the creaking wicket , where little [Nan]21-miss anne had been wo nt to look for [his]19-stephen coming [home]125-home , until [she]21-miss anne could run with outstretched arms to meet [him]19-stephen . The beehives stood yet beneath the hedge , and the bees were flying to and fro , seeking out the few flowers of the autumn upon [the hillside]1428-the hillside . The fern upon [the uplands]93-the uplands , just behind [the hollow]1903-the hollow , was beginning to die , and its rich red - brown hue showed that it was ready to be cut and carried away for fodder ; but [a squatter from some other hill - hut]1904-a squatter from some other hill - hut had trespassed upon [[Stephen]19-stephen 's old domain]1905-stephen 's old domain . Except [this one man]1906-this one man , [the whole tableland]1907-the whole tableland was deserted ; and so silent was it that the rustle of [his]1906-this one man own feet through the fading ferns sounded like other footsteps following [him]1906-this one man closely . The sheep were not yet driven down into [the valleys]92-the valleys , and [they]1909-they and [the wild ponies]1910-the wild ponies stood and stared boldly at [the solitary boy]1911-the solitary boy , without fleeing from [his]1906-this one man path , as if [they]1909-they had long since forgotten how [the bilberry gatherers]1912-the bilberry gatherers had delighted in frightening [them]1909-they . [Stephen]19-stephen was too grave and manlike to startle [them]1909-they into memory of it , and [he]19-stephen plodded on mile after mile with the three notes in [his]19-stephen pocket and [his]19-stephen hand closed upon them , pondering deeply with what words [he]19-stephen should speak to [the unknown clergyman at [Danesford]5-danesford]1913-the unknown clergyman at danesford . When [he]19-stephen reached [Danesford]5-danesford , [he]19-stephen found [it]5-danesford [a very quiet , sleepy little village]1914-a very quiet , sleepy little village , with [a gleaming river]1915-a gleaming river flowing through [it]5-danesford placidly , and [such respectable houses and [small clean cottages]1917-small clean cottages as put to shame [the dwellings at [Botfield]23-botfield]1918-the dwellings at botfield]1916-such respectable houses and small clean cottages as put to shame the dwellings at botfield . So early was it yet , that [the village children]1919-the village children were only just going to [school]1718-school ; and [the biggest boy]1921-the biggest boy turned back with [Stephen]19-stephen to the gate of [the Rectory]1922-the rectory . [Stephen]19-stephen had never seen so large and grand [a mansion]1923-a mansion , standing far back from [the road]1924-the road , in [a park]1925-a park , through which ran [a carriage drive up to a magnificent portico]1926-a carriage drive up to a magnificent portico . [He]19-stephen stole shyly along [a narrow side path]1927-a narrow side path to the back door , and even there was afraid of knocking ; but when [his]19-stephen low single rap was answered by [a good - tempered - looking girl , not much older than [Martha]22-martha]1928-a good - tempered - looking girl , not much older than martha , [his]19-stephen courage revived , and [he]19-stephen asked , in a straightforward and steady manner , if [he]19-stephen could see [the parson]1929-the parson . At which [the servant]1930-the servant laughed a little , and , after inquiring [his]19-stephen name , said [she]1930-the servant would see if [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood could spare time to speak to [him]19-stephen . Before long [the girl]1931-the girl returned , and led [Stephen]19-stephen through [many winding and twisting passages]1932-many winding and twisting passages , more puzzling than [the roads in [the pit]1478-the pit]1933-the roads in the pit , to [a large , grand room , with windows down to the ground , and looking out upon [a beautiful flower - garden]1936-a beautiful flower - garden]1935-a large , grand room , with windows down to the ground , and looking out upon a beautiful flower - garden . It was like [the palace]1937-the palace [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had spoken of , for [he]19-stephen could not understand half the things that were in [the room]1852-the room ; only [he]19-stephen saw a fire burning in a low grate , the bars of which shone like silver , and upon the carpeted hearth beside it was a sofa , where [a young lady]1585-a young lady was lying , and near to it was a breakfast - table , at which [an elderly gentleman]1940-an elderly gentleman was seated alone . [He]19-stephen was [a very keen , shrewd - looking man]1941-a very keen , shrewd - looking man , and very pleasant to look at when [he]19-stephen smiled ; and [he]19-stephen smiled upon [Stephen]19-stephen , as [he]19-stephen stood awe - struck and speechless at [his]19-stephen own daring in coming to speak to [such a gentleman]1942-such a gentleman , and in such a place as this . '[19-stephen] So [you]664-you are [Stephen Fern]19-stephen , of [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , ' said [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood ; '[19-stephen] [I]0-i remember christening [you]664-you , and giving [you]664-you [my]0-i own name , thirteen or fourteen years since , is n't it ? [[Your]664-you mother]166-your mother had been [[my]0-i faithful servant]666-my faithful servant for several years ; and [she]166-your mother brought [you]664-you all across [the hills]82-the hills to [Danesford]5-danesford to be christened . Is [she]166-your mother well — [[my]0-i good [Sarah Moore]50-sarah moore]668-my good sarah moore ? ' '[166-your mother] [Mother]167-mother died four years ago , [sir]264-sir , ' murmured [Stephen]19-stephen , unable to say any more . '[671-poor boy] [Poor boy]671-poor boy ! ' said [the young lady on the sofa]1943-the young lady on the sofa . '[671-poor boy] [Father]28-father , is there anything [we]672-we can do for [him]671-poor boy ? ' '[28-father] That is what [I]0-i am going to hear , [[my]0-i child]673-my child , ' replied [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood . '[0-i] [Stephen]19-stephen has not come over [the hills]82-the hills without some errand . Now , [[my]0-i boy]253-my boy , speak out plainly and boldly , and let [me]0-i hear what has brought [you]253-my boy to [[your]253-my boy mother 's old master]676-your mother 's old master . ' Thus encouraged , [Stephen]19-stephen , with the utmost simplicity and frankness , though with fewer words than [Martha]22-martha would have put into the narrative , told [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood the whole history of [his]19-stephen life ; to which [the clergyman]1456-the clergyman listened with ever - increasing interest , as [he]1456-the clergyman noticed how [the boy]1434-the boy was telling all the truth , and nothing but the truth , even to [his]1434-the boy joining [Black Thompson]31-black thompson in poaching . When [he]19-stephen had finished , [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood went to a large cabinet in [the room]1852-the room , and , bringing out a bundle of old yellow documents , soon found among them the paper [James Fern]20-james fern had spoken of on [his]20-james fern death - bed . It was written by [the clergyman living in [Longville]10-longville]1947-the clergyman living in longville at the time of [old Martha Fern]22-martha 's death , to certify that [she]22-martha had settled , and maintained [her]22-martha settlement on [the hillside]1428-the hillside , without paying rent , or having [[her]22-martha fences]1949-her fences destroyed , for upwards of twenty years , and that [the land]1319-the land was [her]22-martha own by the usages of the common . '[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what use it will be , ' said [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood , '[0-i] but [I]0-i will take legal advice upon it ; that is , [I]0-i will tell [[my]0-i lawyer]677-my lawyer all about it , and see what [we]678-we had best do . [You]679-you may leave the case in [my]0-i hands , [Stephen]19-stephen . But to - morrow morning [we]678-we start for [the south of [France]15-france , where [[my]0-i daughter]681-my daughter must live all the winter for the benefit of the warm climate]680-the south of france , where my daughter must live all the winter for the benefit of the warm climate ; and [I]0-i must go with [her]681-my daughter , for [she]681-my daughter is [my]0-i only treasure now . Can [you]679-you live in [[your]679-you cabin]682-your cabin till [we]678-we come [home]125-home ? Will [you]679-you trust [yourself]679-you to [me]0-i , [Stephen]19-stephen ? [I]0-i will not see [a son of [[my]0-i old servant]685-my old servant]684-a son of my old servant wronged . ' '[0-i] Please , [sir]264-sir , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[0-i] [the cabin]577-the cabin is good enough for [us]678-we , and [we]678-we are nearer [church]661-church and [the night - school]689-the night - school ; only [I]0-i did n't like to break [my]0-i word to [father]1396-father , besides losing [the old home]691-the old home : [we]678-we can stay all winter well . [I]0-i 'll trust [you]264-sir , [sir]264-sir ; but [my]0-i work is dangersome , and please [God]26-god [I]0-i should get killed , will [you]264-sir do the same for [Martha]22-martha and [little Nan]21-miss anne ? ' '[264-sir] Ay ! ' answered [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood , coughing down [his]49-mr. lockwood emotion at [the young boy]1951-the young boy 's forethought and care for [[his]1951-the young boy sisters]1952-his sisters . '[264-sir] If it pleases [God]26-god , [[my]0-i boy]253-my boy , [you]253-my boy will live to make [a right good , true - hearted Christian man]694-a right good , true - hearted christian man ; but if [He]695-he should take [you]253-my boy [home]125-home before [me]0-i , [I]0-i 'll befriend [[your]253-my boy sisters]697-your sisters as long as [I]0-i live . [I]0-i like [your]253-my boy Miss [Anne]21-miss anne , [Stephen]19-stephen ; but [[your]253-my boy master]698-your master is [a terrible rascal]699-a terrible rascal , [I]0-i fear . ' '[699-a terrible rascal] Yes , [sir]264-sir , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen quietly . '[264-sir] [You]253-my boy do n't say much about [him]698-your master , however , ' replied [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood , smiling at [his]19-stephen few words . '[253-my boy] Please , [sir]264-sir , [I]0-i am trying to love [[my]0-i enemies]702-my enemies , ' [he]0-i answered , with a feeling of shyness ; '[0-i] if [I]0-i was to call [him]698-your master [a rascal]703-a rascal , or any other bad word , it ' ud throw [me]703-a rascal back like , and it 's very hard work anyhow . [I]703-a rascal feel as if [I]703-a rascal 'd like to do it sometimes . '[703-a rascal] ' [You]19-stephen are right , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[49-mr. lockwood] said [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood ; ' [you]19-stephen are wise in keeping [your]19-stephen tongue from evil speaking : for " therewith bless [we]1953-we [God]26-god , even [the Father]1954-the father ; and therewith curse [[we]1953-we men]1955-we men , which are made after the similitude of [God]26-god . Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing . " [You]19-stephen have taught [an old parson]1956-an old parson a lesson , [[my]49-mr. lockwood boy]253-my boy . [You]19-stephen had better leave [your]19-stephen money with [me]49-mr. lockwood until [[my]49-mr. lockwood lawyer]677-my lawyer gives [us]1953-we [his]677-my lawyer opinion . Now go [home]125-home in peace , and serve [[your]19-stephen master]698-your master faithfully ; but if [you]19-stephen should need [a friend]1961-a friend before [I]49-mr. lockwood return , come here and ask for [the clergyman who is going to take [my]49-mr. lockwood duty]1962-the clergyman who is going to take my duty . [I]49-mr. lockwood will tell [him]1962-the clergyman who is going to take my duty about [you]19-stephen , and [he]1962-the clergyman who is going to take my duty will help [you]19-stephen until [I]49-mr. lockwood come [home]125-home . '[49-mr. lockwood] That afternoon [Stephen]19-stephen retraced [his]19-stephen lonely path across [the hills]82-the hills in great gladness of heart ; and when [he]19-stephen came to [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , [he]19-stephen leaped lightly down the bank against which the old stove - pipe had been reared as a chimney , and stood again on the site of the old hearth , in the midst of the new walls of red bricks that were being built up . How [the master]179-the master could remove [the new house]196-the new house and restore [the old hut]1536-the old hut was a question of some perplexity to [him]179-the master ; but [his]179-the master confidence in [the parson at [Danesford]5-danesford]183-the parson at danesford was so perfect , that [he]179-the master did not doubt for a moment that [he]179-the master could call [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow [his]179-the master own again next spring . [Everybody at [Botfield]23-botfield]709-everybody at botfield was astonished at the change in [Stephen]19-stephen 's manner ; so cheerful was [he]19-stephen , and light - hearted , as if [his]19-stephen brief manhood had passed away , with its burden of cares and anxieties , and [his]19-stephen boyish freedom and gladsomeness had come back again . The secret cause remained undiscovered ; for [Martha]22-martha , fluent in tongue as [she]22-martha was , had enough discretion to keep [her]22-martha own counsel , and seal up [her]22-martha lips as close as wax , when it was necessary . [The people]1468-the people puzzled [themselves]1468-the people in vain ; and [Black Thompson]31-black thompson left off hinting at revenge to [Stephen]19-stephen . Even [the master]179-the master , when [the boy]1434-the boy passed [him]179-the master with a respectful bow , in which there was nothing of resentment or sullenness , wondered how [he]179-the master could so soon forget the great injury [he]179-the master had suffered . [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley would have been better satisfied if [the whole family]1438-the whole family could have been driven out of [the neighbourhood]246-the neighbourhood ; but there was no knowing what ugly rumours and inquiries might be set afloat , if [the boy]1434-the boy went telling [his]1434-the boy tale to [nobody]147-nobody knows whom . Upon the whole , [Martha]22-martha did not very much regret [her]22-martha change of dwelling , though [she]22-martha made a great virtue of [her]22-martha patience in submitting quietly to it . To be sure , [the cinder - hill]1862-the cinder - hill was unsightly , and [the cabin]577-the cabin blackened with smoke ; and it was necessary to lock [little Nan]21-miss anne and [grandfather]1397-grandfather safely within [the house]1347-the house whenever [she]22-martha went out , lest [they]721-they should get to the mouth of [the open shaft]722-the open shaft , where [Stephen]19-stephen often amused [the child]1568-the child by throwing stones down it , and listening to [their]721-they rebound against the sides . But still [Martha]22-martha had [near neighbours]724-near neighbours ; and until now [she]22-martha had hardly even tasted the luxury of a thorough gossip , which [she]22-martha could enjoy in [any one of [the cottages throughout [Botfield]23-botfield]726-the cottages throughout botfield]725-any one of the cottages throughout botfield . Moreover , [she]22-martha could get work for [herself]22-martha on three days in the week , to help [a washerwoman]727-a washerwoman , who gave [her]22-martha ninepence a day , besides letting [little Nan]21-miss anne go with [her]22-martha , and have , as [she]22-martha said , ' the run of [her]21-miss anne teeth . '[22-martha] [She]22-martha had [[her]22-martha admirers]728-her admirers , too — [young collier lads]729-young collier lads , who told [her]22-martha truly enough [she]22-martha was [the cleanest , neatest , tidiest lass in all [Botfield]23-botfield]730-the cleanest , neatest , tidiest lass in all botfield . So [Martha Fern]22-martha regarded [[their]731-we residence on [the cinder - hill]1862-the cinder - hill]732-their residence on the cinder - hill with more complacency than could have been expected . The only circumstance which in [her]22-martha secret heart [she]22-martha considered a serious drawback was [her]22-martha very near neighbourhood to [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . ' [Stephen]19-stephen , '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha one Saturday night , after [their]731-we work was done , ' [I]22-martha 've been thinking how it 's only [thee]734-thee that 's trying to keep the commandments . [I]22-martha 'm[22-martha] not such a scholar as [thee]734-thee ; but [I]0-i 've heard [thy]734-thee chapter read till it 's in [my]0-i head , as well as if [I]0-i could read it off book [myself]0-i . So [I]0-i 'm thinking [I]0-i ought to love [[my]0-i enemies]702-my enemies as well as [thee]734-thee ; and [I]0-i 've asked [Black Bess]23-botfield to come and have a cup of tea with [us]731-we to - morrow . '[0-i] ' [Black Bess]23-botfield ! '[19-stephen] exclaimed [Stephen]19-stephen , with a feeling of some displeasure . ' Ah , '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha , ' [she]23-botfield 's always calling [me]22-martha — a shame to be heard . But [I]22-martha 've quite forgiven [her]23-botfield ; and to - morrow [I]22-martha 'll let [her]23-botfield see [I]22-martha can make pikelets as well as [[her]23-botfield mother]1965-her mother ; and [we]731-we 'll have out the three china cups ; only [grandfather]1397-grandfather and [little Nan]21-miss anne must have common ones . [I]22-martha thought [I]22-martha 'd better tell [thee]23-botfield ; and then [thee'lt]23-botfield make haste [home]125-home from [church]661-church in the afternoon . '[22-martha] ' [Black Bess]23-botfield is n't a good friend for [thee]23-botfield , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen , who was better acquainted with [the pit - girl]735-the pit - girl 's character than was [Martha]22-martha , and felt troubled at the idea of any companionship between [them]736-them . ' But [we]731-we are to love [[our]731-we enemies]223-our enemies , '[22-martha] persisted [Martha]22-martha , ' and do good to [them]223-our enemies that hate [us]731-we . At any rate [I]22-martha asked [her]23-botfield , and [she]23-botfield said [she]23-botfield 'd come . '[22-martha] ' [I]19-stephen do n't think it means [we]731-we are to ask [[our]731-we enemies]223-our enemies to tea , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , in perplexity . ' If [she]23-botfield was badly off , like , and in want of a meal 's meat , it '[19-stephen] ud be another thing ; [I]0-i 'd do it gladly . And on a Sunday too ! Oh , [Martha]22-martha , it does n't seem right . ' '[22-martha] Oh , nothing 's right that [I]0-i do ! ' replied [Martha]22-martha pettishly ; '[737-thee] [thee'rt]737-thee afraid [I]0-i 'll get as good as [thee]737-thee , and then [thee]737-thee can not crow over [me]0-i . But [I]0-i 'll not spend a farthing of [thy]737-thee money , depend upon it . [I]0-i 'm not without some shillings of [my]19-stephen own , [I]19-stephen reckon . [Thee]737-thee should let [me]19-stephen love [[my]19-stephen enemies]702-my enemies as well as [thee]737-thee , [I]19-stephen think ; but [thee'lt]737-thee want to go up to [heaven]226-heaven alone next . '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen said no more , though [Martha]22-martha continued talking peevishly about [Black Bess]23-botfield . [She]22-martha was not at all satisfied in [her]22-martha own mind that [she]22-martha was doing right ; but [Bess]23-botfield had met [her]22-martha at [[a neighbour]738-a neighbour 's house]739-a neighbour 's house , where [she]23-botfield was boasting of [her]23-botfield skill in making pikelets , and [she]23-botfield had been drawn out by [her]23-botfield sneers and mocking to give [her]23-botfield a kind of challenge to come and taste them . [She]22-martha wanted now to make [herself]22-martha and [Stephen]19-stephen believe that [she]22-martha was doing it out of love and forgiveness towards poor [Bess]23-botfield ; but [she]22-martha could not succeed in the deception . All the Sunday morning [she]22-martha was bustling about , and sadly chafing [the grandfather]1472-the grandfather by making [him]1472-the grandfather move hither and thither out of the way . It was quite a new experience to have [any one]138-any one coming to tea ; and all [her]22-martha hospitable and housekeeping feelings were greatly excited by the approaching event . When [Stephen]19-stephen , with tired little [Nan]21-miss anne riding on [his]19-stephen shoulder , returned from [church]661-church in the afternoon , [they]743-they found [Bess]23-botfield had arrived , and was sitting in the warmest corner , close to a very large and blazing fire , which filled [the cabin with light and heat]744-the cabin with light and heat . [Bess]23-botfield had dressed [herself]23-botfield up in [her]23-botfield best attire , in a bright red stuff gown , and with yellow ribbons tied in [her]23-botfield hair , which had been brought to a degree of smoothness wonderful to [Stephen]19-stephen , who saw [her]23-botfield daily on [the pit - bank]206-the pit - bank . [She]23-botfield had washed [her]23-botfield face and hands with so much care as to leave broad stripes of grime round [her]23-botfield neck and wrists , partly concealed by a necklace and bracelets of glass beads ; and [her]23-botfield green apron was marvellously braided in a large pattern . [Martha]22-martha , in [her]22-martha clean print dress , and white handkerchief pinned round [her]22-martha throat , was a pleasant contrast to [the tawdry girl]746-the tawdry girl , who looked wildly at [Stephen]19-stephen as [he]19-stephen entered , as if [she]22-martha scarcely knew what to do . ' Good evening , [Bess]23-botfield , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said , as pleasantly as [he]19-stephen could . ' [Martha]22-martha told [me]19-stephen [thee]1973-thee was coming to eat some pikelets with [her]22-martha , so [I]19-stephen asked [Tim]33-tim to come too ; and after tea [we]1974-we 'll have some rare singing . [I]19-stephen often hear [thee]23-botfield on [the bank]1975-the bank , [Bess]23-botfield , and [thee]23-botfield has a good voice . '[19-stephen] [Bess]23-botfield coloured with pleasure , and evidently tried [her]23-botfield best to be amiable and well - mannered , sitting up nearer and nearer to the fire until [her]23-botfield face shone as red as [her]23-botfield dress with the heat . [Martha]22-martha moved triumphantly about [the house]1347-the house , setting the tea - table , upon which [she]22-martha placed the three china cups , with a gratified glance at the undisguised admiration of [Bess]23-botfield ; though three common ones had to be laid beside [them]748-them , for , as [Tim]33-tim was coming , [Stephen]19-stephen must fare like [grandfather]1397-grandfather and [little Nan]21-miss anne . As soon as [Tim]33-tim arrived , [she]23-botfield was very busy beating up the batter for the pikelets , and then baking them over the fire ; and very soon [the little party]750-the little party were sitting down to [their]750-the little party feast — [Bess]23-botfield declaring politely , between each piece pressed upon [her]23-botfield by [Martha]22-martha , that [she]23-botfield had never tasted such pikelets , never ! At last , when tea was quite finished , and the table carefully lifted back to a safe corner at the foot of the bed , though [Martha]22-martha prudently replaced the china cups in the cupboard , [Tim]33-tim and [Stephen]19-stephen drew up [their]748-them stools to the front of the fire , and a significant glance passed between [them]748-them . ' Now then , [Stevie]19-stephen , '[33-tim] said [Tim]33-tim , ' [thee]19-stephen learn [me]33-tim the new hymn [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sings with [us]1976-us ; and let ['s]1976-us teach [Bess]23-botfield to sing too . '[33-tim] [Bess]23-botfield looked round uneasily , as if [she]23-botfield found [herself]23-botfield caught in a trap ; but , as [Tim]33-tim burst off loudly into a hymn tune , in which [Stephen]19-stephen joined at the top of [his]19-stephen voice , [she]23-botfield had no time to make any objection . [Martha]22-martha and [the old grandfather]512-the old grandfather , who had been [a capital singer]752-a capital singer in [his]512-the old grandfather day , began to help ; and [little Nan]21-miss anne mingled [her]21-miss anne sweet , clear , childish notes with their stronger tones . It was a long hymn , and , before it was finished , [Bess]23-botfield found [herself]23-botfield shyly humming away to the tune , almost as if it had been the chorus of one of the pit - bank songs . [They]753-they sang more and more , until [she]23-botfield joined in boldly , and whispered to [Martha]22-martha that [she]23-botfield wished [she]23-botfield knew the words , so as to sing with them . But the crowning pleasure of the evening was when [little Nan]21-miss anne , sitting on [Stephen]19-stephen 's knee , with [his]19-stephen fingers stroking [her]21-miss anne curly hair , sang by [herself]21-miss anne a new hymn for [little children]754-little children , which [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had been teaching [her]21-miss anne . [She]21-miss anne could not say the words very plainly , but [her]21-miss anne voice was sweet , and [she]21-miss anne looked so lovely with [her]21-miss anne tiny hands softly folded , and [her]21-miss anne eyes lifted up steadily to [Stephen]19-stephen 's face , that at last [Black Bess]23-botfield burst out into a loud and long fit of crying , and wept so bitterly that none of [them]753-they could comfort [her]23-botfield , until [the little child]1824-the little child [herself]1824-the little child , who had been afraid of [her]23-botfield before , climbed upon [her]23-botfield lap and laid [her]1824-the little child arms round [her]23-botfield neck . [She]21-miss anne looked up then , and wiped the tears from [her]21-miss anne face with the corner of [her]21-miss anne fine apron . ' [I]21-miss anne had [a sister]1977-a sister once , just like [little Nan]21-miss anne , '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne said , with a sob , ' and [she]1977-a sister minded [me]21-miss anne of [her]756-she . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne told [me]21-miss anne [she]756-she was singing somewhere among the angels , and [I]21-miss anne thought [she]756-she 'd look like [little Nan]21-miss anne . But [I]21-miss anne 'm[21-miss anne] afraid [I]0-i shall never go where [she]756-she is ; [I]0-i 'm so bad . '[21-miss anne] ' [We]1978-we 'll teach [thee]1979-thee how to be good , '[22-martha] answered [Martha]22-martha . ' [Thee]1979-thee come to [me]21-miss anne , [Bess]23-botfield , and [I]21-miss anne 'll teach [thee]1979-thee the hymns , and the singing , and how to make pikelets , and keep [the house]1347-the house clean on a week - day . [I]21-miss anne 'm[21-miss anne] going to love [[my]0-i enemies]702-my enemies , and do good to [them]702-my enemies that hate [me]0-i ; so do n't [thee]758-thee be shy - like . [We]759-we 'll be [friends]760-friends like [Stephen]19-stephen and [Tim]33-tim ; and were n't [they]702-my enemies [enemies]761-enemies afore [Stephen]19-stephen learned to read ? ' That night , as [Stephen]19-stephen lay down to sleep , [he]19-stephen said to [himself]19-stephen , '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm glad [Black Bess]23-botfield came to eat pikelets with [Martha]22-martha . [My]761-enemies chapter says , " Whosoever shall do the commandments , and teach them , the same shall be called great in [the kingdom of [heaven]226-heaven]354-the kingdom of heaven . " Perhaps [Martha]22-martha and [me]761-enemies will be called great in heaven , if [we]1983-we teach [Bess]23-botfield how to do [God]26-god 's commandments . '[761-enemies] [Black Bess]23-botfield began to visit [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin very often . But there was a fatal mistake , which poor [Stephen]19-stephen , in [his]19-stephen simplicity and single - heartedness , was a long time in discovering . [Martha]22-martha [herself]22-martha had not truly set out on the path of obedience to [God]26-god 's commandments ; and it was not possible that [she]22-martha could teach [Bess]23-botfield how to keep them . [A Christian]419-a christian can not be like a finger - post , which only points the way to [a place]764-a place , but never goes [there itself]765-there itself . [She]22-martha could teach [Bess]23-botfield the words of the hymn , and the tunes they were sung to ; but [she]22-martha could tell [her]22-martha nothing of the feeling of praise and love to the Saviour with which [Stephen]19-stephen sang them , and out of which all true obedience must flow . With [her]22-martha lips [she]22-martha could say , ' Blessed are [the poor in spirit]1984-the poor in spirit , '[22-martha] and ' Blessed are the meek , '[22-martha] and ' Blessed are [they]766-they that do hunger and thirst after righteousness ; '[22-martha] but [she]22-martha cared for none of these things , and felt none of [their]766-they blessedness in [her]22-martha own soul ; and [Bess]23-botfield very quickly found out that [she]22-martha would far rather talk about other matters . And because [our]767-our hearts , which are foolish , and deceitful above all things , and desperately wicked , soon grow weary of good , but are ever ready to delight in evil , it came to pass that , instead of [Martha]22-martha teaching [poor ignorant Bess]23-botfield how to do [God]26-god 's will , [Bess]23-botfield was leading [her]22-martha into all sorts of folly and wickedness . It would be no very easy task to describe how unhappy [Stephen]19-stephen was when , from day to day , [he]19-stephen saw [Martha]22-martha 's pleasant sisterly ways change into a rude and careless harshness , and [her]22-martha thrifty , cleanly habits give place to the dirty extravagance of [the collier - folk]768-the collier - folk at [Botfield]23-botfield . But who could tell how [he]19-stephen suffered in [his]19-stephen warm , tender - hearted nature , when [he]19-stephen came [home]125-home at night , and found [the poor old grandfather]1465-the poor old grandfather neglected , and left desolate in [his]1465-the poor old grandfather blindness ; and [little Nan]21-miss anne [herself]21-miss anne severely punished by [Martha]22-martha 's unkindness and quick temper ? Not that [Martha]22-martha became bad suddenly , or was always unkind and neglectful ; there were times when [she]22-martha was [her]22-martha old self again , when [she]22-martha would listen patiently enough to [Stephen]19-stephen 's remonstrances and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's gentle teaching ; but yet [Stephen]19-stephen could never feel sure , when [he]19-stephen was at [[his]19-stephen dismal toil underground]771-his dismal toil underground , that all things were going on right in [[his]19-stephen home]1385-his home overhead . Often and often , as [he]19-stephen looked up to [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow , where [the new red - brick house]774-the new red - brick house was now to be seen plainly , like [a city set]775-a city set on [a hill]776-a hill]773-fern 's hollow , where the new red - brick house was now to be seen plainly , like a city set on a hill , [he]19-stephen longed to be back again , and counted the months and weeks until the spring should bring [home]125-home [the good clergyman]778-the good clergyman to [Danesford]5-danesford . One day , during the time allowed to [the pit - girls]779-the pit - girls for eating [their]779-the pit - girls dinner , [Bess]23-botfield came running over [the cinderhills]780-the cinderhills in breathless haste to [the old cabin]550-the old cabin . [Martha]22-martha had been busy all the morning , and was still standing at the washing - tub ; but [she]22-martha was glad of an excuse for resting [herself]22-martha , and when [Bess]23-botfield sprang over the door - sill , [she]23-botfield received [her]22-martha very cordially . ' [Martha]22-martha ! [Martha]22-martha ! '[23-botfield] cried [Bess]23-botfield ; ' come away quickly . Here 's [[Andrew]51-andrew the packman in [the lane]1614-the lane]1985-andrew the packman in the lane , with such shawls , [Martha]22-martha ! Blue and red and yellow and green ! Only five shillings a - piece ; and [thee]22-martha canst pay [him]51-andrew a shilling a week . Come along , and be sharp with [thee]22-martha . '[23-botfield] ' [I]22-martha 've got no money to spend , '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha sullenly . ' [Stephen]19-stephen ought to let [grandfather]1397-grandfather go into [the House]1347-the house , and then [we]1989-we should n't be so pinched . What with buying for [him]51-andrew and [little Nan]21-miss anne , [I]22-martha 've hardly a brass farthing in [the world]1665-the world for [myself]22-martha . '[22-martha] ' [I]23-botfield 'd not pinch , '[23-botfield] [Bess]23-botfield answered ; ' let [Stephen]19-stephen pinch if [he]19-stephen will . Why , [all the lads in [Botfield]23-botfield]1991-all the lads in botfield are making a mock at [thee]22-martha , calling [thee]22-martha [an old - fashioned piece]1992-an old - fashioned piece and [Granny Fern]52-granny fern . But come and look , anyhow ; [Andrew]51-andrew will be gone directly . '[23-botfield] [Bess]23-botfield dragged [Martha]22-martha by the arm to the top of [the cinder - hill]1862-the cinder - hill , where [they]783-they could see [the pit - girls]779-the pit - girls clustering round [the packman]785-the packman in [the lane]1614-the lane . The black linen wrapper in which [his]785-the packman pack was carried was stretched along the hedge , and upon it was spread a great show of bright - coloured shawls and dresses , and [the girls]787-the girls were flitting from one to another , closely examining [their]787-the girls quality ; while [[Andrew]51-andrew 's wife]788-andrew 's wife walked up and down , exhibiting each shawl by turns upon [her]788-andrew 's wife shoulders . The temptation was too strong for [Martha]22-martha ; [she]22-martha wiped the soap - suds from [her]22-martha arms upon [her]22-martha apron , and ran as eagerly down to [the lane]1614-the lane as [Black Bess]23-botfield [herself]23-botfield . ' Eh ! here 's [a clean , tight lass]1993-a clean , tight lass for [you]22-martha ! '[51-andrew] cried [Andrew]51-andrew , comparing [Martha]22-martha with [the begrimed pit - girls about [him]785-the packman]790-the begrimed pit - girls about him . ' The best shawl in [my]22-martha pack is n't good enough for [you]22-martha , [[my]22-martha dear]1994-my dear . Pick and choose . Just make [your]22-martha own choice , and [I]22-martha 'll accommodate [you]22-martha about the price . '[22-martha] ' [I]22-martha 've got no money , '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha . ' Oh , [you]22-martha and [me'll]51-andrew not quarrel about money , '[51-andrew] replied [Andrew]51-andrew ; ' [you]22-martha make [your]22-martha choice , and [I]51-andrew 'll wait [your]22-martha time . [I]51-andrew 'm[51-andrew] coming [my]0-i rounds pretty regular , and [you]22-martha can put up a shilling or two agen [I]0-i come , without letting on to [father]1396-father . But maybe [you]22-martha 're married , [[my]22-martha dear]1994-my dear ? '[22-martha] ' No , '[22-martha] [she]22-martha answered , blushing . ' It 's not far off , [I]51-andrew 'll be bound , '[51-andrew] [he]51-andrew continued , ' and with a shawl like this , now , [you]22-martha 'd look like a full - blown rose . Come , [I]51-andrew 'll not be hard upon [you]22-martha , as it 's the first time [you]22-martha 've dealt with [me]51-andrew . That shawl 's worth ten shillings if it 's worth a farthing , and [I]51-andrew 'll let [you]22-martha have it for seven shillings and sixpence ; half a crown down , and a shilling a fortnight till it 's paid up . '[51-andrew] [Andrew]51-andrew threw the shawl over [her]22-martha shoulders , and turned [her]22-martha round to the envying view of [the assembled girls]792-the assembled girls , who were not allowed to touch any of [his]51-andrew goods with [their]792-the assembled girls soiled hands . [Martha]22-martha softly stroked the bright blue border , and felt its texture between [her]22-martha fingers ; while [she]22-martha deliberated within [herself]22-martha whether [she]22-martha could not buy it from the fund procured by the bilberry picking in the autumn . As [Stephen]19-stephen had never known the full amount , [she]22-martha could withdraw the half - crown without [his]19-stephen knowledge , and the sixpence a week [she]22-martha could save out of [her]22-martha own earnings . In ten minutes , while [Andrew]51-andrew was bargaining with [some of [the others]449-the others]793-some of the others , [she]22-martha came to the conclusion that [she]22-martha could not possibly do any longer without a new shawl ; so , telling [the packman]785-the packman that [she]22-martha would be back again directly , [she]22-martha ran as swiftly as [she]22-martha could over [the cinder - hill homewards]796-the cinder - hill homewards . In [her]22-martha hurry to accompany [Bess]23-botfield to [the lane]1614-the lane , [she]22-martha had left [her]22-martha cabin door unfastened , never thinking of the danger of the open pit to [[her]22-martha blind grandfather]798-her blind grandfather and [the child]1568-the child . [Little Nan]34-little nan had been wearying all morning for a run in the wintry sunshine , out of the close steam of washing in [the small hut]800-the small hut ; but [Martha]22-martha had not dared to let [her]34-little nan run about alone , as [she]22-martha had been used to do at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , in [[their]801-their safe garden]802-their safe garden . After [Martha]22-martha and [Black Bess]23-botfield had left [her]34-little nan , [the child]1568-the child stood looking wistfully through the open door for some time ; but at last [she]22-martha ventured over the door - sill , and [her]22-martha tiny feet painfully climbed the frozen bank behind [the house]1347-the house , whence [she]22-martha could see [the group of girls in [the lane below]806-the lane below]805-the group of girls in the lane below . Perhaps [she]22-martha would have found [her]22-martha way down to [them]805-the group of girls in the lane below , but [Martha]22-martha had been cross with [her]34-little nan all the morning , and [the child]1568-the child 's little spirit was frightened with [her]22-martha scolding . [She]22-martha turned back to [the cabin]577-the cabin , sobbing , for the north wind blew coldly upon [her]22-martha ; and then [she]22-martha must have caught sight of [the shaft]1492-the shaft , where [Stephen]19-stephen had been throwing stones down for [her]22-martha the night before , without a thought of [the little one trying to pursue the dangerous game alone]810-the little one trying to pursue the dangerous game alone . As [Martha]22-martha came over [the cinder - hill]1862-the cinder - hill , [her]22-martha eyes fell upon [little Nan]21-miss anne , rosy , laughing , screaming with delight as [her]21-miss anne tiny hands lifted a large stone high above [her]21-miss anne curly head , while [she]21-miss anne bent over the unguarded margin of [the pit]1478-the pit . But before [Martha]22-martha could move in [her]22-martha agony of terror , the heavy stone dropped from [her]22-martha small fingers , and [Nan]21-miss anne , [little Nan]21-miss anne , with [her]21-miss anne rosy , laughing face , had fallen after it . [Martha]22-martha never forgot that moment . As if with a sudden awaking of memory , there flashed across [her]22-martha mind all [the child]1568-the child 's simple , winning ways . [She]22-martha seemed to see [[her]22-martha dying mother]814-her dying mother again , laying [the helpless baby]815-the helpless baby in [her]814-her dying mother arms , and bidding [her]22-martha to be [a mother]816-a mother to it . [She]22-martha heard [[her]22-martha father]1395-her father 's last charge to take care of little [Nan]21-miss anne , when [he]1395-her father also was passing away . [Her]22-martha own wicked carelessness and neglect , [Stephen]19-stephen 's terrible sorrow if [little Nan]21-miss anne should be dead , all the woeful consequences of [her]22-martha fault , were stamped upon [her]22-martha heart with a sudden and very bitter stroke . [Those who were watching [her]22-martha from [the lane]1614-the lane]818-those who were watching her from the lane saw [her]22-martha stand as if transfixed for a moment ; and then a piercing scream , which made [every one within hearing]820-every one within hearing start with terror , rang through the frosty air , as [Martha]22-martha sprang forward to the mouth of [the old pit]821-the old pit , and , peering down [its]821-the old pit dark and narrow depths , could just discern [a little white figure lying motionless at the bottom of the shaft]822-a little white figure lying motionless at the bottom of the shaft . In a very short time [all the people at work on the surface of the mine]823-all the people at work on the surface of the mine knew that [[Stephen Fern]19-stephen 's little sister]824-stephen fern 's little sister was dead — lying dead in the very pit where [he]19-stephen was then labouring for [her]824-stephen fern 's little sister , with the spirit and strength and love of [a father]825-a father rather than [a brother]826-a brother . Every face was overcast and grave ; and [many of [the boys]219-the boys and [girls]573-girls]827-many of the boys and girls were weeping , for [little Nan]21-miss anne had endeared [herself]21-miss anne to [them]827-many of the boys and girls all since [she]21-miss anne came to live at [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . [Tim]33-tim felt faint and heart - sick , almost wishing [he]33-tim could have perished in [the child]1568-the child 's stead , for poor [Stephen]19-stephen 's sake ; but [he]33-tim had to rouse [himself]33-tim , for [one of [the banksmen]575-the banksmen]832-one of the banksmen was going to shout the terrible tidings down the shaft ; and if [Stephen]19-stephen should be near , instead of being at work farther in [the pit]1478-the pit , the words would fall upon [him]19-stephen without any softening or preparation . [He]33-tim implored [them]827-many of the boys and girls to wait until [he]33-tim could run and tell [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; but while [he]33-tim was speaking [they]827-many of the boys and girls saw [Miss Anne]21-miss anne [herself]21-miss anne coming towards [the pit]1478-the pit , [her]21-miss anne face very pale and sorrowful , for the rumour had reached [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house , and [she]21-miss anne was hastening to meet [Stephen]19-stephen , and comfort [him]19-stephen , if that were possible . ' Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ! '[33-tim] cried [Tim]33-tim ; ' it will kill [poor Stephen]19-stephen , if it come upon [him]19-stephen sudden like . [I]33-tim know the way through [the old pit]821-the old pit to where [poor little Nan]21-miss anne has fallen ; and [I]33-tim 'll go and find [her]21-miss anne . The roof 's dropped in , and only [a boy]176-a boy could creep along . But who 's to tell [Stevie]19-stephen ? Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , could n't [you]21-miss anne go down with [me]33-tim , and tell [him]19-stephen gently [[your]21-miss anne own self]1998-your own self ? '[33-tim] ' Yes , [I]21-miss anne will go , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , weeping . [Underground]838-underground , in [those low , dark , pent - up galleries]839-those low , dark , pent - up galleries , lighted only here and there by a glimmering lamp , [the colliers]1372-the colliers were busy at [their]1372-the colliers labours , unconscious of all that was happening overhead . [Stephen]19-stephen was at work at some distance from the others , loading [a train of small square waggons]841-a train of small square waggons with the blocks of coal which [he]19-stephen and [Black Thompson]31-black thompson had picked out of [the earth]130-the earth . [He]19-stephen was singing softly to [himself]19-stephen the hymns that [he]19-stephen and [little Nan]21-miss anne had been learning during the summer in [the Red Gravel Pit]364-the red gravel pit ; and [he]19-stephen smiled as [he]19-stephen fancied that [little Nan]21-miss anne was perhaps singing them over as well by the cabin fire . [He]19-stephen did not know , [poor boy]671-poor boy , that at that moment [Tim]33-tim was creeping through [the winding , blocked - up passages]845-the winding , blocked - up passages , so long untrodden , to the bottom of [the old shaft]846-the old shaft ; and that when [he]33-tim returned [he]33-tim would be bearing in [his]33-tim arms a sad , sad burden , upon which [his]33-tim tears would fall unavailingly . [[Stephen]19-stephen 's comrades]847-stephen 's comrades were all of a sudden very quiet , and [their]847-stephen 's comrades pickaxes no longer gave dull muffled thumps upon the seam of coal ; but [he]19-stephen was too busy to notice how idle and still they were . It was only when [Cole]33-tim spoke to [him]19-stephen , in a tone of extraordinary mildness , that [the boy]1434-the boy paused in [his]1434-the boy rough and toilsome employment . ' [[My]33-tim lad]135-my lad , '[33-tim] said [Cole]33-tim , ' [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's come down [the pit]1478-the pit , and [she]21-miss anne 's asking for [thee]135-my lad . '[33-tim] ' [She]21-miss anne promised [she]21-miss anne 'd come some day , '[19-stephen] cried [Stephen]19-stephen , with a thrill of pleasure and a quicker throbbing of [his]19-stephen heart , as [he]19-stephen darted along the narrow paths to [the loftier and more open space near the bottom of [the shaft]1492-the shaft]849-the loftier and more open space near the bottom of the shaft , where [Miss Anne]21-miss anne was waiting for [him]19-stephen . The covered lamps gave too little light for [him]19-stephen to see how pale and sorrow - stricken [she]21-miss anne looked ; but the solemn tenderness of [her]21-miss anne voice sank deeply into [his]19-stephen heart . ' [Stephen]19-stephen , [[my]21-miss anne dear boy]2001-my dear boy , '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne said , ' are [you]19-stephen sure that [I]21-miss anne care for [you]19-stephen , and would not let any trouble come upon [you]19-stephen if [I]21-miss anne could help it ? '[21-miss anne] ' Yes , surely , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[1434-the boy] answered [the boy]1434-the boy wonderingly . ' [[Your]19-stephen Father]248-your father which is in heaven cares much more for [you]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne continued ; ' but " whom [the Lord]2003-the lord loveth [He]248-your father chasteneth , and scourgeth [every son whom [He]248-your father receiveth . " [God]26-god is dealing with [you]19-stephen as [[His]26-god son]1312-his son]2004-every son whom he receiveth . " god is dealing with you as his son , [Stephen]19-stephen . Can [you]19-stephen bear the sorrow which is sent by [Him]248-your father ? '[21-miss anne] ' If [the Lord Jesus]39-christ will help [me]1434-the boy , '[1434-the boy] [he]1434-the boy murmured . ' [He]39-christ will help [you]19-stephen , [[my]21-miss anne poor boy]628-my poor boy , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ' Oh , [Stephen]19-stephen , [Stephen]19-stephen , how can [I]19-stephen tell [you]19-stephen ? [[Our]2007-our little [Nan]21-miss anne]2008-our little nan , [[our]2007-our precious little child]2009-our precious little child , has fallen down [the old shaft]846-the old shaft . '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen reeled giddily , and would have sunk to the ground , but [Cole]33-tim held [him]19-stephen up in [his]33-tim strong arms , while [[his]19-stephen comrades]411-his comrades gathered about [him]19-stephen with tears and sobs , which prevented [them]411-his comrades uttering any words of consolation . But [he]19-stephen could not have listened to [them]411-his comrades . [He]19-stephen fancied [he]19-stephen heard the pattering of [Nan]21-miss anne 's little feet , and saw [her]21-miss anne laughing face . But no ! [he]19-stephen heard instead the dull and lingering footsteps of [Tim]33-tim , and saw a little lifeless form folded from sight in [Tim]33-tim 's jacket . ' [The little lass]2011-the little lass '[33-tim] ud die very easy , ' whispered [Cole]33-tim , passing [his]33-tim arm tighter round [Stephen]19-stephen ; '[33-tim] and [she]21-miss anne 's up in heaven among the angels by this time , [I]0-i reckon . ' [Stephen]19-stephen drew [himself]19-stephen away from [Cole]33-tim 's arm , and staggered forward a step or two to meet [Tim]33-tim ; when [he]19-stephen took the sad burden from [him]19-stephen , and sat down without a word , pressing it closely to [his]19-stephen breast . [His]19-stephen perfect silence touched all about [him]19-stephen . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne hid [her]21-miss anne face in [her]21-miss anne hands , and [some of [the men]1474-the men]2012-some of the men groaned aloud . '[0-i] [The old pit]821-the old pit ought to have been bricked up years ago , ' said [Cole]33-tim ; '[0-i] [the child]1568-the child 's death will be upon [the master]179-the master 's head . ' '[0-i] It 'll all go to one reckoning , ' muttered [Black Thompson]31-black thompson . But [Stephen]19-stephen seemed not to hear [their]1474-the men words . Still , with [the child]1568-the child clasped tightly to [him]19-stephen , [he]19-stephen waited for the lowering of the skip , and when it descended , [he]19-stephen seated [himself]19-stephen in it without lifting up [his]19-stephen head , which was bent over [the dead child]2015-the dead child . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne and [Tim]33-tim took [their]1474-the men places beside [him]19-stephen , and [they]1474-the men were drawn up to the broad , glittering light of day on the surface , where [a crowd of eager bystanders]2016-a crowd of eager bystanders was waiting for [Stephen]19-stephen 's appearance . '[0-i] Do n't speak to [me]0-i , please , ' [he]19-stephen murmured , without looking round ; and [they]1474-the men made way for [him]19-stephen in [his]19-stephen deep , silent grief , as [he]19-stephen passed on homewards , followed by [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . Once [she]21-miss anne saw [him]19-stephen look up to [the hills]82-the hills , where , at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , [the new house]196-the new house stood out conspicuously against the snow ; and when [they]1474-the men passed the shaft , [he]19-stephen shuddered visibly ; but yet [he]19-stephen was silent , and scarcely seemed to know that [she]21-miss anne was walking beside [him]19-stephen . [The cabin]577-the cabin was full of [women from [Botfield]23-botfield]2020-women from botfield , for [Martha]22-martha had fallen into violent fits of hysterics , and none of [their]2020-women from botfield remedies had any effect in soothing [her]22-martha . [One of [them]2020-women from botfield]2021-one of them took [the dead child]2015-the dead child from [Stephen]19-stephen 's arms at the door , and bade [him]19-stephen go away and sit in [[her]2021-one of them cottage]2023-her cottage till [she]2021-one of them came to [him]19-stephen . But [he]19-stephen turned off towards [the hills]82-the hills ; and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , seeing that [she]21-miss anne could say nothing to comfort [him]19-stephen just then , watched [him]19-stephen strolling along [the old road that led to [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow]2025-the old road that led to fern 's hollow , with [his]19-stephen arms folded and [his]19-stephen head bent down , as if [he]19-stephen were still carrying that sad burden which [he]19-stephen had borne up from the pit , so closely pressed against [his]19-stephen heart . '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm [a murderer]2026-a murderer , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha , with a look of settled despair upon [her]22-martha face , on the evening of the next day . [She]22-martha had been sitting all the weary hours since morning with [her]22-martha face buried in [her]22-martha hands , hearing and heeding [no one]189-no one , until [Miss Anne]21-miss anne came and sat down beside [her]22-martha , speaking to [her]22-martha in [her]21-miss anne own kind and gentle tones . Upon a table in the corner of [the cabin]577-the cabin lay the little form of [the dead child]2015-the dead child , covered with a white cloth . [The old grandfather]512-the old grandfather was crouching over the fire , moaning and laughing by turns ; and [Stephen]19-stephen was again absent , rambling upon [the snowy uplands]860-the snowy uplands . ' And for [murderers]2027-murderers there is pardon , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne softly . ' Oh , [I]22-martha never thought [I]22-martha wanted pardon , '[22-martha] cried [Martha]22-martha ; ' [I]22-martha always felt [I]22-martha 'd done [my]22-martha duty better than [any of [the girls about [here]146-here]2029-the girls about here]2028-any of the girls about here . But [I]22-martha 've killed [little Nan]21-miss anne ; and now [I]22-martha remember how cross [I]22-martha used to be when [nobody]147-nobody was nigh , till [she]21-miss anne grew quite timmer - some of [me]22-martha . [Everybody]1672-everybody knows [I]22-martha 've murdered [her]21-miss anne ; and now it does n't signify how bad [I]22-martha am . [I]22-martha shall never get over that . '[22-martha] ' [Martha]22-martha , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' [you]22-martha are not so guilty of [the child]1568-the child 's death as [[my]21-miss anne uncle , who ought to have had the pit bricked over safely when [it]2035-it was no longer in use]2034-my uncle , who ought to have had the pit bricked over safely when it was no longer in use . But [you]22-martha say [you]22-martha never thought [you]22-martha wanted pardon . Surely [you]22-martha feel [your]22-martha need of it now . '[21-miss anne] ' But [God]26-god will never forgive [me]22-martha now , '[22-martha] replied [Martha]22-martha hopelessly ; ' [I]22-martha see how wicked [I]22-martha have been , but the chance is gone by . [God]26-god will not forgive [me]22-martha now ; nor [Stephen]19-stephen . '[22-martha] ' [We]2036-we will not talk about [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; ' but [I]21-miss anne will tell [you]22-martha about [God]26-god . When [He]26-god gave [His]26-god commandments to [mankind]2037-mankind that [they]2037-mankind might obey [them]2037-mankind , [He]26-god proclaimed [His]26-god own name at the same time . [Listen]53-listen to [His]26-god name , [Martha]22-martha : " [The Lord]2038-the lord , [the Lord God]2039-the lord god , merciful and gracious , long - suffering , and abundant in goodness and truth , keeping mercy for [thousands]2040-thousands , forgiving iniquity , transgression , and sin . " If [you]22-martha would not go to [Him]26-god for mercy when [you]22-martha did not feel [your]22-martha need of it , [He]26-god was keeping it for [you]22-martha against this time ; saving and treasuring it up for [you]22-martha , " that [He]26-god might show the exceeding riches of [His]26-god grace in [His]26-god kindness towards [us]2041-us , through [Christ Jesus]2042-christ jesus . " [He]26-god is waiting to pardon [your]22-martha iniquity , for [Christ]39-christ 's sake . Do [you]22-martha wish to be forgiven now ? Do [you]22-martha feel that [you]22-martha are [a sinful girl]2043-a sinful girl , [Martha]22-martha ? '[21-miss anne] ' [I]22-martha have thought of nothing else all day long , '[22-martha] whispered [Martha]22-martha ; ' [I]22-martha have helped to kill [little Nan]21-miss anne by [my]22-martha sins . '[22-martha] ' Yes , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne mournfully ; ' if , like [Stephen]19-stephen , [you]22-martha had opened [your]22-martha heart to the gentle teaching of [the Holy Spirit]2044-the holy spirit , if [you]22-martha had looked to [Jesus]39-christ , trusted in [Him]39-christ , and followed [Him]39-christ , this grief would not have come upon [you]22-martha and upon all of [us]861-them . For [Bess]23-botfield would not have persuaded [you]22-martha to leave [your]22-martha own duties , and [little Nan]21-miss anne would have been alive still . '[21-miss anne] ' Oh , [I]21-miss anne knew [I]21-miss anne 'd killed [her]21-miss anne ! '[21-miss anne] cried a voice behind [them]861-them ; and , looking round , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne saw that the door had been softly opened , and [Bess]23-botfield had crept in unheard . [Her]23-botfield face was swollen with weeping , and [she]23-botfield stood wringing [her]23-botfield hands , as [she]23-botfield cast a fearful glance at the white - covered table in the corner . ' Come here , [Bess]23-botfield , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; and [the girl]1931-the girl crept to [them]861-them , and sat down on the ground at [their]861-them feet . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne talked long with [them]861-them about [little Nan]21-miss anne 's death , until [they]861-them shed many tears in true contrition of heart for [their]861-them sinfulness ; and when [they]861-them appeared to feel [their]861-them own utter helplessness , [she]21-miss anne explained to [them]861-them , in such simple and easy language as [Bess]23-botfield could understand , how [they]861-them could obtain salvation through faith in [the Lord Jesus Christ]39-christ . After which [they]861-them all knelt down ; and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne prayed earnestly for [the weeping and heart - broken girls]863-the weeping and heart - broken girls , who , as yet , hardly knew how [they]863-the weeping and heart - broken girls could frame any prayers for [themselves]863-the weeping and heart - broken girls . When [Miss Anne]21-miss anne left [the cabin]577-the cabin the night was quite dark but the snow which lay unmelted on [the mountains]74-the mountains showed their outlines plainly with a pale gleaming of light though the sky was overcast with more snow - clouds . [Her]21-miss anne heart was full of sadness for [Stephen]19-stephen , who was wandering , [no one]189-no one knew whither , among the snowdrifts on [the solitary plains]85-the solitary plains . [She]21-miss anne knew that [he]19-stephen must be passing through a terrible trial and temptation , but [she]21-miss anne could do nothing for [him]19-stephen ; [her]21-miss anne voice could not reach [him]19-stephen , nor [her]21-miss anne eye tell [him]19-stephen by a silent look how deeply [she]21-miss anne felt for [him]19-stephen . Yet [Miss Anne]21-miss anne knew who it is that possesseth ' the shields of [the earth]130-the earth , '[21-miss anne] and in [her]21-miss anne earnest thanksgiving to [God]26-god for [Martha]22-martha and [Bess Thompson]48-bess , [she]21-miss anne prayed fervently that [the boy]1434-the boy might be shielded and sheltered in [his]1434-the boy great sorrow , and that when [he]1434-the boy was tried [he]1434-the boy might come forth as gold . All the day long , [Stephen]19-stephen , instead of going to [his]19-stephen work in [the pit]1478-the pit , had been rambling , without aim or purpose , over [the dreary uplands]870-the dreary uplands ; here and there stretching [himself]19-stephen upon [the wiry heath]871-the wiry heath , where the sun had dried away the snow , and hiding [his]19-stephen face from the light , while [he]19-stephen gave way to an anguish of grief , and broke the deep silence with a loud and very bitter cry . It was death , sudden death , [he]19-stephen was lamenting . Only yesterday morning [little Nan]21-miss anne was clinging strongly to [his]19-stephen neck , and covering [his]19-stephen face with merry kisses ; and every now and then [he]19-stephen felt as if [he]19-stephen was only dreaming , and [he]19-stephen started down towards [home]125-home , as though [he]19-stephen could not believe that those tender arms were stiffened and that rosy mouth still in death . But before [he]19-stephen could run many paces the truth was borne in upon [his]19-stephen aching heart that [she]21-miss anne was surely dead ; and never more in this life would [he]19-stephen see and speak to [her]21-miss anne , or listen to [her]21-miss anne lisping tongue . [Little Nan]21-miss anne , dearest of all earthly things,—perhaps dearer to [him]19-stephen in the infancy of [his]19-stephen Christian life than [the Saviour Himself,—was]873-the saviour himself,—was removed from [him]19-stephen so far that [she]21-miss anne was already [a stranger]874-a stranger , and [he]19-stephen knew nothing of [her]21-miss anne . Towards evening [he]19-stephen found [himself]19-stephen , in [his]19-stephen aimless wandering , drawing near to [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow , where [she]21-miss anne had lived]875-fern 's hollow , where she had lived . [The outer shell of [the new house]196-the new house]876-the outer shell of the new house was built up , [the three rooms above and below]878-the three rooms above and below , with [the little dairy and coal - shed]879-the little dairy and coal - shed beside [them]878-the three rooms above and below , and [Stephen]19-stephen , even in [his]19-stephen misery , was glad of the shelter of the blank walls from the cutting blast of the north wind ; for [he]19-stephen felt that [he]19-stephen could not go [home]125-home to [the cabin where [the dead child]2015-the dead child — no longer [darling little Nan]21-miss anne]881-the cabin where the dead child — no longer darling little nan — was lying . [Poor Stephen]19-stephen ! [He]19-stephen sat down on a heap of bricks upon the new hearth , where no household fire had ever been kindled ; and , while the snow - flakes drifted in upon [him]19-stephen unheeded , [he]19-stephen buried [his]19-stephen face again in [his]19-stephen hands , and went on thinking , as [he]19-stephen had been doing all day . [He]19-stephen would never care to come back now to [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]1387-fern 's hollow . No ! [he]19-stephen would get away to [some far - off country , where [he]19-stephen should never more hear [the master]179-the master 's name spoken]884-some far - off country , where he should never more hear the master 's name spoken . Let [him]19-stephen keep [the place]177-the place , [he]19-stephen thought , and let it be a curse to [him]19-stephen , for [he]19-stephen had bought it with [a child]887-a child 's blood . If the law gave [him]19-stephen back [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]1387-fern 's hollow , it would not avenge [little Nan]21-miss anne 's death ; and [he]19-stephen had no power . But [the master]179-the master was [a murderer]2026-a murderer ; and [Stephen]19-stephen knelt down on the desolate hearth , where no prayer had ever been uttered , and prayed [God]26-god that the sin and punishment of murder might rest upon [[his]19-stephen enemy]891-his enemy . Was it consolation that filled [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart when [he]19-stephen rose from [his]19-stephen knees ? It seemed as if [his]19-stephen spirit had grown suddenly harder , and in some measure stronger . [He]19-stephen did not feel afraid now of going down to [the cabin]577-the cabin , where [the little lifeless corpse]893-the little lifeless corpse was stretched out ; and [he]19-stephen strode away down [the hill]1336-the hill with rapid steps . When the thought of [Martha]22-martha , and [[his]19-stephen grandfather]1405-his grandfather , and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne crossed [his]19-stephen mind , it was with no gentle , tender emotion , but with a strange feeling that [he]19-stephen no longer cared for [them]896-them . All [his]19-stephen love was gone with [little Nan]21-miss anne . Only the thought of [the master]179-the master , and the terrible reckoning that lay before [him]19-stephen , sent a thrill through [his]19-stephen heart . ' [I]19-stephen shall be there at the judgment , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen muttered half aloud , looking up to the cold , cloudy sky , almost as if [he]19-stephen expected to see the sign of the coming of [the Lord]2003-the lord . But there was no sign there ; and , after gazing for a minute or two , [he]19-stephen turned in the direction of [the cabin]577-the cabin , where [he]19-stephen could see a glimmer of the light within through the chinks of the door and shutter . [Bess]48-bess and [Martha]22-martha were still sitting hand in hand as [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had left [them]896-them ; but [they]896-them both started up as [Stephen]19-stephen entered , pale and ghastly from [his]19-stephen long conflict with grief and temptation on [the hills]82-the hills . [He]19-stephen was come [home]125-home conquered , though [he]19-stephen did not know it ; and the expression of [his]19-stephen face was one of hatred and vengeance , instead of sorrow and love . [He]19-stephen bade [Black Bess]23-botfield to be off out of [his]19-stephen sight in a voice so changed and harsh , that both [the girls]787-the girls were frightened , and [Martha]22-martha stole away tremblingly with [her]22-martha . [He]19-stephen was alone then , with [[his]19-stephen sleeping grandfather]903-his sleeping grandfather on the bed , and [the dead child]2015-the dead child lying in the corner , from which [he]19-stephen carefully averted [his]19-stephen eyes ; when there came a quiet tap at the door , and , before [he]19-stephen could answer , it was slowly opened , and [the master]179-the master stepped into [the cabin]577-the cabin . [He]179-the master stood before [the boy]1434-the boy , looking into [his]1434-the boy white face in silence , and when [he]179-the master spoke [his]179-the master voice was very husky and low . ' [[My]179-the master lad]135-my lad , '[179-the master] [he]179-the master said , ' [I]179-the master 'm[179-the master] very sorry for [you]1434-the boy ; and [I]0-i 'll have the pit bricked over at once . It had slipped [my]0-i memory , [Stephen]19-stephen ; but [Martha]22-martha knew of it , and [she]22-martha ought to have taken better care of [the child]1568-the child . It is no fault of [mine]0-i ; or it is only partly [my]0-i fault , at any rate . But , whether or no , [I]0-i 'm come to tell [you]1434-the boy [I]22-martha 'm[22-martha] willing to bear the expenses of the funeral in reason ; and here 's a sovereign for [you]1434-the boy besides , [[my]0-i lad]135-my lad . ' [The master]179-the master held out a glittering sovereign in [his]179-the master hand , but [Stephen]19-stephen pushed it away , and , seizing [his]179-the master arm firmly , drew [him]179-the master , reluctant as [he]19-stephen was , to the white - covered table in the corner . There was no look of pain upon the pale , placid little features before [them]910-them ; but there was an awful stillness , and all the light of life was gone out of the open eyes , which were fixed into an upward gaze . The Bible , which [Stephen]19-stephen had not looked for that morning , had been used instead of a cushion , and the motionless head lay upon it . '[135-my lad] That was [little Nan]21-miss anne yesterday , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen hoarsely ; '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne is gone to tell [God]26-god all about [you]1434-the boy . [You]1434-the boy robbed [us]910-them of [[our]910-them own home]911-our own home ; and [you]1434-the boy 've been the death of [little Nan]21-miss anne . [God]26-god 's curse will be upon [you]1434-the boy . It 's no use [my]0-i cursing ; [I]0-i can do nothing ; but [God]26-god can punish [you]1434-the boy better than [me]0-i . A while ago [I]0-i thought [I]0-i 'd get away to [some other country where [I]0-i 'd never hear of [you]1434-the boy]912-some other country where i 'd never hear of you ; but [I]0-i 'll wait now , if [I]0-i 'm almost clemmed to death , till [I]0-i see what [God]26-god will do at [you]1434-the boy . Take [your]1434-the boy money . [You]1434-the boy 've robbed [me]0-i of all [I]0-i love , but [I]0-i wo n't take from [you]1434-the boy what [you]1434-the boy love . [I]0-i 'll only wait here till [I]0-i see what [God]26-god can do . '[0-i] [He]0-i loosed [his]0-i grasp then , and opened the door wide . [The master]179-the master muttered a few words indistinctly , but [he]179-the master did not linger in [the cabin]577-the cabin beside that awful little corpse . The night had already deepened into intense darkness ; and [Stephen]19-stephen , standing at the door to listen , thought , with a quick tingling through all [his]19-stephen veins , that perhaps [the master]179-the master would [himself]179-the master fall down [the open pit]916-the open pit . But no , [he]179-the master passed on securely ; and [Martha]22-martha , coming in shortly afterwards , ventured to remark that [she]22-martha had just brushed against [the master]179-the master in [the lane]1614-the lane , and wondered where [he]179-the master was going to at that time of night . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne came to see [Stephen]19-stephen the next day ; but , though [he]19-stephen seemed to listen to [her]21-miss anne respectfully , [she]21-miss anne felt that [she]21-miss anne had lost [her]21-miss anne influence over [him]19-stephen ; and [she]21-miss anne could do nothing for [him]19-stephen but intercede with [God]26-god that [the Holy Spirit , who only can enter into our inmost souls and waken there every memory]919-the holy spirit , who only can enter into our inmost souls and waken there every memory , would in [His]19-stephen own good time recall to [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart all the lessons of love and forgiveness [he]19-stephen had been learning , and enable [him]19-stephen to overcome the evil spirit that had gained the mastery over [him]19-stephen . [All the people in [Botfield]23-botfield]920-all the people in botfield wished to attend [little Nan]21-miss anne 's funeral , but [Stephen]19-stephen would not consent to it . At first [he]19-stephen said only [Tim]33-tim and [himself]19-stephen should accompany the tiny coffin to [[the churchyard]341-the churchyard at [Longville]10-longville]922-the churchyard at longville ; but [Martha]22-martha implored so earnestly to go with [them]920-all the people in botfield , that [he]19-stephen was compelled to relent .
