The coffin was placed in a little cart , drawn by one of [the hill - ponies]923-the hill - ponies , and led slowly by [Tim]33-tim ; while [Stephen]19-stephen and [Martha]22-martha walked behind , the latter weeping many humble and repentant tears , as [she]22-martha thought sorrowfully of [little Nan]21-miss anne ; but [Stephen]19-stephen with a set and gloomy face , and a heart that pondered only upon the calamities that should overtake [[his]19-stephen enemy]891-his enemy . But [God]26-god had not forsaken [Stephen]19-stephen ; though , for a little time , [He]26-god had left [him]19-stephen to the working of [his]19-stephen own sinful nature , that [he]19-stephen might know of a certainty that in [himself]19-stephen there dwelt no good thing . [God]26-god looks down from heaven upon all [our]925-our bitter conflicts ; and [He]26-god weighs , as [a just Judge]926-a just judge , all the events that happen on [earth]1667-earth . From [the servant to whom [He]26-god has given but one talent]928-the servant to whom he has given but one talent , [He]26-god does not demand the same service as from [him]26-god who has ten talents . [[Stephen]19-stephen 's heavenly [Father]28-father]929-stephen 's heavenly father knew exactly how much understanding and strength [he]28-father possessed , for [He]28-father [Himself]28-father had given those good gifts to [the boy]1434-the boy , and [He]28-father knew in what measure [He]28-father had bestowed them . When the right time was come , ' [He]28-father sent from above , [He]28-father took [him]19-stephen , [He]28-father brought [him]19-stephen out of [many waters]2048-many waters . [He]28-father brought [him]19-stephen forth also into [a large place]2049-a large place ; [He]28-father delivered [him]19-stephen , because [He]28-father delighted in [him]19-stephen . '[28-father] After the great tribulation of those days [Stephen]19-stephen fell into a long and severe illness . For many weeks [he]19-stephen was delirious and unconscious , neither knowing what [he]19-stephen said nor who was taking care of [him]19-stephen . When [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sat beside [him]19-stephen , soothing [him]19-stephen , as [she]21-miss anne sometimes could do , with singing , [he]19-stephen would talk of being in [heaven]226-heaven , and listening to [little Nan among the angels]932-little nan among the angels . [Bess]23-botfield shared many of [Martha]22-martha 's weary hours of watching : and so deeply had [the child]1568-the child 's death affected [them]934-their , that now all [their]934-their thoughts and talk were about the things that [Miss Anne]21-miss anne diligently taught [them]934-their concerning [Jesus]39-christ and [His]39-christ salvation . It was not much [they]934-their knew ; but as in former times a very small subject was sufficient for a long gossip , so now the little knowledge of the Scriptures that was lodged in either of [their]934-their minds became the theme of fluent , if not very learned conversation . Sometimes [Stephen]19-stephen , as if [their]934-their words caught some floating memory , would murmur out a verse or two in [his]19-stephen delirious ramblings , or sing part of a hymn . [Tim]33-tim , also , [who came for an hour or two every evening]935-who came for an hour or two every evening , was always ready to read the few chapters [he]19-stephen had learned , and to give [the girls]787-the girls [his]19-stephen interpretation of [them]934-their . There was no pressing want in [the little household]937-the little household , though [[their]934-their bread - winner]938-their bread - winner was unable to work . [The miners]939-the miners made up [Stephen]19-stephen 's wages among [themselves]939-the miners at every reckoning , for [Stephen]19-stephen had won [their]939-the miners sincere respect , though [they]939-the miners had often been tempted to ill - treat [him]19-stephen . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne came every day with dainties from [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house , without meeting with any reproof or opposition , though the name of [Stephen Fern]19-stephen never crossed [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley 's lips . Still [he]19-stephen used to listen attentively whenever [the doctor]942-the doctor called upon [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , to give [her]942-the doctor [his]19-stephen opinion how [the poor boy]943-the poor boy was going on . When [Stephen]19-stephen was recovering , [his]19-stephen mind was too weak for any of the violent passions that had preceded [his]19-stephen illness . Moreover , the bounty of [[his]19-stephen comrades]411-his comrades , and the humble kindness of [Martha]22-martha and [Bess]23-botfield , came like healing to [his]19-stephen soul ; for very often the tenderness of [others]945-others will seem to atone for the injuries of [[our]946-our enemies]223-our enemies , and at least soften [our]946-our vehement desire for revenge . Yet , in a quiet , listless sort of way , [Stephen]19-stephen still longed for [God]26-god to prove [His]19-stephen wrath against [the master]179-the master 's wrong - doing . It appeared so strange to hear that all this time nothing had befallen [him]19-stephen , that [he]19-stephen was still strong and healthy , and becoming more and more wealthy every day . Like [Asaph]54-asaph , [the psalmist]949-the psalmist , when [he]19-stephen considered the prosperity of [the wicked]950-the wicked , [Stephen]19-stephen was inclined to say , ' How doth [God]26-god know ? and is there knowledge with the Most High ? Behold , these are the ungodly that prosper in [the earth]130-the earth ; they increase in riches . Verily [I]19-stephen have cleansed [my]19-stephen heart in vain , and washed [my]19-stephen hands in innocency . For all the day long have [I]19-stephen been plagued , and chastened every morning . '[19-stephen] ' Why does [God]26-god let these things be ? '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen inquired of [Miss Anne]21-miss anne one day , after [he]19-stephen was well enough to rise from [his]19-stephen bed and sit by the fire . [He]19-stephen was very white and thin , and [his]19-stephen eyes looked large and shining in their sunken sockets ; but they gazed earnestly into [[his]19-stephen teacher]951-his teacher 's face , as if [he]19-stephen was craving to have this difficulty solved . ' [You]19-stephen have asked [me]21-miss anne a hard question , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; ' [we]2051-we can not understand [God]26-god 's way , for " as the heavens are higher than [the earth]130-the earth , so are [His]26-god ways than [our]2051-we ways . " But shall [we]2051-we try to find out a reason why [God]26-god let these things be for little [Nan]21-miss anne 's sake ? '[21-miss anne] ' Yes , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , turning away [his]19-stephen eyes from [her]21-miss anne face . ' [[Our]2051-we Lord Jesus [Christ]39-christ had [one disciple]2053-one disciple , called [John]39-christ , whom [He]39-christ loved more than the rest]39-christ ; and before [John]39-christ died [he]39-christ was permitted to see [heaven]226-heaven , and to write down many of the things shown to [him]39-christ , that [we]2051-we also might know of them . [He]39-christ beheld [a holy city]2055-a holy city , whose builder and [maker]2056-maker is [God]26-god , and having the glory of [God]26-god . [It]2055-a holy city was built , as it were , of pure gold , and the walls were of all manner of precious stones ; the gates of [the city]2057-the city were of pearl , and [the streets of gold]2058-the streets of gold , as clear and transparent as glass . There was no need of the sun nor of the moon to shine in it ; for the glory of [God]26-god doth lighten it , and the Lamb is the light thereof . [He]39-christ saw , too , the throne of [God]26-god , and above it there was a rainbow of emerald , which was a sign of [His]26-god covenant with [the people]1468-the people upon [earth]1667-earth . And round about the throne , nearer than the angels , there were seats , upon which [men who had been ransomed from this world of sin and sorrow]2061-men who had been ransomed from this world of sin and sorrow were sitting in white robes , and with crowns upon [their]2061-men who had been ransomed from this world of sin and sorrow heads . There came a pure river of water of life out of the throne , and on [each side of the river]2062-each side of the river , in [the streets of [the city]2057-the city]2063-the streets of the city , there was a tree of life , the leaves of which are for the healing of [all nations]2065-all nations . Before the throne stood a great multitude , which [no man]2066-no man could number , clothed in white robes , and with palms in [their]2061-men who had been ransomed from this world of sin and sorrow hands . And as [John]39-christ listened , [he]39-christ heard a sound like the voice of [many waters]2048-many waters ; then , as it became clearer , it seemed like the voice of a great thunder ; but at last it rang down into [his]39-christ opened ears as the voice of [many harpers]2068-many harpers , singing a new song with [their]2068-many harpers harps . And [he]39-christ heard a great voice out of [heaven]226-heaven , proclaiming the covenant of [God]26-god with [men]1482-men : " Behold , the tabernacle of [God]26-god is with [men]1482-men , and [He]26-god will dwell with [them]1482-men , and [they]1482-men shall be [[His]26-god people]2072-his people ; and [God]26-god [Himself]26-god shall be with [them]1482-men , and be [[their]1482-men God]2073-their god . And [God]26-god shall wipe away all tears from [their]1482-men eyes ; and there shall be no more death , neither sorrow , nor crying , neither shall there be any more pain . " [The disciple whom [Jesus]39-christ loved]2074-the disciple whom jesus loved saw many other things which [he]2074-the disciple whom jesus loved was commanded to seal up ; but these things were written for [our]2075-our comfort . '[19-stephen] ' And little [Nan]21-miss anne is there , '[19-stephen] murmured [Stephen]19-stephen , as the tears rolled down [his]19-stephen cheeks . ' [[Our]2075-our Lord]2076-our lord says of [little children]754-little children , " [I]21-miss anne say unto [you]19-stephen , That in [heaven]226-heaven [[their]754-little children angels]2079-their angels do always behold the face of [[my]21-miss anne Father]2080-my father which is in heaven , " '[21-miss anne] continued [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . ' [Stephen]19-stephen , do [you]19-stephen wish [her]21-miss anne to be back again in [this sorrowful world]2081-this sorrowful world , with [Martha]22-martha and [you]19-stephen for [companions]2082-companions , instead of [the angels]1589-the angels ? '[21-miss anne] ' Oh no ! '[19-stephen] sobbed [Stephen]19-stephen . ' And now , why has [God]26-god sent so many troubles to [you]19-stephen , [[my]19-stephen poor [Stephen]19-stephen]629-my poor stephen ? As [I]19-stephen told [you]19-stephen before , [we]2085-we can not understand [His]26-god ways yet . But do not [you]19-stephen see that sorrow has made [you]19-stephen very different to [the other boys]426-the other boys about [you]19-stephen ? Have [you]19-stephen not gained much wisdom that [they]426-the other boys do not possess ? And would [you]19-stephen change [your]19-stephen lot with [any one of [them]426-the other boys]2087-any one of them ? Would [you]19-stephen even be as [you]19-stephen were [yourself]19-stephen twelve months ago , before these afflictions came ? [We]2085-we are sent into [this world]2088-this world for something more than food and clothing , and work and play . [[Our]2085-we souls]2089-our souls must live , and [they]2089-our souls are dead if [they]2089-our souls are not brought into submission to [God]26-god 's will . Even [[our]2085-we own Lord]2090-our own lord and [Saviour]2091-saviour , " though [He]2091-saviour were [a son]2092-a son , yet learned [He]2091-saviour obedience by the things which [He]2091-saviour suffered . " How much more do [we]2085-we need to suffer before [we]2085-we learn obedience to the will of [God]26-god ! '[19-stephen] Then there is [Martha]22-martha , ' continued [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , after a pause ; '[19-stephen] [she]22-martha and [Bess]23-botfield are both brought to repentance by the death of [[our]952-our little child]953-our little child . Surely [I]0-i need not excuse [God]26-god 's dealings to [you]954-you any more , [Stephen]19-stephen . ' '[19-stephen] But there comes no judgment upon [the master]179-the master , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen in a low voice . A flush of pain passed over [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's face as [she]21-miss anne met [Stephen]19-stephen 's eager gaze , and saw something of the working of [his]19-stephen heart in [his]19-stephen flashing eye . '[952-our] [[Our]952-our [God]26-god]956-our god will suffer no sin to go unpunished for ever , ' [she]21-miss anne answered solemnly . '[26-god] " Vengeance is [mine]957-mine ; [I]0-i will repay , saith [the Lord]2003-the lord . " Listen , [Stephen]19-stephen : when [[our]952-our Lord]2076-our lord spoke those " blessings " in [your]19-stephen chapter , [He]2076-our lord implied that on the opposite side there were curses corresponding to [them]960-them . But [He]2076-our lord did not leave this matter uncertain ; [I]0-i will read them to [you]19-stephen from another chapter : " But woe unto [you]19-stephen that are rich ! for [ye]19-stephen have received [your]19-stephen consolation . Woe unto [you]19-stephen that are full ! for [ye]19-stephen shall hunger . Woe unto [you]19-stephen that laugh now ! for [ye]19-stephen shall mourn and lament . " ' '[179-the master] That is [the master]179-the master , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , [his]19-stephen face glowing with satisfaction , '[179-the master] for [he]179-the master is rich and full , and [he]179-the master laughs now ! ' '[179-the master] Yes , who can tell but that these woes will fall upon [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle , ' said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and [her]21-miss anne head drooped low , and [Stephen]19-stephen saw the tears streaming down [her]21-miss anne cheeks ; '[179-the master] all [my]0-i prayers and love for [him]338-my uncle may be lost . [His]338-my uncle soul , which is as precious and immortal as [ours]963-ours , may perish for ever ! ' [Stephen]19-stephen looked at [her]21-miss anne bitter weeping with a longing desire to say something to comfort [her]21-miss anne , but [he]19-stephen could not speak a word : for [her]21-miss anne grief was caused by the thought of the very vengeance [he]19-stephen was wishing for . [He]19-stephen turned away [his]19-stephen head uneasily , and gazed deep down into the glowing embers of the fire . '[0-i] Not [my]0-i prayers and love only , ' continued [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[0-i] but [[our]963-ours Saviour]964-our saviour 's also ; all [His]338-my uncle griefs and sorrows may prove unavailing , as far as [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle is concerned . Perhaps [He]338-my uncle will say of [him]338-my uncle , " [I]0-i have laboured in vain , [I]0-i have spent [My]0-i strength for nought , and in vain . " O [[my]0-i Saviour]966-my saviour ! because [I]0-i love [Thee]966-my saviour , [I]0-i would have every immortal soul saved for [Thy]966-my saviour eternal glory . ' '[0-i] And so would [I]0-i , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' cried [the boy]1434-the boy , sinking on [his]1434-the boy knees . '[21-miss anne] Oh , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , pray to [Jesus]39-christ that [I]0-i may love all [[my]0-i enemies]702-my enemies for [His]39-christ sake . ' When [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's prayer was ended , [she]21-miss anne left [Stephen]19-stephen alone to the deep but gentler thoughts that were filling [his]19-stephen mind . [He]19-stephen understood now , with a clearness that [he]19-stephen had never had before , that '[21-miss anne] love is of [God]26-god ; and every one that loveth is born of [God]26-god , and knoweth [God]26-god . ' [He]19-stephen must love [[his]19-stephen enemies]2094-his enemies because [they]2094-his enemies were precious , as [he]19-stephen [himself]19-stephen had been , in all [their]2094-his enemies sin and rebellion , to [[their]2094-his enemies Father]1448-their father in [heaven]226-heaven . Not only did [God]26-god send rain and sunshine upon the evil and unjust , but [He]19-stephen had so loved [them]2094-his enemies as to give [[His]19-stephen only begotten Son]2097-his only begotten son to die for [them]2094-his enemies ; and if [they]2094-his enemies perished , so far it made the cross of [Christ]39-christ of none effect . Henceforth the bitterness of revenge died out of [his]19-stephen heart ; and whenever [he]19-stephen bent [his]19-stephen knees in prayer , [he]19-stephen offered up the dying petition of [[his]19-stephen namesake]2098-his namesake , [the martyr Stephen]2099-the martyr stephen , in behalf of all [[his]19-stephen enemies]2094-his enemies , but especially of [[his]19-stephen master]190-his master : '[968-lord] [Lord]968-lord , lay not this sin to [their]969-their charge . ' [Stephen]19-stephen 's recovery went on so slowly , that [the doctor who attended [him]19-stephen]2102-the doctor who attended him said it would not be fit for [him]19-stephen to resume [his]19-stephen underground labour for some months to come , if [he]19-stephen were ever able to do so ; and advised [him]19-stephen to seek some out - door employment . [[His]19-stephen old comrades]2103-his old comrades began to find the weekly subscription to make up [his]19-stephen wages rather a tax upon [their]2103-his old comrades own earnings ; and [Stephen]19-stephen [himself]19-stephen was unwilling to be a burden upon [them]2103-his old comrades any longer . As soon , therefore , as [he]19-stephen was strong enough to bear the journey , [he]19-stephen resolved to cross [the hills]82-the hills again to [Danesford]5-danesford , to see when [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood was coming [home]125-home , and what help [the clergyman]1456-the clergyman left in charge of [his]19-stephen duty could give to [him]19-stephen . [Tim]33-tim brought [[his]33-tim father]1392-his father 's donkey for [him]33-tim to ride , and went with [him]33-tim across [the uplands]93-the uplands . The hard frosts and the snow were over , for it was past the middle of March ; but [the house at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow]2109-the house at fern 's hollow remained in precisely the same state as when [little Nan]21-miss anne died ; not a stroke of work had been done at it , and a profound silence brooded over [the place]177-the place . Perhaps [the master]179-the master had lost all pleasure in [his]179-the master ill - gotten possession ! So changed was [Stephen]19-stephen , though [Danesford]55-mr. danesford looked exactly the same , so tall had [he]19-stephen grown during [his]19-stephen illness , and so white was [his]19-stephen formerly brown face , that [the big boy who had shown [him]19-stephen the way to [the rectory]1922-the rectory]2112-the big boy who had shown him the way to the rectory did not know [him]19-stephen again in the least . Probably [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood and [[his]49-mr. lockwood daughter]2114-his daughter would not have recognised [him]19-stephen ; but [they]2115-they were still lingering in a warmer climate , until the east winds had quite finished [their]2115-they course . [The strange clergyman]2116-the strange clergyman , however , was exceedingly kind to both [the boys]219-the boys , and promised to send a full and faithful account to [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood of all the circumstances [they]219-the boys narrated to [him]49-mr. lockwood ; for [Tim]33-tim told of many things which [Stephen]19-stephen passed over . [They]219-the boys had done right in coming to [him]19-stephen , [he]33-tim said ; and [he]33-tim gave [Stephen]19-stephen enough money to supply the immediate necessities of [[his]33-tim family]1445-his family , at the same time bidding [him]19-stephen apply for more if [he]19-stephen needed any ; for [he]33-tim knew that [a boy of]2119-a boy of [his]2119-a boy of principle and character would never live upon [other people]2120-other people 's charity whenever [he]2119-a boy of could work for [himself]2119-a boy of . How refreshing and strengthening it was upon [the tableland]81-the tableland that spring afternoon ! The red leaf - buds of the bilberry - wires were just bursting forth , and the clumps of gorse were tinged with the first golden flowers . Every kind of moss was there carpeting the ground with a bright fresh green from the moisture of the spring showers . As for the birds , [they]219-the boys seemed absolutely in a frenzy of enjoyment , and seemed to forget that [they]219-the boys had [their]219-the boys nests to build as [they]219-the boys flew from bush to bush , singing merrily in the sunshine . [Tim]33-tim wrapped a cloak round [Stephen]19-stephen ; and then [they]219-the boys faced the breeze gaily , as it swept to meet [them]219-the boys with a pure breath over miles of heath and budding flowers . No wonder that [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart rose within [him]19-stephen with a rekindled gladness and gratitude ; while [Tim]33-tim became almost as wild as the birds . But [Stephen]19-stephen began to feel a little tired as [they]219-the boys neared [[Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , though [they]219-the boys were still two miles from [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . '[968-lord] [Home]125-home , [home]125-home ! ' [he]19-stephen said , rather mournfully , pointing to [the new house]196-the new house . '[33-tim] [Tim]33-tim , [I]0-i remember [I]0-i used to feel in [myself]0-i as if that was to be [[my]0-i own home]972-my own home for ever . [I]0-i did n't think that [God]26-god only meant it to be [mine]0-i for a little while , even if [I]0-i kept it till [I]0-i died . And when [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was going to die , it seemed as if it did n't signify what kind of a place [we]973-we 'd lived in , or what troubles had happened to [us]973-we . Yesterday , [Tim]33-tim , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne showed [me]0-i a verse about [us]973-we being [strangers]974-strangers and pilgrims upon [the earth]130-the earth . ' '[21-miss anne] Perhaps [we]973-we are [pilgrims]976-pilgrims , ' replied [Tim]33-tim , '[21-miss anne] but [we]973-we are n't [much strangers on [these hills]978-these hills]977-much strangers on these hills . ' '[21-miss anne] It means , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] that [we]973-we are no more at [home]125-home [here]146-here than [a stranger]874-a stranger is when [he]874-a stranger is passing through [Botfield]23-botfield . [I]0-i 'm willing now never to go back to [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , if [God]26-god pleases . Not that little [Nan]21-miss anne is gone ; but because [I]26-god 'm[26-god] sure [God]26-god will do what is best with [me]0-i , and [we]973-we 're to have [no continuing city here]2124-no continuing city here . [I]0-i think [I]0-i should n't feel a bit angry if [I]0-i saw [other people]2120-other people living [there]1463-there . '[0-i] ' Hillo ! what 's that ? '[33-tim] cried [Tim]33-tim . Surely it could not be smoke from the top of the new chimney ? Yes ; a thin , clear blue column of smoke was curling briskly up into the air , and then floating off in a banner over [the hillside]1428-the hillside . [Somebody]983-somebody was there , that was certain ; and the first fire had been lighted on the hearthstone . There was a sharp pang in [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart , and [he]19-stephen cast down [his]19-stephen eyes for a moment , but then [he]19-stephen looked up to the sky above [him]19-stephen with a smile ; while [Tim]33-tim set up a loud shout , and urged [the donkey]984-the donkey to a canter . ' It 's [Martha]22-martha ! '[33-tim] [he]33-tim cried ; ' [I]33-tim saw [her]22-martha gown peeping round the corner of the wall . [I]33-tim 'll lay a wager it 's [her]22-martha print gown . Come [thy]22-martha ways ; [we]985-we 'll make sure afore [we]985-we pass . '[33-tim] It was [Martha]22-martha waiting for [them]985-we at [the old wicket]986-the old wicket , and [Bess]23-botfield was just within the doorway . [They]985-we were come so far to meet [the travellers]987-the travellers , and had even prepared tea for [them]987-the travellers in [the new kitchen]988-the new kitchen , having cleared away some of the bricks and mortar , and raised benches with the pieces of planks left about . Tea was just ready for [Stephen]19-stephen 's refreshment , and [he]19-stephen felt that [he]19-stephen was in the greatest need of it ; so [they]985-we sat down to it as soon as [Martha]22-martha had laid out the provisions , among which was a cake sent by [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . The fire of wood - chips blazed brightly , and gave out a pleasant heat ; and [every one of [the little party]750-the little party]989-every one of the little party felt a quiet enjoyment , though there were many tender thoughts of [little Nan]21-miss anne . ' [We]985-we may be [pilgrims]976-pilgrims , '[33-tim] said [Tim]33-tim reflectively , over a slice of cake , ' but there 's lots of pleasant things sent [us]985-we by the way . '[33-tim] [They]985-we were still at tea when [the gamekeeper , who was passing by , and who guessed from the smoke from the chimney]991-the gamekeeper , who was passing by , and who guessed from the smoke from the chimney , and the donkey grazing in [the new pasture]1808-the new pasture , that [some gipsies]993-some gipsies had taken possession of [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , came to look through the unglazed window . [He]19-stephen had not seen [Stephen]19-stephen since [his]19-stephen illness , and there was something in [his]19-stephen wasted face and figure which touched even [him]19-stephen . ' [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] sorry to see [thee]19-stephen looking so badly , [[my]0-i lad]135-my lad , ' [he]19-stephen said ; '[19-stephen] [I]0-i must speak to [[my]0-i missis]995-my missis to send [you]19-stephen something nourishing , for [I]0-i 've not forgotten [you]19-stephen , [Stephen]19-stephen . If ever there comes a time when [I]0-i can speak up about any business of [yours]19-stephen without hurting [myself]0-i , [you]19-stephen may depend upon [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i do n't like making [enemies]761-enemies , and the Bible says [we]997-we must live peaceably with [all men]998-all men . [I]0-i heard talk of [you]19-stephen wanting some out - door work for a while ; and there 's [[my]0-i wife 's brother]999-my wife 's brother is wanting [a shepherd 's boy]1000-a shepherd 's boy . [He]999-my wife 's brother 'd take [you]19-stephen at [my]0-i recommendation , and [I]0-i 'd be glad to speak a word for [you]19-stephen . Would that do for [you]19-stephen ? ' [Stephen]19-stephen accepted the offer gladly ; and when [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper was gone , [they]997-we sang a hymn together , so blotting out by an offering of praise the evil prayer which [he]19-stephen had uttered upon that hearth on the night of [his]19-stephen desolation and strong conflict . Pleasant was the way [home]125-home to [the old cabin]550-the old cabin in the twilight ; pleasant the hearty '[999-my wife 's brother] Good - night ' of [Tim]33-tim and [Bess]23-botfield ; but most pleasant of all was the calm sense of truth , and the submissive will with which [Stephen]19-stephen resigned [himself]19-stephen to the providence of [God]26-god . The work of [a shepherd]424-a shepherd was far more to [Stephen]19-stephen 's taste than [his]19-stephen dangerous toil as [a collier]2132-a collier . From [his]19-stephen earliest years [he]19-stephen had been accustomed to wander with [[his]19-stephen grandfather]1405-his grandfather over the extensive sheep - walks , seeking out any strayed lambs , or diligently gathering food for [the sick ones of the flock]2134-the sick ones of the flock . To be sure , [he]19-stephen could only earn little more than half [his]19-stephen former wages , and [his]19-stephen time for returning from [his]19-stephen work would always be uncertain , and often very late . But then , sorrowful consideration ! there was no little [Nan]21-miss anne to provide for now , nor to fill up [his]19-stephen leisure hours at [home]125-home . [Martha]22-martha was earning money for [herself]22-martha ; and as yet [the master]179-the master had demanded no rent for [[their]2137-their miserable cabin]2138-their miserable cabin ; so [his]19-stephen earnings as [a shepherd 's boy]1000-a shepherd 's boy would do until [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood came back . Still upon [the mountains]74-the mountains [he]19-stephen would be exposed to the bleak winds and heavy storms of the spring ; while underground the temperature had always been the same . No wonder that [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , when [she]21-miss anne looked at [the boy]1434-the boy 's wasted and enfeebled frame , listened with unconcealed anxiety to [his]19-stephen new project for gaining [his]19-stephen livelihood ; and so often as the spring showers swept in swift torrents across the sky , lifted up [her]21-miss anne eyes wistfully to [the unsheltered mountains]2142-the unsheltered mountains , as [she]21-miss anne pictured [Stephen]19-stephen at the mercy of the pitiless storm . [Stephen]19-stephen had been engaged in [his]19-stephen new calling for about a fortnight , and was coming [home]125-home , after a long and toilsome day among [the flocks]2144-the flocks , two hours after sunset , with a keen east wind bringing the tears into [his]19-stephen eyes , when a few paces from [[his]19-stephen cabin]2145-his cabin door [a tall dark figure]2146-a tall dark figure sprang up from [a hollow in the cinder - hill]2147-a hollow in the cinder - hill , and laid a heavy hand upon [his]19-stephen shoulder . It was just light enough to discern the gloomy features of [Black Thompson]31-black thompson ; and [Stephen]19-stephen inquired fearlessly what [he]19-stephen wanted with [him]31-black thompson . '[0-i] [I]0-i thought [thee'd]1001-thee'd never be coming , ' said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson impatiently . '[0-i] [Lad]131-lad , hast [thee]131-lad forgotten [thy]131-lad rights and [thy]131-lad wrongs , that [thou]131-lad comes to yonder wretched kennel whistling as if [all the land]1003-all the land belonged to [thee]131-lad ? Where 's [thy]131-lad promise to [[thy]131-lad father]1495-thy father , that [thee'd]131-lad never give up [thy]131-lad rights ? [Jackson]56-jackson [the butcher]1005-the butcher has taken [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow , and it 's to be finished up in a week or two ; and [thee'lt]131-lad see [[thy]131-lad own place]1006-thy own place go into the hands of [strangers]974-strangers . ' '[974-strangers] It 'll all be put right some day , [Thompson]31-black thompson , thank [you]31-black thompson , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen . '[31-black thompson] Right ! ' repeated [Thompson]31-black thompson ; '[31-black thompson] who 's to put wrong things right if [we]1008-we wo n't take the trouble [ourselves]1008-we ? Is it right for [the master]179-the master to grind [us]1008-we down in [our]1008-we wages , and raise the rents over [our]1008-we heads , till [we]1008-we can scarcely get enough to keep [us]1008-we in victuals , just that [he]179-the master may add money to money to count over of nights ? Was it right of [him]179-the master to leave [the pit]1478-the pit yonder open , till [little Nan]21-miss anne was killed in it ? [Thee]1011-thee has a heavy reckoning to settle with [him]179-the master , and [I]0-i 'd be wiping off some of the score . If [I]0-i was in [[thy]1011-thee place]479-thy place , [I]0-i should have little [Nan]21-miss anne 's voice calling [me]0-i day and night from [the pit]1478-the pit , to ask when [I]0-i was going to revenge [her]21-miss anne . ' [Black Thompson]31-black thompson felt that [Stephen]19-stephen trembled under [his]0-i grasp , and [he]0-i went on with greater earnestness . '[21-miss anne] [Thee]1011-thee could revenge [thyself]1014-thyself this very night . [Thee]1011-thee could get the worth of [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow without a risk , if [thee'd]1011-thee listen to [me]0-i . It 's [thy]1011-thee own , [lad]131-lad , and [thy]1011-thee wrongs are heavy — [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow stolen from [thee]1011-thee , and [the little lass]2011-the little lass murdered ! How canst [thee]1011-thee rest , [Stephen]19-stephen ? ' '[19-stephen] [God]26-god will repay , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen in a tremulous tone . '[26-god] Dost think that [God]26-god sees ? ' asked [Black Thompson]31-black thompson scoffingly ; '[26-god] if [He]26-god sees , [He]26-god does n't care . What does it matter to [Him]26-god that [poor folks like [us]1018-us]1017-poor folks like us are trodden down and robbed ? If [He]26-god cared , [He]26-god could strike [the master]179-the master dead in a moment , and [He]26-god does n't . [He]26-god lets [him]179-the master prosper and prosper , till [nobody]147-nobody can stand afore [him]179-the master . [I]0-i 'd take [my]0-i own matter in [my]0-i own hands , and make sure of vengeance . [God]26-god does n't take any notice . ' '[26-god] [I]0-i 'm sure [God]26-god sees , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen ; ' [He]26-god is everywhere ; and [He]26-god is n't blind , or deaf , only [we]1018-us do n't understand what [He]26-god is going to do yet . If [He]26-god did n't take any notice of [us]1018-us , [He]26-god would n't make [me]19-stephen feel so happy , spite of everything . Oh , [Thompson]31-black thompson [thee]31-black thompson and [the men]1474-the men were so kind to [me]19-stephen when [I]19-stephen could n't work , and [I]19-stephen 've never seen [thee]31-black thompson to thank [thee]31-black thompson . [I]19-stephen can do nothing for [thee]31-black thompson , except [I]19-stephen could persuade [thee]31-black thompson to repent , and be as happy as [I]19-stephen am . '[19-stephen] ' Oh , [I]31-black thompson 'll repent some day , '[31-black thompson] said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , loosing [Stephen]19-stephen 's arm ; ' but [I]31-black thompson 've lots of things to do aforehand , and [I]31-black thompson reckon [they]2149-they can all be repented of together . So , [lad]131-lad , it 's true what [everybody]1672-everybody is saying of [thee]31-black thompson — [thee]31-black thompson has forgotten poor little [Nan]21-miss anne , and [thy]31-black thompson promise to [[thy]31-black thompson father]1495-thy father ! '[31-black thompson] ' No , [I]19-stephen 've never forgotten , '[19-stephen] replied [Stephen]19-stephen , ' but [I]19-stephen 'll never try to revenge [myself]19-stephen now . [I]19-stephen could n't if [I]19-stephen did try . Besides , [I]19-stephen 've forgiven [the master]179-the master ; so do n't speak to [me]19-stephen again about it , [Thompson]31-black thompson . '[19-stephen] ' Well , [lad]131-lad , be sure [I]31-black thompson 'll never waste [my]31-black thompson time thinking of [thee]131-lad again , '[31-black thompson] said [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , with an oath ; ' [thy]131-lad religion has made [a poor , spiritless , cowardly chap of [thee]131-lad]2155-a poor , spiritless , cowardly chap of thee , and [I]31-black thompson 've done with [thee]131-lad altogether . '[31-black thompson] [Black Thompson]31-black thompson strode away into the darkness , and was quickly out of hearing , while [Stephen]19-stephen stood still and listened to [his]31-black thompson rapid footsteps , turning over in [his]19-stephen mind what mischief [he]19-stephen wished to tempt [him]19-stephen to now . [The open shaft]722-the open shaft was only a few feet from [him]19-stephen ; but [it]722-the open shaft had been safely encircled by a high iron railing , instead of being bricked over , as it had been found of use in the proper ventilation of the pit . From [Thompson]31-black thompson and [his]31-black thompson temptation , [Stephen]19-stephen 's thoughts went swiftly to [little Nan]21-miss anne , and how [he]19-stephen had heard [her]21-miss anne calling to [him]19-stephen upon that dreadful night when [he]19-stephen went away with [the poachers]1022-the poachers . Was it possible that [he]19-stephen could forget [her]21-miss anne for a single day ? Was [she]21-miss anne not still one of [his]19-stephen most constant and most painful thoughts ? Yes , [he]19-stephen could remember every pretty look of [her]21-miss anne face , and every sweet sound of [her]21-miss anne voice ; yet [they]1023-they were saying [he]19-stephen had forgotten [her]21-miss anne , while the pit was there for [him]19-stephen to pass night and morning — a sorrowful reminder of [her]21-miss anne dreadful death ! A sharp thrill ran through [Stephen]19-stephen 's frame as [his]19-stephen outstretched hand caught one of the iron railings , which rattled in its socket ; but [his]19-stephen very heart stood still when up from the dark , narrow depths there came a low and stifled cry of ' [Stephen]19-stephen ! [Stephen]19-stephen ! '[19-stephen] [He]19-stephen was [no coward]1024-no coward , though [Black Thompson]31-black thompson had called [him]19-stephen [one]1551-one ; but this voice from [the dreaded pit]1026-the dreaded pit , at that dark and lonely hour , made [him]19-stephen tremble so greatly that [he]19-stephen could neither move nor shout aloud for very fear . [He]19-stephen leaned there , holding fast by the railing , with [his]19-stephen hearing made wonderfully acute , and [his]19-stephen eyes staring blindly into the dense blackness beneath [him]19-stephen . In another second [he]19-stephen detected a faint glimmer , like a glow - worm deep down in the earth , and the voice , still muffled and low , came up to [him]19-stephen again . ' It 's only [me]1028-they — [Tim]33-tim ! '[1028-they] it cried . ' Hush ! do n't speak , [Stephen]19-stephen ; do n't make any noise . [I]1028-they 'm[1028-they] left down in [the pit]1478-the pit . [They]1028-they 're going to break into [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house to - night . [They]1028-they 're[1028-they] going to get [thee]19-stephen to creep through the pantry window . If [thee]19-stephen wo n't , [Jack Davies]44-davies is to go . [They]1028-they 'll fire the thatch , if [they]1028-they ca n't get the door open . [Thee]19-stephen go and take care of [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and send [Martha]22-martha to [Longville]10-longville for help . Do n't trust anybody at [Botfield]23-botfield . ' These sentences sounded up into [Stephen]19-stephen 's ears , one by one , slowly , as [Tim]33-tim could give [his]33-tim voice its due tone and strength . [He]19-stephen recollected instantly all the long oppression [the men]1474-the men had suffered from [[their]1474-the men master]2159-their master . In [that distant part of [the county]2161-the county]2160-that distant part of the county , where there were extensive works , [the colliers]1372-the colliers had been striking for larger wages ; and [some of [them]1372-the colliers]2163-some of them had strolled down to [Botfield]23-botfield , bringing with [them]2163-some of them an increase of discontent and inquietude , which had taken deep root in the minds of [all the workpeople]2164-all the workpeople . It was well known that [the master]179-the master kept large sums of money in [[his]179-the master house]1858-his house , which , as [I]1028-they have told [you]2167-you , was situated among lonely fields , nearly a mile from [Botfield]23-botfield ; and [no one]189-no one lived with [him]179-the master , except [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and [one maid - servant]2169-one maid - servant . [It]1858-his house was [a very secure building]2170-a very secure building , with stone casements and strongly barred doors ; but if [a boy]176-a boy could get through the pantry window , [he]176-a boy could admit [the others]449-the others readily . How long it would be before the attempt was made [Stephen]19-stephen could not tell , but it was already late , and [Black Thompson]31-black thompson had left [him]19-stephen hurriedly . But at least it must be an hour or two nearer midnight , and all hopes of rescue and defence rested upon [him]19-stephen and [Martha]22-martha only . [Martha]22-martha was sitting by the fire knitting , and [Bess Thompson]48-bess was pinning on [her]48-bess shawl to go [home]125-home . [Poor Bess]48-bess ! Even in [his]19-stephen excitement [Stephen]19-stephen felt for [her]22-martha ; but [he]19-stephen dared not utter a word till [she]22-martha was gone . But then [Martha]22-martha could not credit [his]19-stephen hurried tidings and directions , until [she]22-martha had been [herself]22-martha to the shaft to see the feeble gleam of [Tim]33-tim 's lamp , and hear the sound of [his]19-stephen voice ; for as soon as [she]22-martha rattled the railings [he]19-stephen spoke again . '[1028-they] Be sharp ! ' [he]19-stephen cried . '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm not afeared ; but [I]0-i ca n't stay here where [little Nan]21-miss anne died . [I]0-i 'll go back to [the pit]1478-the pit , and wait till morning . Be sharp ! '[0-i] There was no need after that to urge [Martha]22-martha to hasten . After throwing a shawl over [her]22-martha head , [she]22-martha started off for [Longville]10-longville with the swiftness of a hare ; and was soon past [the engine - house]1029-the engine - house , and threading [her]22-martha way cautiously through [Botfield]23-botfield , where [she]22-martha dreaded to be discovered as [she]22-martha passed the lighted windows , or across the gleam of some open door . [Many of [the houses]1031-the houses]1030-many of the houses were quite closed up and dark , but in some there was a voice of talking ; and here and there [Martha]22-martha saw a figure stealing like [herself]22-martha along the deepest shadows . But [she]22-martha escaped without being noticed ; and , once through [the village]280-the village , [her]22-martha path lay along [the silent high - roads straight on to [Longville]10-longville]1033-the silent high - roads straight on to longville . Nor did [Stephen]19-stephen linger in [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . [He]19-stephen ran swiftly over [the pit - banks]1035-the pit - banks , and stole along by [the limekilns]1036-the limekilns and [the blacksmith 's shop]1037-the blacksmith 's shop , for under the heavy door [he]19-stephen could see a little fringe of light . How loudly the dry cinders cranched under [his]19-stephen careful footsteps ! Yet , quiet as [[the blacksmith]1038-the blacksmith 's shop]1037-the blacksmith 's shop was , and soundless as the night without , the noise did not reach the ears of [those who were lurking within]1040-those who were lurking within , and [Stephen]19-stephen went on in safety . There stood [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house at last , black and massive - looking against the dark sky ; not a gleam from fire or candle to be seen below , for every window was closely shuttered ; but on [the second storey]1043-the second storey there shone a lighted casement , which [Stephen]19-stephen knew belonged to [[the master]179-the master 's chamber]1045-the master 's chamber . The dog , which came often with [Miss Anne]21-miss anne to [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin , gave one loud bay , and then sprang playfully upon [Stephen]19-stephen , as if to apologize for [his]19-stephen mistake in barking at [him]19-stephen . For some minutes [the boy]1434-the boy stood in deep deliberation , scarcely daring to knock at the door , lest some of [the housebreakers]1048-the housebreakers should be already concealed near the spot , and rush upon [him]19-stephen before it was opened , or else enter with [him]19-stephen into [the defenceless dwelling]1049-the defenceless dwelling . But at length [he]19-stephen gave one very quiet rap with [his]19-stephen fingers , and after a minute 's pause [his]19-stephen heart bounded with joy as [he]19-stephen heard [Miss Anne]21-miss anne [herself]21-miss anne asking who was [there]1463-there . ' [Stephen Fern]19-stephen , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen answered , with [his]19-stephen lips close to the keyhole , and speaking in [his]19-stephen lowest tones . ' What is the matter , [Stephen]19-stephen ? '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne asked . ' [I]21-miss anne can not open the door , for [[my]21-miss anne uncle]338-my uncle always takes the keys with [him]338-my uncle into [[his]338-my uncle own room]2176-his own room . '[21-miss anne] ' Please to take the light into [the pantry]2177-the pantry for one minute , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen whispered cautiously , with a fervent hope that [Miss Anne]21-miss anne would do so without requiring any further explanations ; for [he]19-stephen was lost if [Black Thompson]31-black thompson or [Davies]44-davies were lying in wait near at hand . Very thankfully [he]19-stephen heard [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's step across the quarried floor , and in a moment afterwards the light shone through a low window close by . [It]1051-it was unglazed , with a screen of open lattice - work over [it]1051-it so as to allow of free ventilation . [It]1051-it had one thick stone upright in the middle , leaving such a narrow space as only [a boy]176-a boy could creep through . [He]19-stephen examined the opening quickly and carefully while the light remained , and when [Miss Anne]21-miss anne returned to the door [he]1053-he whispered again through the keyhole , ' Do n't be afraid . It 's [me]1053-he — [Stephen]19-stephen ; [I]1053-he 'm[1053-he] coming in through the pantry window . ' [He]19-stephen knew [his]19-stephen danger . [He]19-stephen knew if [any of [the robbers]2179-the robbers]2178-any of the robbers came up [they]2178-any of the robbers must hear [him]19-stephen removing the wooden lattice which was laid over the opening ; and unless [they]2178-any of the robbers supposed it to be one of [[their]2178-any of the robbers accomplices]2180-their accomplices at work , [he]19-stephen would be at once in [their]2178-any of the robbers power , exposed to [their]2178-any of the robbers ill - treatment , or perhaps suffer death at [their]2178-any of the robbers hands . And would [Miss Anne]21-miss anne within trust to [him]19-stephen instead of alarming [the master]179-the master ? If [he]19-stephen came down and opened the door , all the designs of [the evil men]2182-the evil men would be hastened and finished before [Martha]22-martha could return from [Longville]10-longville . But [Stephen]19-stephen did not listen , nor did [his]19-stephen fingers tremble over [their]2178-any of the robbers work , though there was a rush of thoughts and fears through [his]19-stephen brain . [He]19-stephen tore away the lattice as quickly and quietly as [he]19-stephen could , and , with one keen glance round at the dark night , [he]19-stephen thrust [his]19-stephen head through the narrow frame . [He]19-stephen found it was just possible to crush through ; and , after a minute 's struggle , [his]19-stephen feet rested upon the pantry floor . [Anne]21-miss anne was standing close to the pantry door , listening to [Stephen]19-stephen 's mysterious movements in utter bewilderment , hardly knowing whether [she]21-miss anne ought to call [[her]21-miss anne uncle]2183-her uncle , but not coming to a decision about it until [the boy]1434-the boy appeared before [her]21-miss anne . [His]19-stephen first quick action was to secure the door by fastening a rusty bolt which was on the outside , and then , in a few hurried sentences , [he]19-stephen explained [his]19-stephen strange conduct by telling [her]21-miss anne how [Tim]33-tim had conveyed to [him]19-stephen the design of some of [the colliers]1372-the colliers for breaking into [[the master]179-the master 's house]1830-the master 's house . There had been several similar robberies in [the country]1361-the country during the strike for wages , and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne was greatly alarmed , while [Stephen]19-stephen felt all the tender spirit of [a brave man]2189-a brave man aroused within [him]19-stephen , as [she]21-miss anne sank faint and trembling upon the nearest seat . '[1053-he] Do n't be afraid , ' [he]19-stephen said courageously ; '[1053-he] [they]1054-they shall tear [me]0-i to pieces afore [they]1054-they touch [you]1055-you , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . [I]0-i 'm stronger than [you]1055-you 'd think ; but if [I]0-i ca n't take care of [thee]1055-you , [God]26-god can . Has n't [He]179-the master sent [me]0-i here , afore [they]1054-they come , on purpose ? [They]1054-they 'd have come upon [you]1055-you unawares , but for [God]26-god . '[0-i] ' [You]19-stephen are right , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] answered [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . ' [He]0-i says , " [Thou]2190-thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night . " But what shall [we]2191-we do ? How can [we]2191-we make [ourselves]2191-we safer ? [I]21-miss anne 'll try not to be afraid ; but [we]2191-we must do all [we]2191-we can [ourselves]2191-we . Hark ! there 's a footstep already ! '[21-miss anne] Yes , there was a footstep , and [not a very stealthy one]1056-not a very stealthy one , approaching [the house]1347-the house , and the dog bounded forward to the full length of [his]1058-his chain , but [he]1058-his was beaten down with a blow that stunned [him]1058-his . [The men]1474-the men were too strong in numbers , and too secure in the extreme loneliness of [the dwelling]1060-the dwelling , to care about taking many precautions . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne and [Stephen]19-stephen heard [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley cross the floor of [[his]36-mr. wyley room]641-his room above , and open [his]36-mr. wyley window ; but there was silence again , and the chime of the house clock striking eleven was the only sound that broke the silence until the casement above was reclosed , and [the master]179-the master 's footfall returned across [the room]1852-the room . ' [I]21-miss anne must go and tell [him]179-the master , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; ' perhaps [he]179-the master can secure some of [his]179-the master money , lest [Martha]22-martha should be stopped on the way , or not come in time . Stay here and watch , [Stephen]19-stephen , and let [me]21-miss anne know if [you]19-stephen hear anything . '[21-miss anne] [She]21-miss anne stole up - stairs in the dark , lest [those without]1064-those without should see the glimmer of [her]21-miss anne candle through the fanlight in [the hall]1065-the hall ; and then [she]21-miss anne spoke softly to [[her]21-miss anne uncle]2183-her uncle through [his]2183-her uncle locked and bolted door . [Down - stairs]1067-down - stairs [Stephen]19-stephen listened with [his]19-stephen quickened hearing to the footsteps gathering round [the house]1347-the house ; and presently the latch of the pantry door was lifted with a sudden click that made [him]19-stephen start and catch [his]19-stephen breath ; but [Jack Davies]44-davies could come no further , now the rusty bolt was drawn on the outside . There was a whispered conversation through the pantry window , and the sound of [some one]1069-some one getting out again ; and then [Stephen]19-stephen crept across [the dark kitchen]1070-the dark kitchen into [the hall through which [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had gone]1071-the hall through which miss anne had gone . At the head of the staircase was the door of [[the master]179-the master 's room]1073-the master 's room , now standing open ; and the light from [it]1074-it served to guide [him]19-stephen across [the strange hall]1075-the strange hall , and up the stairs , until [he]19-stephen reached the doorway , and could look in . [The chamber]1076-the chamber had a low and sloping ceiling , and a gable - window in the roof , which was defended by strong bars . Near this window was an open cabinet , containing many little drawers and divisions , all of which were filled with papers ; while upon a leaf in the front there lay rolls of bank notes , and heaps of golden money , which [the master]179-the master had been counting over . [He]19-stephen stood beside [his]19-stephen cabinet as if [he]19-stephen had just risen from this occupation , and was leaning upon [his]19-stephen chair , panic - stricken at the tidings [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had uttered . [His]19-stephen grey hair was scattered over [his]19-stephen forehead , instead of being smoothly brushed back ; and the long , loose coat , which hung carelessly around [his]19-stephen shrivelled form and stooping shoulders , made [him]19-stephen look far older than [he]19-stephen did in the day - time . As [Stephen]19-stephen 's eyes rested upon the sunken form and quaking limbs of [the aged man]1078-the aged man , [he]19-stephen felt , for the first time , how helpless and infirm [[his]19-stephen enemy]891-his enemy was , instead of [the rich , full , and prospering master [he]19-stephen had always considered [him]179-the master]1080-the rich , full , and prospering master he had always considered him . ' Keep off ! '[1081-the old miser] cried [the old miser]1081-the old miser , as [he]1081-the old miser caught sight of [Stephen]19-stephen on the threshold ; and [he]1081-the old miser raised [his]1081-the old miser withered arm as if to ward [him]19-stephen from [his]1081-the old miser treasures . ' Keep off ! [Stephen Fern]19-stephen , is it [you]19-stephen ? [You]19-stephen 've come to take [your]19-stephen revenge . [The robbers]2179-the robbers and [murderers]2027-murderers have got in ! [O God]2194-o god , have pity upon [me]1081-the old miser ! '[1081-the old miser] ' [I]1081-the old miser 'm[1081-the old miser] come to take care of [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[1081-the old miser] [They]1082-they 've not got in yet , [master]251-master . And , please [God]26-god , help will be here afore long with [Martha]22-martha . The doors and windows are safe . ' '[21-miss anne] [Anne]21-miss anne , take [him]19-stephen away ! ' implored [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley . '[21-miss anne] [I]0-i do n't know if it is true , but take [him]19-stephen away . [I]0-i 'm not safe while [he]19-stephen 's [there]1463-there ; [they]1084-they will murder [me]21-miss anne ! Go , go ! '[21-miss anne] [Miss Anne]21-miss anne led [Stephen]19-stephen away ; and no sooner were [they]1084-they outside [the room]1852-the room , than [the master]179-the master rushed forward and locked and barred the door securely behind [them]1084-they . There was a window in [the landing]1087-the landing , looking over [the yard]1088-the yard where [the housebreakers]1048-the housebreakers were , and [they]1084-they stood at [it]1090-it in silence , straining [their]1084-they eyes into the darkness . But it did not remain dark long ; for a thin , bright flame burst up from behind the dairy wall , and by its fitful blaze [they]1084-they could see the figures of [four men]1091-four men coming rapidly round from that corner of [the old building]1092-the old building . ' Fire ! fire ! '[1084-they] [they]1084-they shouted , in wild voices of alarm , and beating the iron - studded door with heavy sticks . ' Wake up , [master]251-master ! wake up ! [the house]1347-the house is on fire ! '[1084-they] [Their]1084-they only answer was a frantic scream from [the servant]1930-the servant , who thrust [her]1930-the servant head out of [her]1930-the servant window , and echoed [their]1084-they shouts with piercing cries . But [Stephen]19-stephen and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne did not move ; only [Miss Anne]21-miss anne laid [her]21-miss anne hand upon [his]19-stephen arm , and [he]19-stephen felt how much [she]21-miss anne trembled . ' [They]1084-they 're[21-miss anne] only trying to frighten [us]1084-they , ' [he]19-stephen said quietly ; '[21-miss anne] that 's only the wood - stack on fire . [They]1084-they think to frighten [us]1084-they to open the door , by making believe that [the house]1347-the house is on fire . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , [I]0-i 'm praying to [God]26-god all the while to send [Martha]22-martha in time . '[21-miss anne] ' So am [I]21-miss anne , '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne answered , sobbing ; ' but oh , [Stephen]19-stephen , [I]21-miss anne am frightened . '[21-miss anne] ' [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said , in a comforting tone , ' that chapter about faith [you]21-miss anne 've been teaching [me]19-stephen , it says something about quenching fire . '[19-stephen] ' " Quenched the violence of fire , " '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne murmured ; ' " out of weakness were made strong . " '[21-miss anne] [She]21-miss anne hid [her]21-miss anne face for a minute or two in both [her]21-miss anne hands ; and then [she]21-miss anne was strong enough to go to [[the servant]1930-the servant 's room]1096-the servant 's room , where [the terrified girl]1097-the terrified girl was still calling for help . The wild shouts and the deafening clamour at the door rang through [the house]1347-the house ; but the blaze was gone down again ; and when [Stephen]19-stephen threw open the window just over the heads of [the group of men in [the yard]1088-the yard below]1099-the group of men in the yard below , there was not light enough for [him]19-stephen to distinguish [their]1099-the group of men in the yard below faces . ' [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] [here]146-here , ' [he]19-stephen said,—'Stephen [Fern]19-stephen . [I]19-stephen found out what [you]1103-you are up to , and [Martha]22-martha 's gone to [Longville]10-longville for help . [She]22-martha 'll be here afore long , and [you]1103-you ca n't force the door open . Put out the fire in the wood - stack , and go [home]125-home . Maybe if [you]1103-you 're[19-stephen] not found [here]146-here [you]1103-you 'll get off ; for [I]0-i 've seen none of [you]1103-you , and [I]0-i can only guess at who [you]1103-you are . Go [home]125-home , [I]0-i say . ' There was a low , deep growl of disappointment , and a hurried consultation among [the men]1474-the men . But whether [they]1474-the men would follow [Stephen]19-stephen 's counsel , it was not permitted [them]1474-the men to choose ; for suddenly a strong , bright flame burst up in a high column , like a beacon , into the midnight air , and [every one gazing upwards]2200-every one gazing upwards saw in a moment that the thatch over the farthest gable had caught fire . [The house]1347-the house itself was now burning , and the light , blazing full upon [their]1474-the men upturned faces , revealed to [Stephen]19-stephen the well - known features of [four of [[his]19-stephen former comrades]2203-his former comrades]2202-four of his former comrades . The shout that rang from [their]1474-the men lips was one of real alarm now . '[0-i] [Stephen]19-stephen , [lad]131-lad , open the door ! ' cried [Black Thompson]31-black thompson . '[19-stephen] [We]1106-we thought to smoke the old fox out of [[his]1107-his kennel]1108-his kennel , but it 's took fire in earnest . [We]1106-we 'll not hurt [him]1107-his , nor [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . Lad ! [the old house]1541-the old house will burn like tinder . ' What a glaring light spread through [the landing]1087-the landing ! The face of [Miss Anne]21-miss anne coming from [[the servant]1930-the servant 's room]1096-the servant 's room shone rosy and bright in it , though [she]21-miss anne was pale with fear . Through the open window drifted a suffocating smoke of burning wood and thatch , and the crackling and splitting of the old roof sounded noisily above [their]1106-we voices ; but [Miss Anne]21-miss anne commanded [herself]21-miss anne , and spoke calmly to [Stephen]19-stephen . '[1106-we] [We]1106-we must open the door to [them]1110-their now , ' [she]21-miss anne said ; '[1106-we] [God]26-god will protect [us]1106-we from [these wicked men]1111-these wicked men . [Uncle]1112-uncle ! [uncle]1113-uncle ! [the house]1347-the house is really on fire , and [we]1106-we want the keys . Let [me]0-i in . ' [She]21-miss anne knocked loudly at [his]19-stephen door , and lifted up [her]21-miss anne voice to make [him]19-stephen hear , and [Stephen]19-stephen shouted ; but there was no answer . Without the keys of the massive locks it would not be possible to open the doors , and [he]19-stephen had them in [his]19-stephen own keeping ; but [he]19-stephen gave no heed to [their]1110-their calls , nor the vehement screams of [the frightened servant]2207-the frightened servant . Perhaps [he]19-stephen had fallen into a fit ; and [they]1110-their had no means of entering [[his]19-stephen chamber]2208-his chamber , so securely had [he]19-stephen fastened [himself]19-stephen in with [his]19-stephen gold . [Stephen]19-stephen and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne gazed at [one another]2209-one another in the dazzling and ominous light , but no words crossed [their]1110-their trembling lips . Oh , the horror of [their]1110-their position ! And already other voices were mingled with those of [the assailants]2210-the assailants ; and [every one]1692-every one was shouting from without , praying [them]1115-they to open the door , and be saved from [their]1115-they tremendous peril . '[0-i] [I]0-i 'll not open the door ! ' said [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley from within ; '[1115-they] [they]1115-they will rob and murder [me]0-i . [They]1115-they are come to kill [me]0-i , and [I]0-i may as well die here . There 's no help . ' '[1115-they] There is help , [dear uncle]1116-dear uncle ! ' cried [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; '[1115-they] there are [other people from [Botfield]23-botfield]1117-other people from botfield ; and help is coming from [Longville]10-longville . Oh , let [me]0-i in ! ' '[0-i] No , ' said [the master]179-the master , '[0-i] [they]1115-they all hate [me]0-i . [They]1115-they 'll kill [me]0-i , and say it was done in the fire . [I]0-i 'll not open to [anybody]1843-anybody . ' [She]21-miss anne prayed and expostulated in vain ; [he]179-the master cared little for [their]1115-they danger , so hardened was [he]179-the master by a selfish fear for [himself]179-the master . The fire was gaining ground quickly , for a brisk wind had sprung up , and the long - seasoned timber in the old walls burnt like touchwood . [The servant]1930-the servant lay insensible on the threshold of [[the master]179-the master 's chamber]1045-the master 's chamber ; and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne and [Stephen]19-stephen looked out from a front casement upon [the gathering crowd]2216-the gathering crowd , who implored [them]2216-the gathering crowd , with frenzied earnestness , to throw open the door . '[0-i] [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' cried [Stephen]19-stephen , '[0-i] [you]21-miss anne can get through the pantry window ; [you]21-miss anne are little enough . Oh , be quick , and let [me]0-i see [you]21-miss anne safe ! ' '[0-i] [I]0-i can not , ' [she]21-miss anne answered : '[0-i] not yet ! Not till the last moment . [I]0-i dare not leave [[my]0-i uncle]338-my uncle and [that poor girl]1120-that poor girl . Oh , [Stephen]19-stephen , if [Martha]22-martha would but come ! ' [She]21-miss anne rested [her]21-miss anne head against the casement , sobbing , as though [her]21-miss anne grief could not be assuaged . [Stephen]19-stephen felt heart - sick with [his]19-stephen intense longing for the arrival of help from [Longville]10-longville , as [he]19-stephen watched the progress of the fire ; but at last , after what appeared ages of waiting , [they]1123-they heard a shout in the distance , and saw a little band of horsemen galloping up to [the burning house]2217-the burning house . '[1121-they] [They]1121-they are come from [Longville]10-longville , [uncle]1113-uncle , ' cried [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . '[1113-uncle] [You]19-stephen must open now ; there is not a moment to spare . The fire is gaining upon [us]1123-they fast . ' [He]19-stephen had seen [their]1123-they approach [himself]19-stephen , and now [he]19-stephen opened the doors , and gave the keys to [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . [He]19-stephen had collected all [his]19-stephen papers and notes in one large bundle , which [he]19-stephen had clasped in [his]19-stephen arms ; and as soon as [the crowd]2218-the crowd swept in through the open doors , [he]19-stephen cried aloud to [the constable from [Longville]10-longville]2219-the constable from longville to come and guard [him]19-stephen . There was very little time for saving anything out of [the house]1347-the house , for before long the flames gathered such volume and strength as to drive every one out before [them]1123-they ; and as [Stephen]19-stephen stood beside [the miserable old man , who was shivering in the bitter night wind]2221-the miserable old man , who was shivering in the bitter night wind , [he]19-stephen beheld [[his]19-stephen dwelling]2222-his dwelling destroyed as suddenly and entirely as [the hut at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow had been]2223-the hut at fern 's hollow had been . [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley would not stir from the place where [he]19-stephen could gaze upon [[his]19-stephen old home]2224-his old home burning to the ground . [He]19-stephen stood rooted to the spot , like one fascinated and enchained by a power [he]19-stephen could not resist , grasping [his]19-stephen precious bundle to [his]19-stephen breast , and clinging firmly to the arm of [the Longville doctor , who had been one of those who hastened to [his]19-stephen rescue]2225-the longville doctor , who had been one of those who hastened to his rescue . Now and then [he]19-stephen broke out into a deep cry , which [he]19-stephen did not seem to hear [himself]19-stephen ; but even the grey dawn of the morning , brightening over the rounded outlines of [the mountains]74-the mountains , did not awaken [him]19-stephen from [his]19-stephen trance of terror and bewilderment . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne kept near to [him]19-stephen all night , and [Stephen]19-stephen lingered about [her]21-miss anne , making a seat for [her]21-miss anne upon the grass , and taking care that [Martha]22-martha also should be at hand to wait upon [her]21-miss anne . There was a great buzzing of [people]1670-people about [them]1670-people , hurrying to and fro ; and every now and then [they]1670-people heard different conjectures as to how the fire began . But it was not , generally known that [the constables from [Longville]10-longville and [Botfield]23-botfield]2228-the constables from longville and botfield had contrived to arrest [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [Davies]44-davies in the midst of the confusion , and had quietly taken [them]2228-the constables from longville and botfield off to [the jail at [Longville]10-longville]2229-the jail at longville . When the daylight grew strong , it shone upon a smouldering mass of ruins , and heaps of broken furniture piled upon the down - trodden grass . [The master]179-the master had grown aged in that one night , and [he]179-the master gazed helplessly about [him]179-the master , as if for [some one]1069-some one to direct and guide [him]179-the master . [He]179-the master no longer refused to quit [the place]177-the place , only [he]179-the master would not trust [himself]179-the master anywhere near [Botfield]23-botfield ; and as soon as [a carriage]2233-a carriage could be procured , [he]179-the master and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne were driven off to [Longville]10-longville . There was nothing more to wait for now ; and [Stephen]19-stephen went quietly [home]125-home to breakfast in [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . It was a good deal later than usual that morning when [the engineman at [the works]1765-the works]2236-the engineman at the works sent down the first skip - load of [colliers]2238-colliers into [the pit]1478-the pit . [Four of [their]2238-colliers number]2240-four of their number were absent , but that excited no surprise after the events of the night ; and even [Bess Thompson]48-bess supposed [[her]48-bess father]1395-her father had gone off to [the public - house]2242-the public - house with [the others]449-the others . But what was the amazement of [the colliers]1372-the colliers when [they]1372-the colliers found [Tim]33-tim at the bottom of the shaft , fiercely hungry after [his]33-tim night 's fasting , and as fiercely anxious to hear what had been taking place overhead . [He]33-tim had the prudence , however , to listen to [their]1372-the colliers revelations without making any of [his]33-tim own , and would not even explain how [he]33-tim came to be left behind in [the pit]1478-the pit . [He]0-i went up in [the ascending skip]2246-the ascending skip , and , escaping from the curiosity of [the people on the bank]2247-the people on the bank , [he]0-i darted as straight as an arrow to [[Stephen]19-stephen 's cabin]2248-stephen 's cabin . '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm nigh clemmed , '[0-i] were [his]0-i first words , as [he]0-i seized the brown loaf and cut off a slice , which [he]0-i devoured ravenously . ' It seems like a year , '[0-i] [he]0-i continued ; ' [thee'lt]2249-thee never catch [me]0-i being left behind anywhere again . Eh , [Stephen]19-stephen , [lad]131-lad ! many a time [I]0-i shouted for fear [I]0-i 'd never see daylight again ; it 's awful down there in the night . [Thee]2249-thee hears [them]2251-them as [thee]2249-thee ca n't see punning agen the coal ; and then there comes a downfall like a clap of thunder . [I]0-i was n't so much afeared of [little Nan]21-miss anne : [she]21-miss anne never did any harm when [she]21-miss anne was alive ; and [I]0-i thought [God]26-god was too good to send [her]21-miss anne out of heaven just to terrify [a poor lad like [me]0-i]2252-a poor lad like me . '[0-i] ' But how did [thee]2249-thee get left behind ? '[22-martha] asked [Martha]22-martha . Then [Tim]33-tim told [them]1124-them how [the horse - doctor]1125-the horse - doctor had gone down to secure one of the ponies in a large , strong net , in order to bring it to the surface of [the earth]130-the earth for a time ; and that [he]1125-the horse - doctor had gone down with [him]1125-the horse - doctor more for [his]1125-the horse - doctor own amusement than to help [him]1125-the horse - doctor . [He]1125-the horse - doctor had wandered a little way into [the winding galleries of [the pit]1478-the pit]1127-the winding galleries of the pit , and came back just as [the skip]1129-the skip was going up for the last time but one . [Thompson]31-black thompson and [Davies]44-davies were deep in conversation with [the men who remained]1130-the men who remained , and , stealing behind [them]1130-the men who remained , [he]1125-the horse - doctor overheard [their]1130-the men who remained plot , and [their]1130-the men who remained intention of persuading [Stephen]19-stephen to join [them]1130-the men who remained . After that [he]1125-the horse - doctor dare not for [his]1125-the horse - doctor very life come forward when the skip descended , and [he]1125-the horse - doctor watched [them]1130-the men who remained go up , leaving [him]1125-the horse - doctor alone for the night in [that dismal place]1131-that dismal place . [He]1125-the horse - doctor had [[his]1125-the horse - doctor father]1392-his father 's lamp with [him]1125-the horse - doctor , and so made [his]1125-the horse - doctor way to the bottom of [the old shaft]846-the old shaft , and waited , with what impatience and anxiety [we]1134-we may imagine , to hear [Stephen]19-stephen return from [his]1125-the horse - doctor work . ' It was awfully lonesome , '[1125-the horse - doctor] [he]1125-the horse - doctor said , ' and [I]1125-the horse - doctor thought [Stephen]19-stephen would never come , or [I]1125-the horse - doctor 'd never make [him]19-stephen hear . It was n't much better after [he]19-stephen had come , only for thinking [Miss Anne]21-miss anne would be safe . [My]1125-the horse - doctor lamp went out , and [I]1125-the horse - doctor reckon [I]1125-the horse - doctor said " [Our Father]199-our father " over a hundred times . Besides , [I]1125-the horse - doctor was wondering what was being done overhead . [I]1125-the horse - doctor 'll never be left behind anywhere again , [I]1125-the horse - doctor can tell [ye]2254-ye . '[1125-the horse - doctor] ' Well , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [my]1125-the horse - doctor sheep and [lambs]2255-lambs do n't know about the fire , and [I]1125-the horse - doctor must be off . [They]2254-ye 'll want [me]1125-the horse - doctor just as bad as if [I]1125-the horse - doctor 'd been in bed all night . '[1125-the horse - doctor] Still [he]19-stephen could not help turning aside with [Tim]33-tim just for another glimpse of [the smouldering ruins]1135-the smouldering ruins , looking so black and desolate in the daylight . But after that [he]19-stephen did not loiter a minute , and spent the rest of the morning in diligent attention to [his]19-stephen duties , until , a little before mid - day , [he]19-stephen saw [the farmer who employed [him]19-stephen riding across the sheep - walk]1136-the farmer who employed him riding across the sheep - walk ; and when [he]19-stephen ran forward to receive [his]19-stephen orders , [he]19-stephen bade [him]19-stephen make haste and go [home]125-home to prepare [himself]19-stephen for appearing before [the magistrate]1138-the magistrate , to give [his]19-stephen evidence against [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [[his]31-black thompson comrades]411-his comrades . When [Stephen]19-stephen reached [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin [he]19-stephen found [Tim]33-tim there again , and [Bess Thompson]48-bess waiting to see [him]19-stephen . [Poor Bess]48-bess had been crying bitterly , for by this time it was known that [[her]48-bess father]1395-her father and [Davies]44-davies were in [jail]142-jail ; though [the others]449-the others , being young and [single men]1144-single men , had fled at once from [the place]177-the place , and escaped for the present . As soon as [Stephen]19-stephen entered , [Bess]48-bess threw [herself]48-bess on [her]48-bess knees at [his]19-stephen feet , and looked up imploringly into [his]19-stephen face . ' Oh , dear , good [Stephen]19-stephen , '[48-bess] [she]48-bess cried , ' [thee]19-stephen canst save [father]1396-father ! [I]48-bess 'll kneel here till [thee]19-stephen has promised to save [him]1396-father . Oh , do n't bear any spite agen [him]1396-father , but forgive [him]1396-father and save [him]1396-father ! '[48-bess] ' Get up , [Bess]48-bess , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen kindly ; ' do n't [thee]48-bess kneel down to [a fellow like [me]19-stephen]2257-a fellow like me . '[1146-i] [she]1146-i said ; ' [thee'lt]19-stephen tell the justice [thee]19-stephen never saw [him]1396-father there till [the other folks]2259-the other folks came up from [Botfield]23-botfield . [Tim]33-tim says [he]33-tim did n't see [anybody]1843-anybody down in the pit , and [he]33-tim 's promised not to swear to [their]1843-anybody names .
