'[1146-i] ' But [I]19-stephen did see [every one of [them]1843-anybody]2262-every one of them , '[19-stephen] [Stephen]19-stephen answered ; ' and [Tim]33-tim knew all [their]1843-anybody voices ; and there 'll be lots to tell who came up in the last skip . '[19-stephen] ' There 's [nobody in [Botfield]23-botfield]2263-nobody in botfield will swear agen [them]1843-anybody , '[48-bess] pleaded [Bess]48-bess . ' Whose place is it to know [who came up in the last skip]2264-who came up in the last skip , or who was at the fire last night ? Oh , [Stephen]19-stephen , the Bible says [we]1148-we 're[48-bess] to do good to [them]1147-them that hate [us]1148-we . And if [father]1396-father 's hated [thee]48-bess , [thee]48-bess canst save [him]1396-father now . ' '[48-bess] Ay , ' said [Tim]33-tim , '[48-bess] [Bess]48-bess is right ; there 's not [[a mother]816-a mother 's son in [Botfield]23-botfield]1151-a mother 's son in botfield to swear agen [them]1147-them for [the master]179-the master 's sake . If [he]179-the master did n't see [them]1147-them , nor [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , why need [we]1148-we know ? [I]0-i 'll soon baffle the justice , [I]0-i promise [ye]1153-thee . It 's a rare chance to forgive [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , anyhow . ' '[31-black thompson] [Bess]48-bess and [Tim]33-tim , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen , in great distress , '[31-black thompson] [I]0-i ca n't do it . It is n't that [I]0-i bear a grudge against [[thy]1153-thee father]1495-thy father — [I've]0-i almost forgotten that [he]1495-thy father ever did anything to [me]0-i . But it 's not true ; it 's sure to come out somehow . Why , [I]0-i do n't even know what [I]0-i said to [Miss Anne]21-miss anne last night ; but if [I]0-i had n't told a word to [anybody]1843-anybody , [I]0-i 'd be bound to tell the truth now . ' '[548-lass] Only say [thee]1153-thee are n't certain , ' urged [Bess]48-bess . '[1153-thee] Nay , [lass]548-lass , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[0-i] [I]0-i am certain . [I]0-i 'd do anything that was right for [thy]1153-thee sake , and to save [[thy]1153-thee father]1495-thy father ; but [I]0-i ca n't do this , and it would be no use if [I]0-i could . [God]26-god seeth in secret , and [He]26-god will reward [men]1482-men openly . [He]26-god 's begun to reward [the master]179-the master already . [We]1160-we can do nothing for [[thy]1153-thee father]1495-thy father , but [every one of [us]1160-we]1162-every one of us tell the truth , and pray to [God]26-god for [him]1495-thy father . ' '[28-father] [Father]28-father was good to [thee]1153-thee when [thou]1153-thee wert ill , ' said [Bess]48-bess . '[28-father] Ay , [I]0-i know it , ' [he]0-i replied ; '[28-father] but if [he]28-father was [[my]0-i own father]1163-my own father , [I]0-i could not tell a lie to get [him]28-father off . [I]0-i 'd do anything [I]0-i could . Oh , [Bess]48-bess and [Tim]33-tim , do n't ask [me]0-i to go agen the right ! ' '[48-bess] It 'll break [mother]167-mother 's heart , ' said [Bess]48-bess , bursting out into a loud crying . '[48-bess] [We]1165-we made sure of [thee]1153-thee , because [thee]1153-thee says so much about having [[thy]1153-thee enemies]1166-thy enemies ; and [we]1165-we were only afeared of [Tim]33-tim . [Thee]1153-thee says [we]1165-we are to do to [another]1167-another as [we]1165-we 'd have [them]1167-another do to [us]1165-we . If [thee]1153-thee was in [[father]1396-father 's place]1169-father 's place , [thee'd]1153-thee want [him]1396-father to do as [I]0-i ask [thee]1153-thee . [Thee]1153-thee does n't think [father]1396-father wants [thee]1153-thee to swear agen [him]1396-father ? ' '[1153-thee] Nay , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen , '[1153-thee] the justice and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne would have [me]0-i tell the truth . It seems as if [I]0-i ca n't do to [everybody]1672-everybody as [they]1672-everybody 'd like [me]0-i ; so [I]0-i 'll abide by telling the truth . ' There was no time for further discussion , for [the constable from [Longville]10-longville]2219-the constable from longville came in to conduct [them]1672-everybody before [the magistrate]1138-the magistrate , to give [their]1672-everybody separate evidence concerning the events of the past night . [Bess]48-bess went with [them]1672-everybody , weeping all the way beside [them]1672-everybody , and grieving [Stephen]19-stephen 's heart by [her]48-bess tears , though [she]48-bess dared not speak a word in [the constable]2267-the constable 's presence . But [he]2267-the constable gave [his]2267-the constable testimony gravely and truthfully , and [Tim]33-tim and [Martha]22-martha followed [his]2267-the constable example ; and , in consequence of [their]1672-everybody joint evidence , [Black Thompson]31-black thompson and [Davies]44-davies were fully committed to take [their]1672-everybody trial at the next assizes , and were removed that afternoon to [the county jail]2268-the county jail . [Bess Thompson]48-bess started off on [her]48-bess way to [[her]48-bess desolate home]2269-her desolate home , almost heart - broken , and with such a wrathful resentment against [Stephen]19-stephen , and [Martha]22-martha , and [Tim]33-tim , as seemed to blot out all memory of the lessons [she]48-bess had been learning from [Miss Anne]21-miss anne since [the little child]1824-the little child 's death . [She]48-bess could never bear to go near [them]1672-everybody , or speak to [them]1672-everybody again , since [they]1672-everybody had sworn against [[her]48-bess father]1395-her father ; and had not [he]1395-her father been good to [them]1672-everybody when [Stephen]19-stephen was ill , often sparing [her]48-bess to watch with [Martha]22-martha , as well as helping to make up [his]1395-her father wages ? If this was [their]1672-everybody religion , [she]48-bess did not care to have it ; for [nobody else in]2272-nobody else in [Botfield]23-botfield would have done the same . And now [she]48-bess might as well give up all thoughts of getting to [heaven]226-heaven , where little [Nan]21-miss anne and [[her]21-miss anne baby sister]2274-her baby sister were ; for there would be [nobody]147-nobody to care for [her]48-bess , and [she]48-bess would be obliged to go back to all [her]48-bess old ways . These were [her]48-bess bitter thoughts as [she]48-bess walked homewards alone , for [Stephen]19-stephen was gone up to [[the doctor]942-the doctor 's house]2277-the doctor 's house to inquire after [the master]179-the master and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , and [the others]449-the others were waiting for [him]19-stephen in [Longville]10-longville . [She]48-bess heard [their]449-the others voices after a while coming along [the turnpike road]2280-the turnpike road , and walking quickly as if to overtake [her]48-bess ; so [she]48-bess turned aside into [a field]2281-a field , and hid [herself]48-bess under a hedge that [they]449-the others might pass by . [She]48-bess crouched down low upon the grass , and covered [her]48-bess red and smarting eyes from the sunshine with [her]48-bess shawl , and then [she]48-bess listened for [their]449-the others footsteps to die away in the distance . But [she]48-bess felt an arm stealing round [her]48-bess , and [Martha]22-martha 's voice whispered close in [her]48-bess ear , — '[48-bess] [Bess]48-bess , [dear Bess]1172-dear bess , [thee]48-bess must not hide [thyself]1173-thyself from [us]1174-us . [We]1174-us love [thee]48-bess , [Bess]48-bess ; and [we]1174-us are sore sorry for [thee]48-bess . [Stephen]19-stephen is ever so down - hearted about [thee]48-bess and [[thy]48-bess father]1495-thy father . Oh , [Bess]48-bess , [thee]48-bess must have no spite at [us]1174-us . ' '[48-bess] [Bess]48-bess , ' said [Stephen]19-stephen , '[48-bess] [[thy]48-bess father]1495-thy father owned [I]0-i was telling the truth , and said [he]1495-thy father forgave [me]0-i for speaking agen [him]1495-thy father ; and [he]1495-thy father shook hands with [me]0-i afore [he]1495-thy father went ; and [he]1495-thy father said , " [Stephen]19-stephen , [thee]19-stephen be [a friend to [[my]0-i poor lass]134-my poor lass]1177-a friend to my poor lass ! " and [I]0-i gave [him]1495-thy father a sure promise that [I]0-i would . ' '[0-i] [Nobody'll]1179-nobody'll ever look at [me]0-i now , ' cried [Bess]48-bess ; '[1179-nobody'll] [nobody'll]1179-nobody'll be friends with [me]0-i if [father]1396-father 's transported . ' '[1182-thy] [We]1182-thy 're [[thy]1182-thy friends]2282-thy friends , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen , ' and [thee]1182-thy has [a Father in [heaven]226-heaven that cares for [thee]1182-thy]2283-a father in heaven that cares for thee . Listen , [Bess]48-bess ; it will do [thee]1182-thy good , and [poor old grandfather]2285-poor old grandfather no harm now . [He]2285-poor old grandfather was transported beyond [the seas]143-the seas once ; and [no one]189-no one casts it up to [him]2285-poor old grandfather now , nor to [us]1182-thy ; and have n't [we]1182-thy got [friends]760-friends ? Cheer up , [Bess]48-bess . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne says , maybe this very trouble will bring [[thy]1182-thy father]1495-thy father to repentance . [He]2285-poor old grandfather said [he]2285-poor old grandfather 'd repent some time ; and maybe this will be the very time for [him]2285-poor old grandfather . And [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sends [her]21-miss anne kind love to [thee]1182-thy and [[thy]1182-thy mother]2290-thy mother , and [she]21-miss anne 'll come and see [[thy]1182-thy mother]2290-thy mother as soon as [she]21-miss anne can leave [the master]179-the master . '[19-stephen] Thus comforted , poor sorrowful [Bess]48-bess rose from the ground , and walked on with [them]1183-them to [Botfield]23-botfield . Most of [the house]1347-the house doors were open , and [the women]1185-the women were standing at [them]1183-them in order to waylay [them]1183-them with inquisitive questions ; but [Stephen]19-stephen 's grave and steady face , and the presence of [Bess]48-bess , who walked close beside [him]19-stephen , as if there was shelter and protection there , kept [them]1183-them silent ; and [they]1183-them were compelled to satisfy [their]1183-them curiosity with secondhand reports . [Martha]22-martha went on with [Bess]48-bess to [[her]22-martha own cottage]1186-her own cottage to stay all night with [her]48-bess , and help [her]48-bess to console [[her]22-martha broken - hearted mother]1187-her broken - hearted mother . Though [Martha]22-martha was truly sorry for [[Black Thompson]31-black thompson 's family]1188-black thompson 's family , [she]22-martha felt [her]22-martha importance as one of [the chief witnesses]1189-the chief witnesses against [him]31-black thompson ; especially as [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin was visited , not only by [the gossips of [Botfield]23-botfield]1191-the gossips of botfield , but by [more distinguished persons from all [the farmhouses around]1193-the farmhouses around]1192-more distinguished persons from all the farmhouses around ; and [her]22-martha thrilling narrative of [her]22-martha hazardous journey through [Botfield]23-botfield along [the high road]1194-the high road was listened to with greedy interest . In this foolish talking [she]22-martha lost that true sympathy which [she]22-martha ought to have felt for [poor Bess]48-bess , and forfeited the blessing which would have been given to [her]22-martha own soul . But it was very different with [Stephen]19-stephen in [his]19-stephen lonely work upon [the mountains]74-the mountains . There [he]19-stephen thought over the crimes and punishment of [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , until [his]19-stephen heart was filled with an unutterable pity and fellow - feeling both towards [him]19-stephen and [[his]19-stephen family]1445-his family ; and every night , as [he]19-stephen went [home]125-home from [his]19-stephen labour , [he]19-stephen turned aside to [the cottage]1314-the cottage , to read to [Bess]48-bess and [[her]48-bess mother]1965-her mother some portion of the Scriptures which [he]19-stephen had chosen for [their]1445-his family comfort , out of a pocket Bible given to [him]19-stephen by [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . About a fortnight after these events [Stephen]19-stephen received [a visitor]1200-a visitor upon [the uplands]93-the uplands , where [he]19-stephen was seeking a lamb that had strayed into [a dwarf forest of gorse - bushes]1202-a dwarf forest of gorse - bushes , and was bleating piteously in its bewilderment . A pleasant - sounding voice called ' [Stephen Fern]19-stephen ! '[19-stephen] and when [he]19-stephen got free from the entangling thorns , with the rescued lamb in [his]19-stephen arms , who should be waiting for [him]19-stephen but [the lord of [the manor]293-the manor [himself]19-stephen]490-the lord of the manor himself ! [Stephen]19-stephen knew [his]19-stephen face again in an instant , and dropped the lamb that [he]19-stephen might take off [his]19-stephen old cap , while [the gentleman]1205-the gentleman smiled at [him]19-stephen with a hearty smile . ' [I]1205-the gentleman am [Danesford]55-mr. danesford , of [Danesford]55-mr. danesford , '[1205-the gentleman] [he]1205-the gentleman said gaily ; ' and [I]1205-the gentleman believe [you]19-stephen are [Stephen Fern]19-stephen , of [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow . [I]1205-the gentleman 've brought [you]19-stephen a message , [[my]1205-the gentleman boy]253-my boy . Can [you]19-stephen guess what [young lady]2294-young lady has sent [me]1205-the gentleman over [the hills]82-the hills after [you]19-stephen ? '[1205-the gentleman] ' [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[19-stephen] answered [Stephen]19-stephen promptly . ' No ; there are [other young ladies in [the world]1665-the world]2296-other young ladies in the world beside [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ! '[55-mr. danesford] replied [Mr. Danesford]55-mr. danesford . ' Have [you]19-stephen forgotten [Miss Lockwood]57-miss lockwood ? [She]57-miss lockwood has not forgotten [you]19-stephen ; and [we]2298-we are come [home]125-home ready to give battle to [[your]19-stephen enemies]312-your enemies , and reinstate [you]19-stephen in all [your]19-stephen rights . [She]57-miss lockwood gives [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood and [me]55-mr. danesford no rest until [we]2298-we have got [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow , and everything else , for [you]19-stephen again . '[55-mr. danesford] ' [Sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , and [his]19-stephen eyes filled with tears , ' [nobody]147-nobody can give [me]19-stephen back [little Nan]21-miss anne . '[19-stephen] ' No , '[55-mr. danesford] answered [Mr. Danesford]55-mr. danesford gravely ; ' [I]55-mr. danesford know how hardly [you]19-stephen have been dealt with , [[my]55-mr. danesford boy]253-my boy . Tell [me]55-mr. danesford truly , is [your]19-stephen religion strong enough to enable [you]19-stephen to forgive [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley indeed ? Is it possible that [you]19-stephen can forgive [him]36-mr. wyley from [your]19-stephen heart ? '[55-mr. danesford] [Stephen]19-stephen was silent , looking down at the heath upon which [his]19-stephen feet were pressed , but seeing none of its purple blossoms . It was a question that must not be answered rashly , for even that morning [he]19-stephen had glanced down the fatal shaft with a deep yearning after [little Nan]21-miss anne ; and as [he]19-stephen passed the ruins of [[[his]19-stephen master]190-his master 's house]1207-his master 's house , [his]19-stephen memory had recalled the destruction of [the old hut]1536-the old hut with something of a feeling of triumph . ' [Sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said , looking up to [him]190-his master , ' [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] afraid [I]0-i ca n't explain [myself]0-i . [You]190-his master know it was for [my]0-i sake that [the Lord Jesus]655-the lord jesus was killed , yet [[His]655-the lord jesus Father]1392-his father has forgiven [me]0-i all [my]0-i sins ; and when [I]0-i think of that , [I]0-i can forgive [the master]179-the master even for [little Nan]21-miss anne 's death with all [my]0-i heart . But [I]0-i do n't always remember it ; and then [I]0-i feel a little glad at the fire . [I]0-i have n't got much religion yet . [I]0-i do n't know everything that 's in the Bible . ' '[0-i] Yet [I]0-i could learn some lessons from [you]0-i , [Stephen]19-stephen , ' said [Mr. Danesford]55-mr. danesford , after a pause . '[19-stephen] What do [you]0-i suppose [I]0-i should do if [anybody]1843-anybody tried to take [Danesford Hall]17-danesford hall from [me]0-i ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know , [sir]264-sir , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen . '[0-i] Nor do [I]0-i , ' [he]0-i said , smiling ; '[0-i] at any rate , [they]1843-anybody should not have it with [my]0-i consent . Nor shall [anybody]1843-anybody take [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow from [you]0-i . [I]0-i have been down to [Longville]10-longville about it , but [Mr. Wyley]36-mr. wyley is too ill to see [me]0-i . By the way , [I]0-i told [Miss Anne]21-miss anne [I]0-i was coming up [the hills]82-the hills after [you]0-i . [She]21-miss anne wants to see [you]0-i , [Stephen]19-stephen , as soon as possible after [your]0-i work is done . ' [Mr. Danesford]55-mr. danesford rode on over [the hills]82-the hills , and [Stephen]19-stephen walked some way beside [him]55-mr. danesford , to put [him]55-mr. danesford into [the nearest path for [Danesford]55-mr. danesford]2306-the nearest path for danesford . After [he]55-mr. danesford was gone [he]19-stephen watched earnestly for the evening shadows , and when [they]2307-they stretched far away across [the plains]2308-the plains , [he]19-stephen hastened down to [the cabin]577-the cabin , and then on to [Longville]10-longville , to [his]19-stephen appointed interview with [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . When [the master]179-the master at last consented to leave the sight of [[his]19-stephen old dwelling]2311-his old dwelling burning into blackened heaps , [he]19-stephen seemed to care nothing where [he]19-stephen might be taken . [He]19-stephen was without [a home]2312-a home , and almost without [a friend]1961-a friend . It was not accident merely , but the long - provoked hatred of [[his]19-stephen people]2072-his people , that had driven [him]19-stephen from [the old chambers]2315-the old chambers and the old roof which had sheltered [him]19-stephen for so many years , and where all the habits and memories of [his]19-stephen life centred . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had not been long enough at [Botfield]23-botfield to form friendships on [her]21-miss anne own account , except among [the poor and ignorant people on [[her]21-miss anne uncle]2183-her uncle 's works]2316-the poor and ignorant people on her uncle 's works ; and [she]21-miss anne accepted most thankfully the offer of [the doctor]942-the doctor from [Longville]10-longville to give [them]2316-the poor and ignorant people on her uncle 's works a refuge in [[his]19-stephen house]1858-his house . No sooner had [they]2316-the poor and ignorant people on her uncle 's works arrived [there]1463-there than it was discovered that [the master]179-the master was struck with paralysis , brought on by the shock of the fire , and all the terrifying circumstances attending it . [He]179-the master was carried at once to [a bedroom]2322-a bedroom , and from that time [Miss Anne]21-miss anne had been fully occupied in nursing [him]179-the master . [He]179-the master had seemed to be getting better the last day or two , and [his]179-the master power of speech had returned , though [he]179-the master spoke but rarely ; only following [Miss Anne]21-miss anne 's movements with earnest eyes , and hardly suffering [her]21-miss anne to leave [him]179-the master , even for necessary rest and refreshment . All that afternoon [he]179-the master had been tossing [his]179-the master restless head from side to side , uttering deep , low groans , and murmuring now and then to [himself]179-the master words which [Miss Anne]21-miss anne could not understand . [She]21-miss anne looked white and ill [herself]21-miss anne , as if [her]21-miss anne strength were nearly exhausted ; but after [the doctor]942-the doctor had been in , and , feeling [the master]179-the master 's pulse , shook [his]179-the master head solemnly , [she]21-miss anne would not consent to leave [his]179-the master bedside for any length of time . '[21-miss anne] How long ? ' [she]21-miss anne whispered , going with [the doctor]942-the doctor to the outside of the door . '[21-miss anne] Not more than twenty - four hours , ' was the answer . '[21-miss anne] Will [he]1216-he be conscious all the time ? ' [she]21-miss anne asked again . '[1216-he] [I]0-i can not tell certainly , ' replied [the doctor]942-the doctor , '[1216-he] but most probably not . ' Only twenty - four hours ! One day of swiftly - passing time , and then the eternal future ! One more sun - setting , and one more sun - rising , and then everlasting night , or eternal day ! For a minute [Miss Anne]21-miss anne leaned against the doorway , with a fainting spirit . There was so much to do , and so short a space for doing anything . All the real business of the whole life had to be crowded into these few hours , if possible . As [she]21-miss anne entered [the room]1852-the room , [[her]21-miss anne uncle]2183-her uncle 's eyes met [hers]21-miss anne with a glance of unspeakable anguish , and [he]1113-uncle called [her]21-miss anne in a trembling tone to [her]21-miss anne side . '[1216-he] [I]0-i heard , ' [he]1113-uncle whispered . '[1216-he] [Anne]21-miss anne , what must be done now ? ' '[1216-he] Oh , [uncle]1113-uncle , ' [she]21-miss anne said , '[1216-he] have [I]0-i not told [you]1113-uncle often , that " [Christ Jesus]1218-christ jesus came into [the world]1665-the world to save [sinners]650-sinners " ? There is no limit with [God]26-god ; with [him]26-god one day is as a thousand years , and [He]26-god gives [you]21-miss anne still a day to make [your]21-miss anne peace with [Him]26-god . ' '[26-god] There is no peace for [my]0-i soul with [God]26-god , ' [he]0-i answered ; '[0-i] [I]0-i 've been at enmity with [Him]26-god all [my]0-i life ; and will [He]26-god receive [me]0-i at the last moment ? [He]26-god is too just , too righteous , [Anne]21-miss anne . [I]0-i 'll not insult [Him]26-god by offering [Him]26-god [my]0-i soul now . [You]1221-you asked [me]0-i once , " What shall it profit [a man]1421-a man if [he]1421-a man shall gain [the whole world]1223-the whole world , and lose [his]1421-a man own soul ? " [Mine]0-i is lost — lost , and that without remedy . This gold is a millstone about [my]0-i neck . ' '[1224-uncle] [Uncle]1224-uncle , ' [she]1221-you said , commanding [her]1221-you voice with a great effort , '[1224-uncle] [the thief upon the cross]1225-the thief upon the cross beside [[our]1226-our Lord]2076-our lord had a shorter time than [you]1224-uncle , for [he]1225-the thief upon the cross was to die at sunset that day ; yet [he]1225-the thief upon the cross repented and believed in [the crucified Saviour , who was able to pardon [him]1225-the thief upon the cross]1228-the crucified saviour , who was able to pardon him . [Christ]39-christ is still waiting to forgive ; [He]39-christ is stretching out [His]39-christ arms to receive [you]1224-uncle . Only look at [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross with the same penitence and faith that [the dying thief]1229-the dying thief felt . ' '[1225-the thief upon the cross] Nay , ' groaned [the dying man]2329-the dying man , '[1225-the thief upon the cross] [he]1225-the thief upon the cross could show [his]1225-the thief upon the cross faith by confessing [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross before [all those who were crucifying the Lord]1230-all those who were crucifying the lord , and it was a glory to [the Saviour]58-the saviour to forgive [him]1225-the thief upon the cross then . But what glory would it be to pardon [me]0-i on this death - bed , where [I]0-i can do nothing for [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross ? No ; [I]0-i can do nothing — nothing ! All these years [I]0-i could have worked for [God]26-god ; but now [I]0-i can do nothing ! ' '[1231-uncle] [Uncle]1231-uncle , ' said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[1231-uncle] [[our]1232-we Lord]2076-our lord was asked by [some]1234-some , " What shall [we]1232-we do , that [we]1232-we might work the works of [God]26-god ? " and [He]1231-uncle answered [them]1234-some , " This is the work of [God]26-god , that [ye]1234-some believe on [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross whom [He]1225-the thief upon the cross hath sent . " Oh , that is all ! Believe on [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross , and [He]1225-the thief upon the cross will forgive [you]1234-some ; and [all the angels in [heaven]226-heaven]1235-all the angels in heaven will glorify [Him]1225-the thief upon the cross for [His]1225-the thief upon the cross mercy . ' '[21-miss anne] [Anne]21-miss anne , ' [he]0-i answered , fixing on [her]21-miss anne a look of despair , '[21-miss anne] [I]0-i can not . [My]0-i heart is hard and heavy ; [I]0-i remember when it used to feel and care about these things ; but it is dead now , and [my]0-i soul is lost for ever . [Anne]21-miss anne , even if [Jesus]39-christ is willing to pardon [me]0-i , [I]0-i can not believe in forgiveness . ' [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sank down by the bedside , unable to answer [him]0-i , save by a prayer , half aloud , to [God]26-god for [His]26-god mercy to be shown to [him]0-i , if it were possible ! [He]0-i lay there , helpless and hopeless , tossing to and fro upon the pillows . At last [he]0-i spoke again , in a sharp , clear , energetic tone . '[21-miss anne] [Anne]21-miss anne , be quick ! ' [he]0-i said ; '[21-miss anne] find [me]0-i [my]0-i will among those papers . Perhaps if [I]0-i could do something , [I]0-i might be able to believe . ' [He]0-i watched [her]21-miss anne with impatient eagerness as [she]21-miss anne turned over the precious parcel of papers which [he]0-i had rescued from the fire . There were many documents and writings belonging to the property [he]0-i had gathered together , and it was some time before [she]21-miss anne could find the will . [The master]179-the master tried to take it from [her]21-miss anne , but in vain ; [his]0-i right hand was powerless . '[21-miss anne] Oh , [I]0-i forgot ! ' [he]0-i cried despairingly ; '[21-miss anne] this hand is useless , and [I]0-i can not alter it now . [God]26-god will not let [me]0-i undo the mischief [I]0-i have done . [Anne]21-miss anne , [I]0-i have left [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow away from [you]21-miss anne to [[my]0-i brother]615-my brother [Thomas]36-mr. wyley , lest [you]21-miss anne should restore it to [Stephen]19-stephen ; and now [I]0-i can do nothing ! Oh , misery , misery ! The robbery and murder of [the fatherless children]1238-the fatherless children rest upon [my]0-i soul . Send quickly , [Anne]21-miss anne , send for [Stephen Fern]19-stephen . ' [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sent [a messenger]2331-a messenger to hasten [Stephen]19-stephen ; and after that [the master]179-the master lay perfectly still , with closed eyes , as if [he]179-the master were treasuring up the little strength remaining to [him]179-the master . The last sunset was over , and the night - lamp was lighted once more ; while [Miss Anne]21-miss anne sat beside [him]179-the master watching , in an agony of prayer to [God]26-god . There was no sound to be heard , for [every one in [the house]1347-the house]2333-every one in the house knew that [the old man]1403-the old man was dying , and [they]2333-every one in the house kept a profound quietness throughout all [the rooms]2336-the rooms . [He]179-the master had taken no notice of anything since [he]179-the master asked for [Stephen]19-stephen ; but when a light rap was heard at the door [he]179-the master opened [his]179-the master eyes , and turned [his]179-the master grey head round anxiously to see whether [he]179-the master was come . It was [Stephen]19-stephen . [He]19-stephen stood within the doorway , not liking to enter farther , but looking straight forward at [the master]179-the master with a very pale and sorrowful face , upon which there was no trace of triumph or hatred . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne gazed earnestly at [him]19-stephen , but [she]21-miss anne did not speak ; [she]21-miss anne would not place [herself]21-miss anne between [him]19-stephen and [[his]19-stephen dying enemy]2338-his dying enemy now . '[19-stephen] Come here , [Stephen]19-stephen , ' said [the master]179-the master , in a voice of hopeless agony . '[19-stephen] When [little Nan]21-miss anne was lying dead , [you]19-stephen said [you]19-stephen would wait , and see what [God]26-god could do to [me]0-i . Come near , and hear , and see . Death is nothing , [boy]1842-boy ; it will be only a glory to [you]19-stephen to die . But [God]26-god is letting loose [His]26-god terrors upon [me]0-i ; [He]26-god is mocking at [my]0-i soul , and laughing at [my]0-i calamity . Soon , soon [I]0-i shall be in eternity , without hope , and without [God]26-god . ' '[251-master] Oh , [master]251-master , [master]251-master , ' exclaimed [Stephen]19-stephen , '[251-master] there is a time yet for [[our]1242-our Father]199-our father to forgive [thee]19-stephen ! It does n't take long to forgive ! It did n't take even [me]0-i long to forgive ; and oh , how quickly [God]26-god can do it if [you]251-master 'll only ask [Him]26-god ! ' '[251-master] Do [you]251-master forgive [me]0-i ? ' asked [the master]179-the master , in astonishment . '[251-master] Ah , ' [he]0-i cried , '[251-master] [I]0-i forgave [thee]19-stephen long since , directly after [I]0-i was ill . It was [God]26-god who helped [me]0-i ; and would n't [He]26-god rather forgive [thee]19-stephen [Himself]26-god ? Oh , [He]26-god loves [thee]19-stephen ! [He]26-god taught [me]0-i how to love [thee]19-stephen ; and could [He]26-god do that if [He]26-god did n't love [thee]19-stephen [His]26-god own self ? ' '[26-god] If [I]0-i could only believe in being forgiven ! ' said [the dying man]2329-the dying man . '[0-i] Oh , believe it , [dear master]1244-dear master ! See , [I]0-i am here ; [I]0-i have forgiven [thee]19-stephen , and [I]0-i do love [thee]19-stephen . [Little Nan]21-miss anne can never come back , and yet [I]0-i love [thee]19-stephen , and forgive [thee]19-stephen from [my]0-i very heart . Will not [Jesus]39-christ much more forgive [thee]19-stephen ? ' '[19-stephen] Pray for [me]0-i , [Stephen]19-stephen . Kneel down there , and pray aloud , ' [he]0-i said ; and [his]0-i eyelids closed feebly , and [his]0-i restless head lay still , as if [he]0-i had no more power to move it . '[0-i] [I]0-i can not , ' answered [Stephen]19-stephen ; '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm only [a poor lad]2342-a poor lad , and [I]179-the master do n't know how to do it up loud . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne will pray for [thee]19-stephen . '[179-the master] ' If [you]19-stephen have forgiven [me]179-the master , pray to [God]26-god for [me]179-the master , '[179-the master] murmured [the master]179-the master , opening [his]179-the master eyes again with a look of deep entreaty . Over [Stephen]19-stephen 's pale face a smile was kindling , a smile of pure , intense love and faith , and the light in [his]19-stephen pitying eyes met [the master]179-the master 's dying gaze with a gleam of strengthening hope . [He]19-stephen clasped the cold hand in both [his]19-stephen own , and , kneeling down beside [him]179-the master , [he]19-stephen prayed from [his]19-stephen very soul , ' [Lord]2343-lord , lay not this sin to [his]19-stephen charge . '[19-stephen] [He]19-stephen could say no more ; and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , who knelt by [him]19-stephen , was silent , except that one sob burst from [her]21-miss anne lips . [The master]179-the master stirred no more , but lay still , with [his]179-the master numb and paralyzed hand in [Stephen]19-stephen 's clasp ; but in a few minutes [he]179-the master uttered these words , in a tone of mingled entreaty and assertion , ' God be merciful to [me]179-the master [a sinner]2344-a sinner ! '[179-the master] That was all . An hour or two afterwards it was known throughout [Longville]10-longville , and the news was on the way to [Botfield]23-botfield , that [the master of [Botfield]23-botfield works]1248-the master of botfield works was dead . Three months later in the year , when [the new house at [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow]1249-the new house at fern 's hollow was quite finished , with [its]1249-the new house at fern 's hollow dairy and [coal - shed]1250-coal - shed , and [a stable]1251-a stable put up at [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood 's desire , [a large party assembled within the walls]1252-a large party assembled within the walls . [Martha]22-martha had been diligently occupied all the week in a grand cleaning down ; and [Tim]33-tim and [Stephen]19-stephen had been equally busy in clearing away the litter left by [the builders]1253-the builders , and in restoring [the garden]1350-the garden to some order . [They]1253-the builders had been obliged to contrive some temporary seats for [[their]1253-the builders visitors]1255-their visitors , for the old furniture had not yet been brought up from [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin ; and the only painful thoughts [Martha]22-martha had were the misgiving of its extreme scantiness in [[their]1253-the builders house with [six rooms]1258-six rooms]1257-their house with six rooms . [The pasture before [the cottage]1314-the cottage]1259-the pasture before the cottage was now securely enclosed , and the wild ponies neighed over the hedge in vain at the sight of the clear , cool pool where [they]1253-the builders had been used to quench [their]1253-the builders thirst ; and behind [the house]1347-the house there was a plantation of tiny fir - trees bending to and fro in the wind , which [they]1253-the builders were to resist as [they]1253-the builders grew larger . [Every place]1262-every place was in perfect order ; and [the front room]1263-the front room , which was almost grand enough for [a parlour]1264-a parlour , was beautifully decorated with flowers in honour of [the expected guests]1265-the expected guests , who had sent word that [they]1265-the expected guests should visit [Fern 's Hollow]2-fern 's hollow that afternoon . [They]1265-the expected guests could be seen far away from the window of [the upper storey]1266-the upper storey , which , rising above [the brow of [the hill behind]1268-the hill behind , commanded a wide view of [the mountain plains]1269-the mountain plains]1267-the brow of the hill behind , commanded a wide view of the mountain plains . [They]1265-the expected guests were coming on horseback across [the almost pathless uplands]1270-the almost pathless uplands ; dear [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , with [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood riding beside [her]21-miss anne ; and a little way behind [them]1265-the expected guests [the lord of [the manor]293-the manor]94-the lord of the manor and [[his]94-the lord of the manor young wife , who was no other than [Miss Lockwood]57-miss lockwood [herself]57-miss lockwood]1273-his young wife , who was no other than miss lockwood herself . [They]1265-the expected guests greeted [Stephen]19-stephen and [Martha]22-martha with many smiles and words of congratulation ; and when [they]1265-the expected guests were seated in [the decorated room]1274-the decorated room , with the door and window opened upon the beautiful landscape , [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood bade [them]1265-the expected guests come and sit down with [them]1265-the expected guests ; while [Tim]33-tim helped [the groom]1275-the groom to put up the horses in [the stable]1276-the stable . ' [[My]49-mr. lockwood boy]253-my boy , '[49-mr. lockwood] said [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood , ' [our]1265-the expected guests business is finished at last . [Mr. Thomas Wyley]36-mr. wyley will not try [his]36-mr. wyley right to [Fern]22-martha 's Hollow by law ; but [we]1265-the expected guests have agreed to give [him]36-mr. wyley the £ 15 paid to [[your]253-my boy grandfather]256-your grandfather , and also to pay to [him]36-mr. wyley all the actual cost of the work done [here]146-here . [Miss Anne]21-miss anne and [I]49-mr. lockwood have had a quarrel on the subject , but [she]21-miss anne consents that [I]49-mr. lockwood shall pay that as a mark of [my]49-mr. lockwood esteem for [you]253-my boy , and [[my]49-mr. lockwood old servant [[your]253-my boy mother]166-your mother]2348-my old servant your mother . [Mr. Danesford]55-mr. danesford intends to make a gift to [you]253-my boy of [the pasture]2350-the pasture and [plantation]2351-plantation , which were an encroachment upon [the manor]293-the manor . And now [I]49-mr. lockwood want [you]253-my boy to take [my]49-mr. lockwood advice into the bargain . [Jackson]56-jackson wants to come [here]146-here , and offers a rent of £ 20 a year for [the place]177-the place . Will [you]253-my boy let [him]56-jackson have [it]177-the place till [you]253-my boy are old enough to manage [it]177-the place properly [yourself]253-my boy , [Stephen]19-stephen ? '[49-mr. lockwood] ' Yes , if [you]49-mr. lockwood please , [sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] replied [Stephen]19-stephen , in some perplexity ; for [he]19-stephen and [Martha]22-martha had quite concluded that , [they]1277-they should come and live [there]1463-there again [themselves]1277-they . ' [Jackson]56-jackson will make [a tidy little farm]2356-a tidy little farm of [it]177-the place for [you]253-my boy , '[49-mr. lockwood] continued [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood . ' [[My]49-mr. lockwood daughter]681-my daughter proposes taking [Martha]22-martha into [her]681-my daughter service , and putting [her]22-martha into the way of learning dairy - work , and many other things of which [she]22-martha is now ignorant . Are [you]22-martha willing , [Martha]22-martha ? '[49-mr. lockwood] ' Oh yes , [sir]264-sir ! '[22-martha] said [Martha]22-martha , with a look of admiration at [young Mrs. Danesford]59-young mrs. danesford . ' In this case , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[49-mr. lockwood] [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood went on , ' [you]19-stephen will have a yearly income of £ 20 , and [we]2359-we would like to hear what [you]19-stephen will do with it ? '[49-mr. lockwood] ' There 's [grandfather]1397-grandfather , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen diffidently . ' Right , [[my]49-mr. lockwood boy]253-my boy ! '[49-mr. lockwood] cried [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood , with a smile of satisfaction ; ' well , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne thinks [he]1397-grandfather would be very comfortable with [Mrs. Thompson]60-mrs. thompson , and [she]21-miss anne would be glad of a little money with [him]1397-grandfather . But [he]1397-grandfather can not live much longer , [Stephen]19-stephen ; [he]1397-grandfather is very aged , and [the doctor]942-the doctor thinks [he]1397-grandfather will hardly get over the autumn . So [we]2359-we had better settle what shall be done after [grandfather]1397-grandfather is gone . '[49-mr. lockwood] ' [Sir]264-sir , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , ' [I]49-mr. lockwood think [Martha]22-martha should have some good of [grandmother]1426-grandmother 's work , if [she]22-martha is only [a girl]1391-a girl . ' Every face in [the room]1852-the room glowed with approbation of [Stephen]19-stephen 's suggestion ; and [Martha]22-martha flushed crimson at the very thought of possessing so much money ; and visions of future greatness , more than [[her]22-martha grandmother]2368-her grandmother had foreseen , passed before [her]22-martha mind . '[0-i] Why , [Martha]22-martha will be quite [an heiress]1280-an heiress ! ' said [Mr. Lockwood]49-mr. lockwood . '[1280-an heiress] So [she]22-martha is provided for , and [grandfather]1397-grandfather . And what do [you]0-i intend to do with [yourself]0-i , [Stephen]19-stephen , till [you]19-stephen come back here ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i 'm strong enough to go back to [the pit]1478-the pit , '[19-stephen] replied [Stephen]19-stephen bravely , though inwardly [he]19-stephen shrank from it ; but how else could the rent of [Fern]19-stephen 's Hollow be laid by for [Martha]22-martha ? ' Now [Miss Anne]21-miss anne has raised the wages , [I]21-miss anne should get eight shillings a week , and more as [I]21-miss anne grow older . [I]21-miss anne shall do for [myself]21-miss anne very nicely , thank [you]0-i , [sir]264-sir ; and maybe [I]21-miss anne could lodge with [grandfather]1397-grandfather at [Mrs. Thompson]60-mrs. thompson 's . '[21-miss anne] ' No , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , in [her]21-miss anne gentle voice , the sweetest voice in [the world]1665-the world to [Stephen]19-stephen , now [little Nan]21-miss anne 's was silent ; ' [Stephen]19-stephen is [[my]21-miss anne dear friend]2372-my dear friend , and [he]19-stephen must let [me]21-miss anne act the part of [a friend towards [him]19-stephen]2373-a friend towards him . [He]19-stephen shall attend a good school for a few hours daily , to gain a fitting education ; and then what [servant]2379-servant could [I]21-miss anne find more faithful , more true , and more loving than [[my]21-miss anne dear friend]2372-my dear friend [Stephen]19-stephen ? '[94-the lord of the manor] [They]1286-they went out then across [the uplands]93-the uplands , a sunny ramble , to [all [Stephen]19-stephen 's favourite places]1288-all stephen 's favourite places . And it happened that when [they]1286-they reached the solitary yew - tree near which [Snip]29-snip was buried , [all the rest]1289-all the rest strolled on , and left [Stephen]19-stephen and [Miss Anne]21-miss anne alone . Before [them]1286-they , down at [the foot of [the mountains]74-the mountains]1377-the foot of the mountains , there stretched [a wide plain]1292-a wide plain many miles across , beautiful with [woods and streams]1293-woods and streams ; and on the far horizon there hung a light cloud that was always to be seen there , the index of those great works where [Stephen]19-stephen was to dwell for some years . Near to [them]1286-they [they]1286-they could discern , in the clear atmosphere , the spires and towers of [the county town]1294-the county town , where [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , who had tempted [him]19-stephen on [these hills]978-these hills , was now imprisoned for many years ; and below , though hidden from [their]1286-they sight , was [Botfield]23-botfield and [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin . [A band of [bilberry - gatherers]1298-bilberry - gatherers]1297-a band of bilberry - gatherers was coming down [the hill]1336-the hill with songs and shouts of laughter ; and the frightened flocks of sheep stood motionless on [the hillocks]1300-the hillocks , ready to flee away in a moment at [their]1286-they approach . Both [Miss Anne]21-miss anne and [Stephen]19-stephen felt [a crowd of thoughts]1301-a crowd of thoughts , sorrowful and happy , come thronging to [their]1286-they minds . ' [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne solemnly , ' [[our]1286-they Lord]2076-our lord says , " When [ye]19-stephen shall have done all those things which are commanded [you]19-stephen , say , [We]1286-they are [unprofitable servants]2390-unprofitable servants : [we]1286-they have done that which was [our]1286-they duty to do . " '[21-miss anne] ' Yes , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , '[19-stephen] said [Stephen]19-stephen , looking up inquiringly into [[his]19-stephen teacher]951-his teacher 's face . ' [[My]21-miss anne dear boy]2001-my dear boy , '[21-miss anne] [she]21-miss anne continued , ' are [you]19-stephen taking care to say to [yourself]19-stephen , " [I]21-miss anne am [an unprofitable servant]2392-an unprofitable servant " ? '[21-miss anne] ' [I]19-stephen have not done all those things which are commanded [me]19-stephen , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said simply and earnestly ; ' [I]19-stephen 've done nothing of [myself]19-stephen yet . It 's [you]951-his teacher that have taught [me]19-stephen , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne ; and [God]26-god has helped [me]19-stephen to learn . [I]19-stephen 'm[19-stephen] afeared partly of going away to [Netley]18-netley ; but if [you]951-his teacher 're not there to keep [me]21-miss anne right , [God]26-god is everywhere . '[21-miss anne] ' [Stephen]19-stephen , '[21-miss anne] [Miss Anne]21-miss anne said , ' [you]19-stephen have forgiven all [[your]19-stephen enemies]312-your enemies : [[Tim]33-tim , who is now [[your]19-stephen friend]345-your friend , and [the gamekeeper]1557-the gamekeeper , [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , and [[my]21-miss anne poor uncle]2397-my poor uncle]2394-tim , who is now your friend , and the gamekeeper , black thompson , and my poor uncle ; when [you]19-stephen are saying [the Lord]2003-the lord 's Prayer , do [you]19-stephen feel as if [you]19-stephen should be satisfied for [[our]2399-our Father]199-our father to forgive [you]19-stephen [your]19-stephen trespasses in the same measure and in the same manner as [you]19-stephen have forgiven [their]312-your enemies trespasses against [you]19-stephen ? '[21-miss anne] ' Oh no ! '[19-stephen] cried [Stephen]19-stephen , in a tone of some alarm . ' Tell [me]19-stephen why not . '[19-stephen] ' It was a rather hard thing for [me]19-stephen , '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen said ; ' it was very hard at first , and [I]19-stephen had to be persuaded to it ; and every now and then [I]19-stephen felt as if [I]19-stephen 'd take the forgiveness back . [I]19-stephen should n't like to feel as if [[our]2399-our Father]199-our father found it a hard thing , or repented of it afterwards . '[19-stephen] ' No , '[21-miss anne] answered [Miss Anne]21-miss anne . ' [He]199-our father is [a God " ready to pardon]2402-a god " ready to pardon ; " and when [He]199-our father has bestowed forgiveness , [His]199-our father " gifts and calling are without repentance . " But there is something more , [Stephen]19-stephen . Do [you]19-stephen not seem in [your]19-stephen own mind to know [them]312-your enemies , and remember [them]312-your enemies most , by [their]312-your enemies unkindness and sins towards [you]19-stephen ? When [you]19-stephen think of [Black Thompson]31-black thompson , is it not more as one who has been [[your]19-stephen enemy]347-your enemy than [one whom [you]19-stephen love without any remembrance of [his]31-black thompson faults]2404-one whom you love without any remembrance of his faults ? And [you]19-stephen recollect [[my]19-stephen uncle]338-my uncle as [[him]338-my uncle who drove [you]19-stephen away from [[your]19-stephen own home]2407-your own home , and was the cause of [little Nan]21-miss anne 's death]2406-him who drove you away from your own home , and was the cause of little nan 's death . [Their]312-your enemies offences are forgiven fully , but not forgotten . '[19-stephen] ' Can [I]19-stephen forget ? '[19-stephen] murmured [Stephen]19-stephen . ' No , '[1303-she] [she]1303-she replied ; ' but do [you]19-stephen not see that [we]2408-our clothe [[our]2408-our enemies]223-our enemies with [their]312-your enemies faults against [us]2408-our ? Should [[our]2408-our Father]199-our father do so , should [we]2408-our stand before [Him]199-our father bearing in [His]199-our father sight all [our]2408-our sins , would that forgiveness content [us]2408-our , [Stephen]19-stephen ? '[1303-she] ' Oh no ! '[19-stephen] [he]19-stephen cried again . ' Tell [me]19-stephen , [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , what will [He]199-our father do for [me]19-stephen besides forgiving [me]19-stephen ? '[19-stephen] ' Look , [Stephen]19-stephen , '[1304-i] [she]1304-i replied , pointing to the distant sky where the sun was going down amid purple clouds , and bidding [him]19-stephen turn to the grey horizon where the sun had risen in the morning ; ' listen : " As far as [the east]2411-the east is from [the west]2412-the west , so far hath [He]199-our father removed [our]2408-our transgressions from [us]2408-our . " And again : " [He]199-our father will turn again , [He]199-our father will have compassion upon [us]2408-our ; [He]199-our father will subdue [our]2408-our iniquities ; and [Thou]2413-thou wilt cast all [their]2408-our sins into the depths of [the sea]2414-the sea . " And again : " For [I]1304-i will be merciful to [their]2408-our unrighteousness , and [their]2408-our sins and [their]2408-our iniquities will [I]1304-i remember no more . " This is the forgiveness of [[our]2408-our Father]199-our father , [Stephen]19-stephen . '[1304-i] ' Oh , how different to [mine]19-stephen ! '[19-stephen] cried [Stephen]19-stephen , hiding [his]19-stephen face in [his]19-stephen hands . ' Yet , '[21-miss anne] said [Miss Anne]21-miss anne , ' [you]19-stephen may claim the promise made to [us]2408-our by [[our]2408-our Lord]2076-our lord : " If [ye]19-stephen forgive [men]1482-men [their]1482-men trespasses , [[your]19-stephen heavenly Father]2418-your heavenly father will also forgive [you]19-stephen , " in a far richer measure , with infinite long - suffering , and a multitude of tender mercies . '[21-miss anne] ' [Lord]2419-lord , forgive [me]19-stephen , for [Jesus Christ]39-christ 's sake ! '[19-stephen] murmured [Stephen]19-stephen . But the dusk was gathering , and [the others]449-the others were returning to [them]449-the others under the old yew - tree , for there was the long ride over [the hills to [Danesford]5-danesford]1306-the hills to danesford , and the time for parting was come . The day was done ; and on the morrow new work must be entered upon . The path of the commandments had yet to be trodden , step by step , through temptation and conflict , and weakness and weariness , until the end was reached . [Stephen]19-stephen felt something of this as [he]19-stephen walked [home]125-home for the last time to [the cinder - hill cabin]560-the cinder - hill cabin ; and , taking down the old Bible covered with green baize , read aloud to [[his]19-stephen grandfather]1405-his grandfather and [Martha]22-martha the chapter [[his]19-stephen father]1392-his father had taught [him]19-stephen on [his]1392-his father death - bed ; bending [his]19-stephen head in deep and humble prayer after [he]19-stephen had read the last verse : ' Be [ye]2420-ye therefore perfect , even as [[your]2420-ye Father]248-your father in [heaven]226-heaven is perfect . '[19-stephen]
